name: Brannin McBee
title: Founder & CDO @ CoreWeave | Capital Markets
about:
As the co-founder and CSO of CoreWeave, Inc., I leverage my expertise in cloud computing and data analysis to deliver specialized and scalable solutions for compute-intensive use cases. With over 6 years of experience in building and leading CoreWeave, I have grown the company to become one of the largest independent GPU cloud providers in the world, serving clients across various industries such as VFX, AI, gaming, and healthcare.

Prior to founding CoreWeave, I was a successful proprietary trader in the energy and agriculture markets, where I applied my analytical and quantitative skills to generate profitable strategies and manage risk. I also have a background in energy research and consulting, where I published several papers on the environmental and economic impacts of wind power. I am passionate about using technology to solve complex problems and create value for society.
education_1_school: University of Colorado Boulder - Leeds School of Business
notable_achievements: Helped grow CoreWeave Inc. into a leading AI cloud-computing provider with a 300% stock surge post-IPO
reasoning: Brannin McBee qualifies as a Growth-Stage Entrepreneur (L5) based on CoreWeave's significant success and scale. The company has become one of the largest independent GPU cloud providers globally, with substantial funding and growth. In December 2023, CoreWeave raised $2.3B in debt financing, following a $221M Series B round earlier in 2023, valuing the company at $2B+. The company's rapid scaling, major enterprise clients, and significant market position in GPU cloud infrastructure demonstrate proven execution at scale. His prior experience as a proprietary trader shows relevant analytical and risk management skills, though the L5 classification is primarily based on CoreWeave's achievements.

name: Michael Intrator
title: Chief Executive Officer at CoreWeave
about: Michael Intrator, Chief Executive Officer of CoreWeave Inc., is responsible for all aspects of the firm’s operations. Prior to CoreWeave, Intrator was a Co-Founder and CEO of Hudson Ridge Asset Management. Hudson Ridge was a fundamental, systematic natural gas hedge fund. Intrator served as a Principal Portfolio Manager for Natsource Asset Management LLC, which combined with its subsidiaries had over $1.2 billion in assets under management and commitments at its peak. name: Rebeca Minguela
title: Founder & CEO Clarity AI
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Rebeca is Founder of Clarity, which tries to solve the problem of inefficient and unequal allocation of capital by developing a universal framework and building an automated tool to rate companies, projects, governments and NGOs.

Previously, she was defining and leading the Global Digital Transformation Program at Santander Bank (one of the largest banks in the World). 

Rebeca was Founder & CEO of Blink Booking, the award winning last minute hotel booking mobile app leader in Europe, with more than 800,000 downloads, almost 3,000 hotels, available in 6 languages. Rebeca and Blink Booking have been featured widely in the press in several countries with features in publications including Forbes, The Economist, Financial Times, The Sun, The Daily Mirror, El Pais, El Mundo, Il Sole 24 Ore, and many others. 

Blink was acquired by Groupon in Sept 2013, less than 1 and a half years after having launched the product. After the acquisition, Rebeca worked at Groupon, where she was Senior Director of Product and Operations and General Manager, leading one of the top priorities of the company. 

She is also advisor at several startups, mostly focusing on early stage startup with huge potential to make a significant impact.

Prior to Blink, Rebeca worked as Sr Associate at Bain Capital Private Equity, management consultant at Boston Consulting Group and as engineer at German Aerospace Agency, Siemens and IBM. She holds an MBA from Harvard Business School, MSc in Telecommunication Engineering for Polytechnic University in Madrid and Stuttgart University (all of them with Distinction).


Key Words: entrepreneurship, mobile app, investing, early stage technology, mobile product, venture-backed, java, Objective C, native iOS, Android, iPhone, iPad, tablet, mobile, algorithm, data structure, design pattern, e-commerce, large scalable distributed software solutions, systems, operations, IT, testing, QA, travel, mobile UX/ UI

Chatter-box, clown, task-juggler.

name: Mariana Matus
title: CEO and Cofounder at Biobot Analytics
about:
Mariana is CEO and Cofounder of Biobot Analytics, the first company in the world to bring wastewater epidemiology to market. Biobot uses cutting-edge technology to transform sewers into public health observatories, effectively using wastewater data to evaluate and improve the health of communities. 

She holds a Masters degree in Biotechnology from Wageningen University. She received her PhD from the department of Biological Engineering at MIT in Computational Biology, where she specialized in the emerging field of wastewater epidemiology. In addition to her doctoral studies, Mariana cofounded the MIT Underworlds Smart Sewers Project, leading the vision and funding for an interdisciplinary research project with collaborators from MIT’s Department of Urban Studies and Planning. This work led to the creation of Biobot Analytics, and set the scientific foundation for Biobot’s wastewater intelligence platform.

In 2025, Mariana joined the Board of Directors of Asbury Communities Inc. - an innovative non-profit organization in the top 20 nationwide leading the market of senior living services and technology.

Mariana has been recognized for her leadership and entrepreneurial excellence through several awards. In 2020, she was named to the C&EN Trailblazing Women in Chemistry. She made Newsweek’s list of America’s 50 Greatest Disruptors in 2021, and their list of America’s 50 Enterprising Idealists in 2022. Boston Globe named Dr. Matus #8 on their inaugural 50 Tech Power Players list for 2022, and TIME100 NEXT recognized her as a 2022 industry innovator. Most recently, she was named a 2023 Henry Crown Fellow within the Aspen Global Leadership Network at the Aspen Institute, and a 2024 GreenHouse Fellow by the Clinton Global Initiative.
education_2_degree: Doctor of Philosophy (PhD), Computational and Systems Biology
awards_and_recognitions: CNBC Disruptor 50 (2022); Time Magazine TIME100 Most Influential Companies (2022); C&EN’s Trailblazing Women in Chemistry (2020); Newsweek’s America’s 50 Greatest Disruptors (2021); Boston Globe’s #8 Tech Power Player (2022); TIME100 NEXT Industry Innovator (2022); Aspen Institute Henry Crown Fellowship (2023); Barry M. name: Darin Feinstein
title: Founder Core Scientific NASDAQ $CORZ. Blackstar Investments.
about:
Darin Feinstein is an entrepreneur, venture capitalist and philanthropist.

Mr. Feinstein founded, Core Scientific, a publicly traded NASDAQ company that specializes in building enterprise grade and build-to-suit data centers for AI/HPC and Bitcoin ASICs ($CORZ). Mr. Feinstein has been featured regularly on MSNBC, Bloomberg, Coindesk and others to discuss the energy footprint of the data center industry, AI infrastructure, and the the accounting innovation related to The Bitcoin Network.

Today Mr. Feinstein invests in a variety of industries through his boutique investment banking company Blackstar which has a focus on opportunities in AI and infrastructure.

Mr. Feinstein founded El Dorado Cantina and The Cantina in 2014. These are organic, seed oil free and GMO free Mexican Restaurants awarded the 26th top restaurant in the United States from Yelp. The Cantina also offers gaming where Mr. Feinstein holds a gaming license.

Mr. Feinstein also founded Red Mercury Entertainment which actively invests, produces or lends money to a variety of shows and residencies in Las Vegas including J LO, Lionel Richee, Backstreet Boys, Gwen Stefani, Aerosmith, Lady Gaga, Don Henley, and shows including MJ Live, Purple Reign, Chris Angel and others.

Giving back to the community in which he lives and works has been a focus of Feinstein’s philanthropic efforts. After founding https://feinsteingriffinfoundation.com/ over a decade ago, Mr. Feinstein and Eddie Griffin through their foundation provide support to several organizations including The Shade Tree, Keep Memory Alive and Lou Ruvo Center for Brain Health, at Cleveland Clinic Nevada, SafeNest, Noah's Animal House, and Las Vegas area hospitals, among many others.

Mr. Feinstein is a licensed attorney, and former accountant.
speaking_engagements: Featured on Bloomberg, MSNBC, CNBC, Coindesk discussing blockchain, Bitcoin, and related technology; Co-Chairman and Chief Vision Officer at Core Scientific focusing on education and lobbying efforts for the industry
notable_achievements: Founded Core Scientific, a NASDAQ publicly traded company specializing in AI, HPC, and Bitcoin infrastructure; Founded Black Star Investments, a diversified investment and business management company; Produced over 10,000 live shows across the Western United States; Founder of award-winning El Dorado Cantina organic Mexican restaurant; Featured on Bloomberg, MSNBC, CNBC, and Coindesk discussing blockchain and Bitcoin technology

about:
I am fascinated by the potential for artificial intelligence to transform all aspects of our lives. 

I am currently Chief Strategy Officer at Allstora, RuPaul's online book shop. Allstora seeks to uplift marginalized voices and contribute to economic justice for storyetellers by paying authors twice as much as they earn at other leading bookstores.  

I was founding CEO of Rain, a company building artificial brains - integrated hardware-software platforms for radically cheaper artificial intelligence. We implement cutting edge research in new hardware substrates and AI training algorithms to close the cost gap between artificial intelligence and biological intelligence.

I previously worked for several years in political campaigning and non-profit. During this time, I managed the largest field office for a highly contested congressional election in 2010, and was a key member of the team that helped elect Florida's first openly LGBT state representative in 2012.

name: Brennand Pierce
title: Building Kinisi Robotics: Practical humanoids for today's problems
about:
At Kinisi, we don't sell science fiction. We build robots that actually get work done. By equipping practical, wheeled-base humanoids with the latest LLM intelligence, we make them adaptable to any problem in any warehouse. Unlike wobbly bipeds, our bots are smart, speedy, scalable, and safe to work alongside humans so we can solve today's labor shortages. I've shipped over 25,000 robots at my previous startups, and my co-founder Ed Lando has founded unicorn startups that have raised hundreds of millions. But with just $2M raised to date, Kinisi is pioneering the future of physical intelligence where we don't mimic human biology — we outperform it. 

If you ship fast and want to see your work in the real world, not just in demo videos, reach out here https://www.kinisi.com/careers


I've spent the last 15 years founding robotics startups because I hate inefficiency. I turned my childhood bedroom into a robotics lab and started the UK's first robot fighting league while working in warehouses and factories. But after a job made me unscrew 1000 screws manually, I knew my mission was to build practical bots that take hard labor off of people's shoulders. 

I spent a decade in academia, researching humanoid locomotion for my PhD, before founding Bear Robotics. Funded with $180M by investors like SoftBank, we built waiter bots that delivered millions of meals to tables. But without AI, they had to be hard-coded for each restaurant and struggled when tables were rearranged. So I spent two years advising top robotics startups while learning to design LLM-powered hardware before recruiting a team from Nvidia and Dyson. 

Now we're growing Kinisi — not by chasing hype, but by building robots that businesses pay for. And by getting the most humanoids in the field, we're collecting the training data to tackle tomorrow's industrial challenges.

name: Kurt Busch
title: CEO at Syntiant Corp
about:
Founder, CEO, board member, global team builder, leader and (sometimes) visionary driving a culture of innovation through three guiding principles:

Exceptionalism: “If you want to break into a market, you must provide a truly exceptional product that is 100x better or enables something just not possible before.”

Respect: “We are fortunate to voluntarily interact with others. Showing respect for our colleagues, customers and vendors is paramount, whether it is being on time for a meeting or recognizing the strengths and accomplishments of others.”

Gratitude: “We all have gotten where we are through the help of others. Building a new type of processor for deep learning required many groups of people working together toward a common goal. It’s a team sport. We go out of our way each day to thank those who have helped us along the way.”

Using these principles, I have led teams to introduce a host of “first of type” product areas, from semiconductors to systems that were successful in a wide range of industries, including mobile, enterprise core, networking, mobility, broadcast video, as well as consumer products sold at the Apple store.

Away from the office, I am  dedicated to serving others, including mentoring youth through volunteer work at local schools, and as a scoutmaster for the Boy Scouts of America.

name: Enhao GONG
title: Founder&CEO at Subtle Medical. FDA-cleared AI for faster, safer, smarter radiology exams. Award winner: Forbes 30u30. Fortune 40u40, Radiology 40u40, NVIDIA AI Award, CB Insight AI100+GenAI50, Stanford Healthcare GenAI
about:
Looking forward to meet you and brain storm how AI can reshape the world.

Founder&CEO @ Subtle Medical: 
- Deep Learning to improve the efficiency and value Medical Imaging

PhD in EE@Stanford: 
- Medical Imaging (MRI), Deep Learning, Compressed Sensing, Data Driven Image Processing, Machine Learning

Co-founder @ Polarr: 
- Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Image Processing, Image Rendering

Technical Experience: Imaging Systems, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Computational Imaging, Signal Processing, Neural/Bio Signal Processing, Optical Imaging, Super Resolution

Operation Experience: Business Development, Entrepreneurship, Sales Management, Business Planning, Finance, Start-ups, Product Development, Budgeting, Operations Management, Management Consulting.


About me:
As a Stanford Graduate Fellow, I completed my PhD in Electrical Engineering at Stanford. My research is focused on deep learning in medical imaging. Our recent work on MRI reconstruction based on deep learning and Generative AI models which was featured and awarded in academic and industry conferences. 

I co-founded Subtle Medical (StartX 2017), using deep learning technology to improve the efficiency and quality of medical imaging.

I co-founded Polarr (StartX 2014) and built new technologies (GPU rendering, edge-side DL, mobile computer vision) for photo retouching products and curation engine. 

At Stanford, I am supervised by Professor John Pauly and Professor Greg Zaharchuk to apply deep learning and statistical methods on reconstruction to further push the limit of fast imaging and improving the acquisition, reconstruction and quantification of MRI. I am also leading projects on DL application in neuroimaging, PET/MRI, quantitative MRI etc.

At Tsinghua, my awarded undergraduate thesis work is focused on decoding human speech intention using neural signals. I have also interned at Qualcomm and Philips working on Machine Learning and Computational Imaging.

name: Daniel M. Wagner
title: Dan Wagner is a serial technology entrepreneur having created a number of successful tech businesses over 40 years(!!)
about:
Dan Wagner has set up numerous technology businesses since the early 1980s and he continues to strive to bring innovative technologies to market. Dan started in 1984 and set up the first online information platform (MAID later renamed Dialog) which initially licensed content from the major newspapers and magazines to sell their content online. Because this was 1984, Dan was able to secure exclusive agreements and this helped him grind out a unique position when bigger companies like Reuters and Dow Jones entered the market in 1987. Dialog went on to become the global market leader before it was sold to Thomson (now Thomson Reuters). Dan's second company (Venda) was a pioneer in enterprise eCommerce and was founded in 1998. Venda created a cloud or on demand commerce platform that went on to run major retail customers' eCommerce sites (including Lands End, Tesco, BooHoo, TJX Companies, Nieman Marcus and many more) and was sold to Oracle in 2014 after becoming European market leader.

Dan's current business, Rezolve, is positioned to drive a new paradigm in mobile engagement by using the capabilities of the mobile device to enable a new and superior way to connect with consumers.
speaking_engagements: Podcast interview on Bitcoin Treasuries and Tap To Pay (March 2025)
notable_achievements: Founded Powa Technologies, once valued at $2.7 billion; Led Rezolve to a $750 million valuation with significant fundraising
reasoning: Dan Wagner demonstrates a clear pattern of building and successfully exiting multiple significant technology companies over a 40-year career. His track record includes two major exits: Dialog (formerly MAID) to Thomson Reuters and Venda to Oracle in 2014. Both companies achieved market leadership positions in their respective sectors. Dialog became a global market leader in online information services, while Venda became the European market leader in enterprise eCommerce, serving major retail clients like Tesco, Lands End, and Nieman Marcus. The timeline, scale, and exits of these ventures, combined with the caliber of clients and acquirers, strongly support an L7 (Elite Serial Entrepreneur) classification.

I built AI that changed industries, ML,DSP, and Deep learning 
at Apple for iPhones and AirPods, hybrid AI at Meta for AR and VR.

Now I’m solving automation’s last mile: replicating expert human judgment in regulated labs.

Pharma, food safety, and life sciences still rely on manual review. Foundation models cannot help. They need too much data and are not built for compliance.

At Expert Intelligence, we created EI CoPilot, an AI platform that turns expert workflows into autonomous modules using just 30 to 40 examples.

Powered by our patented Limited Sample Model (LSM), we are live at Fortune 100 labs, delivering 50x speed, near-zero error, and full regulatory alignment.

Human expertise at machine speed.
This is the next breakthrough.

name: Casey Morrison
title: Chief Product Officer and Co-Founder at Astera Labs
about:
At Astera Labs, I have the exciting responsibility of defining products and ensuring customers can easily integrate them into their systems. I have a passion for solving high-speed interface problems in unique ways which allow end-users to focus on their system's value. I strive to take a customer-focused approach, aspiring to earn customers' trust and develop meaningful relationships along the way.

At Texas Instruments, I was a Systems and Validation Manager and Member of Group Technical Staff (MGTS) for the High-Speed Signal Conditioning product line in Texas Instruments' Analog Signal Chain division (Santa Clara, CA). My primary role at TI between 2008 and 2017 was product definition, system simulation, and silicon validation of high-speed interface ICs from 2.5 Gbps to 56+ Gbps.

My industry experience is in high-speed serial communications and signal integrity spanning numerous interface standards including PCI-Express, Ethernet, Fibrechannel, SAS/SATA, SRIO, CPRI, and others. I enjoy working collaboratively with customers to develop innovative solutions for data center, enterprise, and wired/wireless infrastructure systems. The team I am proud to be a part of is fueling the world's appetite for data on-demand by developing easy-to-use products for high-speed links--making it simple for system designers to integrate these solutions and focus on their value-add.

Aside from engineering, my passions/hobbies include cooking, playing music (clarinet and saxophone), hiking and trail running, and spending time with family and friends.
awards_and_recognitions: DesignCon Engineer of the Year 2024
speaking_engagements: Presentation on CXL Memory Expansion and Pooling for the Cloud
notable_achievements: Co-Founder and Chief Product Officer of Astera Labs

name: James Min, MD
title: Founder and CEO at Cleerly
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
James K. Min, MD, FACC, FESC, MSCCT, is the Founder & CEO of Cleerly, a digital healthcare company creating a new standard of precision heart care. As a board-certified cardiologist with a clinical focus on cardiovascular disease prevention and imaging, Dr. Min seeks to prevent heart attacks using Cleerly's AI-enabled digital care platform to help physicians precisely identify, define and treat heart disease earlier.

Dr. Min is a former Professor of Radiology and Medicine at Weill Cornell Medical College and the Director of the Dalio Institute of Cardiovascular Imaging (ICI) at NewYork-Presbyterian. Over the last 17 years, Dr. Min has published over 500 peer-reviewed manuscripts that have been funded, in part, by numerous grants awarded by the National Institutes of Health and the Dalio Foundation. He has also served as Principal Investigator on numerous landmark multicenter clinical trials and registries, along with serving as the director of a state-of-the-art core laboratory for coronary computed tomography for several multicenter clinical trials.

Dr. Min received his BA from the University of Chicago, and his medical degree from Temple University Medical School. He completed his internship, residency and cardiovascular medicine fellowship at the University of Chicago Hospitals.

name: Pieter Abbeel

about: Pieter Abbeel is Professor and Director of the Robot Learning Lab at UC Berkeley [2008- ], Co-Director of the Berkeley AI Research (BAIR) Lab, Co-Founder of covariant.ai [2017- ], Co-Founder of Gradescope [2014- ], Advisor to OpenAI, Investment Partner at AIX Ventures, Advisor to many AI/Robotics start-ups. He works in machine learning and robotics. In particular his research focuses on making robots learn from people (apprenticeship learning), how to make robots learn through their own trial and error (reinforcement learning), and how to speed up skill acquisition through learning-to-learn (meta-learning). His robots have learned advanced helicopter aerobatics, knot-tying, basic assembly, organizing laundry, locomotion, and vision-based robotic manipulation. He has won numerous awards, including best paper awards at ICML, NIPS and ICRA, early career awards from NSF, Darpa, ONR, AFOSR, Sloan, TR35, IEEE, and the Presidential Early Career Award for Scientists and Engineers (PECASE). Pieter's work is frequently featured in the popular press, including New York Times, BBC, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, Wired, Forbes, Tech Review, NPR.

name: Patrick Chopson
title: Co-Founder, AIA, CPO | Architect | AI | Technologist
about:
Patrick Chopson, AIA, is the Co-Founder and Chief Product Officer of Cove Architecture, an AI-powered full-service architecture practice revolutionizing how buildings are imagined, designed, and delivered. By integrating artificial intelligence and simulation into the design process, Patrick leads a bold shift away from conventional design services toward scalable, outcomes-based design excellence.

A licensed architect with over 20 years of experience, Patrick holds a Master’s in High Performance Buildings from Georgia Tech and has deep roots in sustainability, building science, and product innovation. He is the co-author of "Build Like It's the End of the World: A Practical Guide to Decarbonize Architecture, Engineering, and Construction (Wiley, 2025)" — a manifesto for retooling the AEC industry for climate resilience.

Through Cove, Patrick is helping redefine architectural value delivery by fusing data-driven design with AI-powered automation—turning design intent into measurable impact at scale. His work has been featured in Architect Magazine, TechCrunch, Site Selection, ArchDaily, and more. He collaborates closely with real estate developers, policymakers, and technologists to tackle the built environment’s toughest challenges—from embodied carbon to permitting bottlenecks.

Passionate about the intersection of architecture, AI, and planetary limits, Patrick is building not just buildings—but the tools and systems to redesign the future.

name: Dan Gedman
title: President/CEO at Outrider
about:
One of my favorite things about Outrider is how our team’s combined backgrounds shape the day-to-day ethos of the company. We started with the foundation of big agency thinking and high-end production, but it’s really our acuity in design and post that make us unique. 

Combine these pillars with a passionate belief that there is almost always a better, more efficient way of doing things—specifically when it comes to the volume of content generally needed by our clients—and we’ve built the exact company I’ve spent my entire career conceptualizing.

name: Neil Hunt
title: Technology leadership, consumer products, healthcare, climate tech, media and entertainment
about:
We are building a cognitive system for healthcare which will incorporate the world’s medical knowledge, learn from data, and make it all accessible to patients and their doctors.

We are convinced that to really make an impact, we need to focus on primary care.  Every person interacts with primary care as their entry point into the system and it is the unifying thread that ties together disparate preventative and curative efforts across all fields of medicine and health.

A tenet that permeates our entire culture at Curai is belief in the power of data to transform medical decision making into a process backed by evidence.  Artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies have matured to the point that this is practical.

We are building a patient-facing system with doctors in the loop.  We are using our experience in creating consumer products to create tools that patients can use to truly understand their health concerns and issues, and we’re investing heavily in natural language technology to understand exactly what a patient is saying so we can make sure they are actually being heard.  But doctors are a core part of healthcare, and our system integrates with health professionals to enable them to helping patients as effectively as possible.

We believe that great healthcare ought to be a human right, and that by tackling the challenge of primary care we build relevance for every human on the planet, and we can shoot to have the biggest impact on an important problem.
Currently hiring great technologists and medical experts
awards_and_recognitions: Honorary D.Sc. from Durham University
speaking_engagements: Interview on diversity and tech leadership at Durham University; Founding member of Computer Science Department’s External Advisory Board at Durham University
notable_achievements: Chief Product Officer at Netflix (1999-2018), responsible for design, implementation and operation of Netflix technology; Founder and Chief Product Officer at Vibrant Planet; Co-founder at Curai, a venture-backed health tech company; Chair of the Board of the Sony Group
reasoning: Neil Hunt has demonstrated exceptional executive-level experience as Netflix's CPO during its transformation into a global streaming giant. While he wasn't a founder at Netflix, his 18-year tenure in a C-level position at a company that grew to massive scale qualifies him as a proven operator. He's now leading Curai Health as a founder/executive, applying AI to healthcare. His experience level matches L4 criteria for 'Proven Operators with Executive Experience' given his C-level role at a major tech company and current founder status.

name: Bruce Cooper
about:
"A designer knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away."  - Antoine de Saint-Exupery

"Any intelligent fool can make things bigger, more complex, and more violent.  It takes a touch of genius, and a lot of courage, to move in the opposite direction."  - Albert Einstein

"We should forget about small efficiencies, say about 97% of the time: premature optimization is the root of all evil.  Yet we should not pass up our opportunities in that critical 3%.  A good programmer will not be lulled into complacency by such reasoning, he will be wise to look carefully at the critical code; but only after that code has been identified"  - Donald Knuth

name: Joanna Riley
title: CEO and Co-Founder Censia
about:
An entrepreneur, investor, and advocate in technology, and is currently the CEO and co-founder of Censia, a leading AI talent intelligence platform that helps companies harness the power of machine learning and clean data to make the best and fairest decisions about individual employees and the workforce as a whole. 

Joanna has a highly experienced background in building and scaling companies, which she attributes to her deep passion for people and building technologies that allow people to be their best selves.  She brings her wide knowledge of the industry to better transform the way enterprise companies hire talent. 

Prior to founding Censia, she led her companies through two successful acquisitions and an IPO, and was part of the International Training Unit for the FBI, a collegiate rower, and earned her BA degree in Foreign Affairs from the University of Virginia where she was a full scholarship athlete. 

Featured in Fortune, Fast Company, Inc, WSJ, Financial Times, Bloomberg, Huffington Post, NYSE, TechCrunch, Business Insider, and many others. 

She currently sits on the Board of Directors for Young Presidents Organization as part of the International Membership Council, the US Board of So They Can, and the Board of Directors at CompTia. She is an active angel investor in early-stage companies.
awards_and_recognitions: Named one of the 100 highest-ranking women in tech in 2017; Most Powerful and Influential Women Award by the California Diversity Council; Power '30 Under 30' for Professional and Community Excellence in 2016
speaking_engagements: Guest on Corporate Competitor Podcast discussing leadership and learning from failure; Featured on Behind Company Lines podcast discussing AI in talent intelligence; Speaker at World Economic Forum in Davos on collaboration and skills-based workforce
notable_achievements: Led 1-Page to a successful IPO and onto the S&P/ASX 300; Named one of the 100 highest-ranking women in tech globally in 2017; Awarded Most Powerful and Influential Women and Power ’30 Under 30 in 2016; Featured in major publications including Fortune, Forbes, WSJ, Bloomberg
reasoning: Joanna Riley demonstrates a clear pattern of successful entrepreneurship with multiple exits including two acquisitions and an IPO. Her current venture Censia is a significant AI platform in the talent space, and she has achieved recognition across major business publications. Her board positions at notable organizations like YPO and CompTIA, combined with her active angel investing, indicate sustained success at the highest levels of entrepreneurship. The multiple successful exits particularly qualify her for L7 classification as an Elite Serial Entrepreneur.

As CEO and Co-Founder of Near Space Labs I am incredibly proud to lead a team that has transformed complex science into a scalable, repeatable solution that is changing how humanity observes and responds to our rapidly evolving planet.
We founded Near Space Labs with a vision: to make high-quality Earth observation accessible, affordable, and impactful for organizations across industries. We recognized that traditional tools were falling short of modern needs, and we knew there was a better way. Today, our team has turned that vision into reality—helping companies and partners create products that serve communities most affected by climate change and rapid environmental shifts.

name: Jeevan Kalanithi
title: CEO at openspace.ai
about:
I'm a technology executive, technologist and entrepreneur. 

My background is in artificial intelligence, drones and cameras, management and leadership, and product design. My first startup Sifteo – co-founded with David Merrill and based on our graduate work from MIT and our TED talk – was acquired by North America's largest drone company, 3D Robotics, in 2014. 

At 3DR, I served as VP Product, Chief Product Officer, and President. 

I spent time at Lux Capital, a VC firm with ~$2B under management, before starting my second company, OpenSpace.

My and my teams' work has been featured in TED, The New York Times, WIRED and more; our products have been sold in boutique retail (NY's MoMA store), large format retail nationally and globally (Best Buy, Toys R Us, Amazon); I have worked on art projects shown at the MoMA, SFMoMA, Oslo Philharmonic, Paris' Villette Numerique and the Miami Museum of Art. I have run teams from 1 to >100 people, and partnered with companies such as Nickelodeon, Sony and Autodesk to launch and sell products globally at scale. 

I am an alumnus of MIT (graduate work at the Media Lab), Stanford (BS in Symbolic Systems), and the Screen Actors Guild (no, I'm not a good actor).

name: Anu Shukla
title: Co- Founder & Executive Chairman  at Botco.ai
about:
Anu Shukla is a serial entrepreneur with over 20 years of high-tech industry experience. She is the Founder& CEO of RewardsPay Inc. Formerly, she was the  founder and CEO of Offerpal Media ( aka Tapjoy, Inc.) She was the Founder and former CEO and Director of MyBuys Inc. (formerly Rubiconsoft) a venture backed  company she started in 2002, .  

Prior to RubiconSoft, she was founder and CEO of Rubric, Inc, a Silicon Valley software company that pioneered the explosive new category of Enterprise Marketing Automation systems to collaborate, plan, execute, manage and measure marketing campaigns.  Rubric eMA is used by F500 and e-commerce companies to drive revenues and build "sticky" customer relationships.  Rubric,  was acquired for $366 million in February 2000.
 
Prior to founding Rubric, Ms. Shukla was the VP of Marketing and Product Strategy at Versata (VATA) .As the COO at mFactory, Inc., Ms. Shukla raised significant growth capital and helped it make a successful transition from a technology start-up to ongoing commercial concern. The company was acquired by Quark.

Ms. Shukla was Vice President of Worldwide Marketing and Product Management at Compuware/Uniface Corporation (CPWR), where sales grew from $10 million to more than $85 million  .  She played a major role in Compuware's $433 million acquisition of Uniface.

Ms. Shukla served on the Board of Directors of FWE&E (Forum for Women Entrepreneurs and Executives) , International Museum of Women ( IMOW.org) and the Advisory Board for the Leavey School of Business, Santa Clara University.  She was named to the Computer Industry “Dream Team” by Business 2.0 magazine in 2004, awarded the YSU Distinguished Alumni award in 2005, and the Entrepreneur of the Year by the Washington D.C. based Dialogue on Diversity organization in 2005. Ms Shukla served as the commencement speaker and was awarded  an Honorary Doctorate from her Alma Mater YSU in 2008.

Specialties: CEO, Entrepreneur, Marketing, Internet Advertising, Virtual Currency Monetiztion, Social Networking, Social Games

name: Benjamin Madick

location: San Diego County, California, United States
about:
Ben Madick is the co-founder and CEO of Matic, one of the fastest-growing insurance agencies in the U.S. and the leader in the mobile and online delivery of homeowner’s insurance. The company provides firm, bindable quotes in seconds from highly rated insurance carriers—expediting the process of closing a mortgage loan.  

Before launching Matic, Ben founded Mortgage Quality Management and Research (MQMR), an independent risk management consulting firm to the mortgage industry. Ben was the company’s past president/CEO, and currently serves as an advisor.

Ben has also founded HQ Vendor Management and was president of Subsequent QC, a provider of mortgage servicing audits. 

Ben began his career working with global financial markets and institutions in London, England. He spent five years as a correspondent lending executive at Bank of America, where he managed relationships with large independent mortgage lenders. He currently serves on the advisory board of Mortgage Compliance Magazine and as an advisor to numerous U.S. mortgage banks and lenders. He holds a B.S. in Business Administration and Finance from the University of Arizona.

name: William Cooper
title: Founder & CEO Klarity, Entrepreneur, Chairman, NED, Investor
about:
Will is a technology entrepreneur that has both founded and developed several international businesses. He is Founder and CEO of Delfin Health, a health data management platform for the healthcare industry and also maintains two board positions.  Delfin Health operates Klarity which provides a comprehensive range of customisable risk prediction models covering premature mortality and chronic disease and disease specific models for cancer and diabetes. Klarity increases the accuracy of these predictions by incorporating real time health data through wearables, facial AI and at-home blood diagnostics (UK, India and US only).
Klarity also provides remote patient monitoring and specific oncology related services including cancer screening, second opinions, cancer treatment and patient concierge service. 
In 2009 he was CEO and co-founder of ACHICA.com, a members only ecommerce platform focussed on the home and garden category. ACHICA has 4+ million members and in 2014 had revenues in excess of $90m and was sold in December 2015.
In 2000 he joined Tradedoubler, an international digital marketing company later becoming CEO. Having joined the company as one of it's first 10 employees by the end of 2008 it operated in 20+ countries across Europe and Asia, had over 700 employees and annual revenues in excess of £300m and was listed on Nasdaq OMX in Sweden.  
In 1995 he started his career in the City of London working for an investor relations and financial PR firm Tavistock Communications
speaking_engagements: Interview with Greg Winterton on life risk space in New Insights
reasoning: William Cooper demonstrates a strong track record as a proven operator with multiple successful ventures and one notable exit. His experience includes scaling ACHICA.com to $90M+ revenue and successful exit, growing Tradedoubler from early employee to CEO with £300M+ revenue and IPO, and currently leading Klarity/Delfin Health. While impressive, his achievements don't quite reach the L5 threshold of consistent >$50M funding rounds or L6 threshold of market-defining innovation, but clearly exceed L3 requirements with multiple proven successes.

name: Stephen Odaibo, MD, MS(Math), MS(Comp. Sci.)
title: CEO & Founder RETINA-AI Health, Inc. | Retina Specialist | Healthcare AI expert | Math/Comp Sci. | AI Engineer
about:
Dr. Stephen G. Odaibo is CEO and Founder of RETINA-AI Health, Inc. He is a Physician, Retina Specialist, Computer Scientist, Full Stack AI Engineer, and AI/ML expert.

Dr. Odaibo completed undergraduate in mathematics at Univ of Alabama (UAB) and medical school at Duke University, where he won the Barrie Hurwitz Award for Excellence in Neurology.  He completed ophthalmology residency at Howard and Retina fellowship at Univ of Michigan.  In addition to his medical training, he holds Masters Degrees in both Mathematics and Computer Science.  In 2017, UAB college of Arts and Sciences awarded him the college’s highest honor--the UAB Distinguished Alumni Achievement Award.  Dr. Odaibo has authored three mathematics textbooks: "Quantum Mechanics and the MRI Machine" (2012),  "The Form of Finite Groups: A Course on Finite Group Theory" (2016), and most recently, "The Foundational Mathematics of Artificial Intelligence" (2024).

Dr. Odaibo has extensive experience in building AI systems and running AI ventures.  Dr. Odaibo is a hands-on full-stack AI/ML engineer and data scientist.  He is a Google Cloud-Certified Professional Cloud Cybersecurity Engineer.  He single-handedly built the world's first mobile AI application for eyecare providers.  He is CEO of RETINA AI—a venture where he and his team designed the RETINA-AI Galaxy for detection of diabetic retinopathy.  As CEO of RETINA-AI, he organized and managed the largest pivotal clinical trial ever done in the United States for an autonomous AI system.  His managerial role has garnered him extensive skill in recruitment and management of tech teams.  He additionally has expertise in the regulatory and legal aspects of AI-- Dr. Odaibo was awarded two U.S. patents for inventing AI systems for detecting disease from ophthalmic images.

His expertise has been sought out across the globe.  Dr. Odaibo chaired and ran the AI workshops at the Medical Device Software Development Summits in the United States (2022, 2023) and European Union (2023).  He has also shared his AI expertise in Asia. In 2019 Dr. Odaibo chaired the "Artificial Intelligence & Tech in Medicine Symposium" at the National Medical Association Meeting. He serves on the Advisory Board of the Duke University Masters of Engineering in Artificial Intelligence program.

Overall, Dr. Odaibo has extensive experience in AI at the technical, managerial, and regulatory levels.  He continues to see patients part time as a Retina Physician, and he enjoys the privilege of providing excellent care to his patients.
education_2_degree: Doctor of Medicine (M.D.), Internal Medicine Residency Program -- Intern year.
awards_and_recognitions: Distinguished Alumni Achievement Award from the College of Arts & Sciences, UAB (2017)
speaking_engagements: Interview on YouTube discussing interdisciplinary background and AI in retinal diagnostics (2021); Featured in Birmingham Times article discussing RETINA-AI and AI in medicine (2023); Presentation on retinal image generation for disease discovery (YouTube)
notable_achievements: First ophthalmologist with advanced degrees in both Mathematics and Computer Science; Recipient of the Distinguished Alumni Achievement Award from UAB College of Arts & Sciences (2017); Winner of the Barrie Hurwitz Award for Excellence in Clinical Neurology at Duke University School of Medicine (2005); Holder of U.S. Patents for AI systems diagnosing eye diseases; Author of three mathematics textbooks

name: Maximilian Evans
title: Founder Parvada / Harvard mathematician focused on spatio-temporal AI
about:
I'm Max Evans, founder, and COO of Parvada AI. With a passion for video AI and an extensive background as a co-founder and former CTO at ClimateAI, I'm excited to bring transformative change to the meat industry. At Parvada AI, we're developing an AI-driven platform to automate the different processes in the meat industry, starting with gender classification.
Having grown up in Ecuador within a farming family, the drive to create resilient systems runs in my veins. My journey from studying applied math at Harvard to specializing in AI and business at Stanford, and now to leading Parvada AI, is fueled by a mission to blend cutting-edge technology with practical applications. Our goal? To make complex workflows as straightforward and effective as possible, ensuring high standards are met with ease.

I'm enthusiastic about the potential of combining sight—the most powerful sensor evolution has gifted us—with large language and multimodal models to transform the way we work. I'm confident that our technology can adapt to improve efficiency, safety, and outcome. Here's to building a better world with the best tools AI has to offer!

name: Ceci Chan
title: 🔥 Your happiness is my priority. I support overwhelmed professionals to feel alive and full of possibility again. Let’s connect. 🌱
about:
I’m here for the pause. 
The moment you remember there’s more to life than getting through the day.


In 2020, I burned out completely.
I had the titles, the career, the credentials. But inside, something was missing.
Even in a job I once loved, I woke up each morning feeling drained.

So I paused.
And began the quiet, powerful work of coming home to myself.
Not to fix anything, but to feel again.

I explored psychology, coaching, yoga — even hypnosis, tarot, and astrology (you name it!).

And what stayed with me and transformed me entirely, was the kind of clarity that comes from truly knowing myself.

Now, that’s what I offer others.


🌿 I support overwhelmed professionals to feel alive and full of possibility again, through holistic coaching and intentional, joyful action planning.

I bring together psychology, holistic coaching, and lived experience into a space for your whole self to be held, nurtured, and expanded.

Whether it’s through 1:1 coaching or accessible, heart-aligned digital resources, my work is here to help you soften the noise, reconnect with what matters, and move forward. With ease and joy.


“I gained a clear sense of direction… from overwhelmed to deeply reconnected.”
— Career transition client

“The clarity and intentional actions I found haven’t left me since.”
— Burnout recovery client

👉 Read more heartfelt stories from my coaching clients
https://testimonial.to/ceci-s-holistic-alignment-coaching/all


Life isn’t meant to be survived.
It’s meant to be lived. 

🌞 If something here stirs something in you, PM me and let’s talk.
I’d love to support you, if you're craving more aliveness and ease! 💌

name: Heather Maio-Smith
title: Director at Memory Workers
about: Heather Smith is an experiential exhibit designer who has exhibited in Los Angeles, Cuba, and The United Nations. Heather was the concept creator and producer of New Dimensions in Testimony, the technology behind future generations being able to have a conversation with a Holocaust survivor. Heather partnered with USC Shoah Foundation on New Dimensions in Testimony to develop a new interview methodology. Heather now serves as the CVO of StoryFile, an interactive Conversational Video AI Platform that uses advanced natural language processing and artificial intelligence to make video interaction feel just like a real conversation. StoryFile’s technology will allow people to have conversations with video, removing the boundaries of time and space, so that we can experience all kinds of conversations and learn from individuals whenever and wherever we want.  At the heart of Heather’s work is the underlying need to share, preserve and learn from the human experience. Heather’s work has been featured on NBC’s The Today Show, The New Yorker, The BBC and on 60 Minutes.

name: Joe Stecher
title: GROWTH EXECUTIVE ✦ AI & XR STRATEGIST ✦ Scalable Innovation ✦ Strategic Partnerships ✦ Driving Revenue, Operational Efficiency & Market Expansion Across Technology, Government & Fortune 500 Organizations
about:
𝐇𝐢, 𝐈’𝐦 𝐉𝐨𝐞 𝐒𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐫. With deep expertise at the intersection of growth strategy, systems design, and emerging technologies, I specialize in turning complex challenges into scalable business engines. From founding an AI automation company before AI was a buzzword, to leading multi-million-dollar partnerships in Tech, Defense, Real Estate, and Healthcare, the through-line is creating repeatable, high-impact systems that drive measurable growth, while consistently building momentum where others see friction.  

I’ve led expansion across startups, government programs, and cross-sector partnerships, reviving stalled business units, accelerating go-to-market performance, and building operational frameworks from scratch. But behind the numbers is something simpler: I love building things. Whether it’s a support model that keeps numerous 5,000-staff hospitals running 24/7, or a virtual training platform good enough to be acquired by a top Electronic Health Record (EHR) provider, I find creative satisfaction in the hands-on process of solving hard problems at scale. I build intentionally—for lasting impact, with clarity, urgency, and deep respect for the people and systems that make it work. 

𝐓𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐬𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐚𝐥 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐮𝐥𝐭𝐬: 

✦ Recognized by Inc. 5000, Fast Company & CIO Magazine for building high-growth, award-winning AI and healthcare ventures. 
✦ Scaled TackleAI to $125M, growing revenue 5x annually by securing recurring AI contracts with government and Fortune 500 clients. 
✦ Grew CETA revenue 400% annually for 4 years by scaling training ops and launching a nationwide virtual learning system. 
✦ Drove 250% revenue growth at King Crow Studios by overhauling GTM strategy and securing multi-sector XR contracts. 
✦ Secured multi-million-dollar contracts with DoD and Fortune 500s by aligning tech with urgent operational pain points. 
✦ Increased asset portfolio by 1,000% at Wednesday Properties through strategic acquisitions and optimized project execution.

𝐋𝐞𝐭’𝐬 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐜𝐭 if you’re looking for someone who can scale growth, navigate complexity, and lead with vision, velocity, and heart. I bring hands-on execution and a systems mindset to every challenge—and I never stop building.

name: Hakan Gunturkun, PhD
title: Head of AI, Co-Founder @ Arcade | AI Strategy Innovation
about:
What I'm up to these days:
• building arcade.ai with an incredible team - yes, it’s as cool as it sounds.
• leading and scaling an ai team full of brilliant minds.
• designing and developing generative AI models (llms, diffusion models, multimodal ai) - no magic, just a lot of coffee, code, and hands-on work.
• driving continuous innovation: building novel tools, breaking them, fixing them, and making them better.
• architecting scalable ai systems with cutting-edge tech - the good stuff that actually ships.
• writing algorithms that aren't just smart - they’re built to scale across real-world production environments.
• diving deep into AI research - and surfacing with new ideas, sometimes even good ones
• occasionally moonlighting as an academic: publishing posters, papers, and sharing what we learn.
• grateful every day to work with amazing people - seriously, they make all the difference.

name: David Cherrie
title: Startup founder, interested in understanding gen-z and what motivates them in work. Love problem solving with an engineer mindset, exploring new ideas and developing strategy to make them a reality. Aussie in Texas, COYS
about:
I'm an Aussie living in Texas (America's America!) with a passion for turning ideas into reality and helping others reach their full potential. I've experienced a lot of the ups and downs of entrepreneurship, moved countries to start a venture backed company and learned a lot along the way.

I worked in retail for a few years while at University, and I firmly believe that these foundational roles are not just jobs but life-defining experiences. They set the stage for critical skills and resilience that serve well beyond the store floor.

I'm currently obsessed with understanding the mindset of gen-z employees and how to maximize their engagement and motivation at work. If that topic interests you as well, feel free to reach out to me about it.

When I’m not working, you’ll find me shooting hoops in my driveway, cheering on the Spurs in the EPL or enjoying time with friends and family.

I still love connecting with curious, creative people. So whether you’re building something new, navigating a transition, or just want to talk tech, startups, or coffee—feel free to reach out.

name: Daniel Berlind
title: Co-Founder and Executive Chairman of Snappt Inc
about:
Daniel Berlind is a real estate executive and the CEO of Snappt, a data-driven fraud detection software that instantly prevents financial fraud in the multi-family housing industry. In 2017,
Dan co-founded Snappt after running his own property management company and noticing a
significant, industry-wide financial issue in the multi-family rental industry. As a
result, he launched Snappt, which provides proprietary software that aids and streamlines
the apartment rental process by reducing bad debt, increasing asset value, and minimizing

name: James Hyde
title: CEO of Snappt | Former Leadership at Venminder, PayPal, Braintree, Venmo & iPay Technologies | Driving Growth, Transformation & Industry Impact.
about:
James Hyde is the Chief Executive Officer of Snappt, the leading verification platform for the multifamily housing industry. Snappt helps property managers identify fraudulent rental applications, verify identity, income, and assets, and reduce financial risk—ensuring operators can confidently approve qualified residents while protecting their communities. With AI-driven technology, Snappt has analyzed over 13 million documents with 99.8% accuracy, setting the standard for fraud prevention in the industry.

Before joining Snappt, Hyde served as CEO of Venminder, a leader in third-party risk management software, until its acquisition by Ncontracts in 2024. Under his leadership, Venminder grew to serve 1,200+ customers across banking, insurance, technology, and healthcare, earning recognition as a Gartner Customers’ Choice and a Best Place to Work multiple times.

Prior to Venminder, Hyde played a key role in scaling FinTech and SaaS companies, including PayPal, Braintree, and Venmo, where he led revenue growth as SVP of Sales and helped transform Braintree from a startup to a global payment leader. 

Hyde is passionate about leading high-growth companies, fostering innovation, and building teams that make an impact. At Snappt, he is focused on advancing fraud prevention technology, strengthening industry partnerships, and ensuring property managers have the most reliable tools to protect their communities.

name: Bhakti Vithalani
title: Founder & CEO at BigSpring. McKinsey, Siebel, Wharton, Carnegie Mellon alum | WEF Tech Pioneer
about:
My life’s work is to equip people to be job-ready in a rapidly changing world.

I grew up in Bombay, where anyone walking down the street has asked: What’s the path forward? Study-work-retire leaves most people behind. Later, at McKinsey & Company, I saw the same problem in business: companies struggled to turn business plans into on-the-ground results. Why? Because we equip people for jobs with training and it’s BS—“death by content,” “spray-and-pray,” “check-the-box”.

BigSpring AI is disrupting that. We solve for three essentials:

🎯 Adapt to change
On BigSpring AI, enterprises don’t just onboard people—they everboard them to meet evolving business needs. We start with the latest job needs, not the content, so people stay relevant and ready.

💪 Measure job-ready, not test-ready
We don’t track “Did you watch the video?” or “Did you pass the test?”
We measure, Are you ready for the job?
BigSpring AI measures muscle memory, not activity—because that's what drives results.

👩‍🦰 Design for the user
Just like YouTube is tailored and social, so is BigSpring AI. The platform understands each person’s muscle memory metrics and builds a personalized onramp. Think of it as a personal CrossFit program for work—targeted, flexible, and designed to help people grow in real time.

BigSpring AI is fueled by doing well and doing good. A platform that adapts to change also unlocks social mobility—anyone can become anything.

Our mission: A direct path to progress for anyone.

name: Davide Marini
title: Technology Entrepreneur | CEO @ Inkbit
about:
I am an entrepreneur naturally attracted to solving ambitious and technically complex challenges that require the convergence of different disciplines, especially chemistry, biology, computer science and engineering. 

A rather nonlinear career path led me to cofound and lead Inkbit, an MIT spinout that developed Vision-Controlled Jetting (VCJ), a scalable additive manufacturing process that can build complex, multi-material objects in a single print, eliminating the need for assembly. The development of VCJ required converging state-of-the-art techniques in optics, chemistry, and computer vision. The technology was published in Nature.

Prior to Inkbit, I had the fortune of being invited to cofound and lead Firefly BioWorks, an MIT spinout that developed a novel assay for multiplexed detection of microRNA on standard flow cytometers. The technology relied on individually encoded and DNA-functionalized hydrogel microparticles manufactured by flow lithography. The technology was published in Science.

Prior to Firefly, I was a postdoctoral fellow at Harvard Medical School and Children's Hospital Boston, where I developed nanomaterials for sensing and drug delivery applications in the area of ion channels.

I obtained my BS in Industrial Engineering from Politecnico di Milano, my MBA from Collège des Ingénieurs in Paris, and my PhD in Mechanical Engineering from MIT. Prior to attending graduate school, I worked on a fixed-income derivatives trading desk at J.P. Morgan in London.

Given my schedule, I can only afford one mind-resetting activity: I am a competitive épée fencer (USFA C2024 rating). If I had more time, I would invest it in more fencing, cycling, skateboarding, archery, astrophotography, playing piano, writing Lisp code, studying physics, history, architecture, ... Some of these interests are at least useful in composing the annual trivia at the Inkbit Christmas party.

I tend to lead by engagement to ensure all the knowledge and creativity of the team flows into making effective decisions. I am intensely curious of how other people think and strive to create an environment where that richness can be fully realized.

Skills: exploration, finding order in chaos, creating a path through uncharted territory, reading manuals when all else fails.  
  
Personal mission: to co-create a world of technology at the service of human dignity.
speaking_engagements: Podcast interview on Talking Design Engineering by Makelab discussing Vision Controlled Jetting technology; Interview on The Fundable Founder podcast about Inkbit's spinout and funding; Featured in MIT Startup Exchange article about Inkbit's innovative 3D printer technology
reasoning: Davide Marini demonstrates a strong pattern of technical innovation and entrepreneurial success, having founded and led two MIT spinout companies. His current role as CEO of Inkbit and previous success with Firefly BioWorks show proven operational capability and technical expertise. The publication of his technologies in prestigious journals (Nature and Science) and his deep technical background (MIT PhD, Harvard postdoc) indicate strong execution ability. While there's evidence of successful company building, without clear exit values or funding amounts for Firefly BioWorks, and with Inkbit still in growth stage, a conservative L4 classification is appropriate rather than L5 or higher.

name: James Matheson
title: Co-founder at Carta Healthcare
about:
As a co-founder and Chief Strategy Officer at Carta Healthcare, I am deeply committed to our mission of empowering clinicians and driving operational improvements through the strategic application of AI. We aim to enhance patient-centric care decisions without disrupting existing infrastructure or workflows.

My entrepreneurial journey began with the founding of Trext, a platform that has revolutionized customer interaction by introducing automated, interactive SMS text messaging. This venture brought my vision of dynamic and responsive communication tools to life.

In addition, I've contributed to initiatives like Pando Pooling, where I assisted in developing career protection solutions for individuals in high-volatility professions. My experience in strategic consulting has honed my skills in analyzing complex scenarios and devising efficient, strategic solutions.

I have a rich background in behavioral economics and AI, spurred by my curiosity about how software can model cognitive biases to enhance our understanding of decision-making processes. Having grown up around healthcare (with my father initiating BCG’s healthcare practice), my interest in healthcare SaaS has naturally grown over time. I am particularly keen on leveraging these experiences and insights to continue driving innovation in healthcare technology.

A serial entrepreneur with three exits, his past ventures include Boxer, a Webby-nominated mobile app used by tens of millions, and Ciphent, ranked #16 on the Inc. 500. Andrew brings 20+ years of experience building enterprise platforms and consumer products that scale.

Andrew began his career as a software architect working with NASA, i2 technologies, and the US Marine Corps. and graduated Summa Cum Laude from Virgina Tech with a degree in Management Information Technology.  

Andrew lives in Austin TX with his wife, two daughters and champion “Dock Dog” Sophie.​

name: Dave DeCaprio
title: AI-powered objective brain health assessments
about:
Dave has over 20 years of experience transitioning advanced technology from academic research labs into successful businesses.  His experience includes genome research, pharmaceutical development, health insurance, computer vision, sports analytics, speech recognition, transportation logistics, operations research, real time collaboration, robotics, and financial markets.  

Dave has been involved in several successful startups as well as consulting and advising both small and large organizations on how to innovate using technology with maximum impact.  As part of the Human Genome Project, he was responsible for mapping all known biology onto the newly developed genome sequences.  At Bluefin Labs, acquired by Twitter in 2014, he helped the founders recruit a team and go from concept to a launch with the NFL in 13 weeks.  At GNS Healthcare, he led the development of their first in class causal machine learning platform.

Dave graduated from MIT with a degree in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science and currently lives in Austin, TX.

name: Gideon Mendels
title: Co-Founder and CEO @ Comet  | Where AI Developers Build
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Prior to Comet, I was a data scientist at Columbia University, Groupwize, and Google working mostly on NLP tasks (document classification, language modeling, code switch detection, keyword search). In many cases, I was asked to tackle a machine learning project where there was no record of how the previous models had been built, what worked and what didn’t. It was like starting from scratch. That’s when I came up with the idea for Comet.

Comet is doing for Machine Learning what GitHub did for code. We allow data scientists to automagically track their datasets, code changes, experimentation history, and models creating efficiency, transparency, and reproducibility. From training to production. 

*** We are currently hiring for multiple positions! ***
https://www.comet.ml/site/career/

In my free time, I enjoy running and playing guitar.

To reach out, feel free to message me on LinkedIn or email me at gideon.mendels@comet.ml.

name: Aldo Carrascoso
title: CEO and Co-Founder at Vivum AI
about:
Aldo is currently the Co-Founder and CEO of Vivum AI , a leading Evolutionary AI (E-AI) company specializing in autonomous vehicles, robotics, and edge devices. ViVum's advanced computing platform simulates human brain neural circuitry, enhancing bio-inspired computing. It employs dynamic neural models like liquid time-constant networks and CTRNNs. ViVum's architecture-agnostic coprocessors, both physical and virtual, efficiently handle diverse AI tasks, reducing energy consumption and computational challenges for complex AI inferencing.

Prior to ViVum, Aldo, in collaboration with Nobel Laureate Dr. Carolyn Bertozzi and Dr. Carlito Lebrilla, co-founded InterVenn Biosciences in 2016. InterVenn has made significant strides in the field of glycoproteomics, transforming early disease detection through liquid biopsies, particularly in the areas of cancer, autoimmune, neurodegenerative, infectious, and reproductive diseases. Their innovative technologies have led to the development of pioneering diagnostics and treatments such as Dawn™ for Immunotherapy, Glori™ for Ovarian Cancer, and GlycoKnow™ for Colorectal Cancer. Aldo’s entrepreneurial journey also includes the establishment of Veem, a global payment processor, in 2013, and Jukin Media, a leading user-generated content licensing company, in 2009. These ventures have collectively generated over $1 billion in investor value.

In addition to his business ventures, Aldo is an active angel investor and holds an MBA from Babson College and a BS from Ateneo De Manila University.

speaking_engagements: Presented at the Bank of America 2022 Healthcare Conference
notable_achievements: Founded Veem, a global payments platform; Founded Jukin Media; Founded InterVenn Biosciences and served as CEO for six years; Raised $45 million over two funding rounds before a $201 million Series C led by SoftBank

name: Carlito Lebrilla
title: Distinguished Professor UC Davis. Co-Founder Infinant Health, Co-Founder InterVenn Bio, Co-Founder BCD Bioscience, Co-Founder Matrubials
about: Dr. Carlito B. Lebrilla is a Distinguished Professor at the University of California, Davis in the Department of Chemistry and Biochemistry and Molecular Medicine in the School of Medicine. He received his BS degree from the University of California, Irvine and Ph.D. from the University of California, Berkeley. He was an Alexander von Humboldt Fellow and a NSF-NATO Fellow at the Technical University in Berlin. He returned to the UC Irvine as a President’s Fellow and has been at UC Davis since 1989.  He has served as Chair of the Chemistry Department. His research is in Analytical Chemistry, primarily mass spectrometry with applications to clinical glycomics and biofunctional food.  He has nearly 500 peer-reviewed publications.  He is also Co-Chief editor of Mass Spectrometry Reviews and has been on the editorial board of Molecular and Cellular Proteomics, Mass Spectrometry Reviews, Journal of American Society for Mass Spectrometry, European Mass Spectrometry, and International Journal of Mass Spectrometry.

name: Dr. Venkateshwaran Loganathan
title: Engineering Leader | Director of Engineering @ ConverSight | Building Scalable SaaS Platforms | AI/ML | Cloud | DevOps | PLG
about:
With over 17 years of experience across engineering, product, and AI-driven innovation, I currently serve as the Director of Engineering at ConverSight, an AI-first decision intelligence platform transforming the way businesses interact with data.

I lead the design and development of scalable systems that power conversational analytics and intelligent decision-making across supply chains and enterprise functions. My focus lies at the intersection of product-led growth, real-time engineering, and responsible AI adoption — ensuring our platforms are not just innovative, but also intuitive, reliable, and impactful.

My journey combines a strong academic foundation — an MS in Software Systems, PhD in Computer Science and Engineering, and a PGDBA in HRM — with practical leadership across cross-functional teams. I work closely with product managers, designers, engineers, and data scientists to turn ideas into well-crafted, customer-centric solutions.

Beyond engineering, I’m passionate about how AI is shaping everyday life — from shop floors to school presentations — and believe in building systems that empower people, not replace them. I’m a strong advocate for ethical AI, continuous learning, and human-in-the-loop design.

If you're exploring how to build or scale AI-first products, transform engineering culture, or drive growth through product and platform thinking — I’d love to connect.

name: Christoph Kreisbeck
title: Chief Executive Officer, Aixelo Inc.
about:
Dr. Christoph Kreisbeck is the founder and CEO of Aixelo Inc., a Cambridge, Mass.-based technology company providing the chemicals and materials industry with enterprise software that integrates AI-optimized decision-making into a modernized R&D process. An accomplished pioneer in accelerated material discovery, Christoph has a proven track record developing conceptional frameworks toward an AI-integrated laboratory robot system, integrating simulation, machine learning and other digital technologies to spawn new research methodologies and concepts. Christoph’s areas of expertise include the computational characterization of energy transport in light-active proteins and organic materials via structure-based methods as well as machine learning tools.

Prior to launching Aixelo, Christoph co-founded Kebotix, a technology platform company for new chemicals and materials where, as chief product officer and later chief commercial officer, he oversaw contract innovation projects and secured successful partnerships with tier-1 multinational companies. Under his leadership, Christoph’s team won the prestigious new product award for Kebotix’s AI-assisted retrosynthesis software at SLAS 2022. In the past decade, Christoph was a postdoctoral researcher at Harvard University and Humboldt University of Berlin. During that period, he spent nearly two years as a software engineer in Germany, focusing on automated driving. Christoph earned his Ph.D. in physics from the University of Regensburg in Germany.

name: Dennis Sheberla
title: Founder and CTO at Kebotix
about:
Dr. Dennis Sheberla brings to his role of Kebotix’s chief technology officer (CTO) an impressive multi-disciplinary background and passion to not only automate and discover fast new materials, but to apply these uses of AI, machine learning and robotics for a better world. As the start-up’s CTO, Dennis is responsible for overseeing and integrating technical and technological aspects of building such platforms as a self-driving lab.

A self-described interdisciplinary scientist, engineer and entrepreneur, Dennis said Kebotix and its mission – to accelerate the discovery of new materials in order to build a better world – combine for the right career opportunity at the right time.

Dennis’ interdisciplinary expertise is in synthetic organic chemistry, device fabrication and characterization, in addition to computational chemistry, machine learning and computer science. Prior to Kebotix, he was a postdoctoral associate in the Department of Chemistry at both Harvard from 2016-2018 and Massachusetts Institute of Technology from 2013 to 2016. Among Dennis’ accomplishments at each, respectfully, were predicting new singlet fission materials for organic photovoltaics via a combination of computational chemistry, software engineering and machine learning; and discovering a new family of one of the most electrically conductive porous materials known today. Before coming to Cambridge, Mass., Dennis from 2010 to 2013 served in a similar capacity at the Weizmann Institute of Science in Israel, where he significantly improved properties of polyfurans (conductive polymers), among other accomplishments.

As an entrepreneur, Dennis prior to Kebotix co-founded Netwill Computer Communications and the non-profit organization Interface, and founded iVenera, the most popular online dating website focused on Israel’s Russian community.

name: Kevin Gaffney
title: Capacity Bio Co-Founder, VP of Research, UA Research Professor
about:
Highlights of my research activities towards my Ph.D. include:

•	GPCR: Designed and synthesized orthosteric agonists and antagonists, and allosteric antagonists using GPCR homology modeling based on my own single point mutation data, induced-fit docking, and ligand-based design.

•	Transcription Factors and Nuclear Enzymes: Combined key interactions from virtual screening hits with structural information from native ligands to design synthetically accessible small molecules with potent activities in disrupting protein-protein interactions and showed ligand-protein binding through 19F NMR.

•	Drug Repurposing: Developed novel therapeutics for cancer through the synthetic optimization of off-target anti-cancer activities of anti-inflammatory drugs.

•	Data Mining: Developed an automated process that segmented both proteome and bioactive peptides into 4-8mer peptide fragments and compared these using parameters such as the sequence, amino acid distribution, and solubility to define the active peptide chemical space.

Over the past 20+ years, I've had the good fortune to have been involved in building some extremely successful businesses, work with amazingly talented people and work with some of the worlds largest companies.

Along the way, have experienced being #1 in The Business Journals Fast 50, made the Inc 500 and have worked with over 25% of the Fortune 500.

And have worked as Board Member / Advisor to many businesses that have achieved great success Health Simple (acquired by J&J), Hollywood Fashion Secrets (acquired by American international Industries), I See Me (acquired by PlanetArt), BrokerBin (www.brokerbin.com) among others.

Along the way, founded the Minnesota Cup (www.mncup.org), the largest state wide business plan competition in the US and have been on the Board of Advocates for Backpack (www.backpackumn.com/), a student run marketing and communications agency out of U of M CLA.

name: Min Chen
title: Co-founder @ Wisy | AI Co-pilot for CPG Brands
about:
I have lived an entrepreneur's life since I was 4 years old when my parents decided to migrate from China to Panama with only $800. We built a business in a foreign country when we were nobody and had nothing, when we couldn't speak the language and were not employable. I had responsibilities since I was very young, learning what it means to work hard and what it is to lose everything and start over during the US invasion to Panama in 1989. I learned that anything is achievable with a vision, constant determination, growing talent, and endless resilience. 

I have achieved everything I have set my mind to, including high salaries and shares at multinational companies, traveling the world, working in Silicon Valley, getting a Fulbright and other scholarships to go to Carnegie Mellon, UC Berkeley and Stanford University, and leading a program to support girls and women in STEM at a global scale. I founded and ran Alcenit Consulting for 10 years generating millions of dollars in revenue. I most recent years, I have been committed to building, Wisy, a global startup to solve society's most pressing problems with technology, data and AI. To make this dream happen I had to risk everything, but I have been training all my life for this.

about:
Nélida Gómez Quintero is an innovation and technology manager with extensive experience in both academic and industry settings across various fields. Currently, she is conducting research on entrepreneurial ecosystems at the University of Queensland Business School in Australia as part of a project supported by the Australian Research Council's Centre of Excellence in Synthetic Biology and the UQ Business School.

Nélida serves as a board director and startup advisor and co-founded a startup. She is a member of the IEEE TEMS Board of Governors and a Member-at-Large in the Technical Activities and Governance Committees. She was part of the initial co-founding team of Wisy, Inc. (now Wisy Platforms, Inc.), where she developed diverse competencies. Being involved in a high-tech startup from its inception gave her valuable experience, particularly in value creation and de-risking business models.

Her interests include building ecosystems, fostering relationships, and empowering early-stage entrepreneurs to create value-focused business models. She believes in collective human transformation and sees business and technology as tools to reshape social systems and organizations. This passion drives her volunteer efforts with several NGOs and Fundación CREEA, a nonprofit organization she co-founded with three other entrepreneurs, aimed at designing and implementing programs in entrepreneurship, informal education, culture, and social innovation.
 
Nélida has 30 years of professional experience, encompassing strategic and competitive intelligence, sustainability, venture and grant fundraising, research, biotechnology, internationalization, entrepreneurship, program content and coordination, and strategic foresight. Her skills offer innovative perspectives on strategies and processes within organizational settings. 

She has authored scientific and opinion articles and participated in international conferences and discussions, including Google Women Techmakers. Nélida is a Fulbright, DAAD, and Australian scholar. Her diverse ethnic background and extensive travel experiences enhance her ability to connect with others.

name: Jens Hilgers
title: Serial Entrepreneur in Esports and Gaming since 1997
about:
I am a serial entrepreneur with my primary interest in esports, videogames and online technologies. Having build my first videogame online tournaments, lan-events and gameserver farms as early as 1998 I'd consider myself a veteran in the Esports industry.

Building companies and making ideas become reality is what I really love. Outstanding user experience, agility, transparency and sustainability are the core principles of my daily work. I am a creative thinker, problem solver and quick learner. I team up with ambitious and smart people of upright character. 

For 23 years now i have been building and managing international games&tech companies in Central and Eastern Europe aswell as in Asia. Since 2012 i am actively investing in and supporting selected startups in the Games&Esports space, nowadays dominantly through my Venture Fund BITKRAFT Esports Ventures.

Many of the most innovative and leading assets in the Esports space have been founded or supported by myself: ESL - Largest Esports tournament production and marketing, BITKRAFT - worlds first and only Esports VC, BAYES (formerly DOJO Madness) - leading esports big data company, G2 Esports - Leading Western Esports Team, The Esports Observer - Largest Esports Business platform, runtime.gg - first performance nutrition brand in esports, epics.gg - first and leading digital trading card game in esports. 

Specialties: Company building, Investment and Investment Portfolio Management, Definition and Iteration of Vision&Strategy for Business and Product, (International) Business Development and Deployment, Mergers and Acquisitions, Project Management and Execution, Fundraising, (Live) Presentations / Coachings.
