about:
Leo Russell is the CEO and Founder of Pride Global. Pride Global (f/k/a PRIDE Technologies) was founded in 1983 with a focus on providing IT services to financial institutions.

Over the years, Leo diversified the core functions of Pride Global to include human capital solutions including vendor management, payroll and passthrough services, business process optimization, leadership development, and complete staffing services for both direct hire and contingent labor solutions.

Currently, Pride Global employs 3,000 associates over a broad geographic area, with offices throughout the United States, Canada, India, and Brazil. As featured in Crain’s New York Business, Leo has grown Pride Global to be the largest minority-owned vendor management and staffing firm, as well as the 5th largest minority-owned company in the New York Area.

Leo previously held senior leadership positions at Young & Rubicam and Lehman Brothers. He received a Bachelor of Arts Degree in Economics from Claremont Men’s College and is an alumnus of the Harvard Business School.

name: Arye Barnehama
title: CEO of Elementary
about:
PRODUCT LEADER & SERIAL ENTREPRENEUR | AI & ROBOTICS FOR THE INDUSTRIAL ENTERPRISE
I’m a serial entrepreneur and the Founder/CEO of Elementary, where we’re revolutionizing industrial manufacturing through AI-driven computer vision. We recently raised a 30M USD Series B led by Tiger Global and collaborated with Rockwell Automation on FactoryTalk(R) Vision AI—a groundbreaking product that brings autonomous manufacturing capabilities to some of the world’s largest production lines.

DRIVING GROWTH & STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS
As our company scales, my role has evolved to include managing Fortune 500 relationships at a strategic level. I oversee product roadmaps, direct cross-functional teams, and guide large enterprise partners to align on long-term innovation strategies.

BUILDING HIGH-PERFORMANCE TEAMS
I’ve recruited top leaders (from Amazon Robotics, Cylance, Palo Alto Networks) who share my commitment to technical excellence and user-centric design. Together, we’ve built a culture of engineering rigor, agile execution, and consistent value delivery.

THOUGHT LEADERSHIP & INDUSTRY PRESENCE
I regularly speak on the intersection of AI, robotics, and human-centered design—most recently at Connected Manufacturing 2024 and Automate 2024. I’m always exploring how ML and computer vision can redefine quality assurance and supply chain operations on a global scale.

PRODUCT LEADERSHIP PHILOSOPHY
Human-Centered Design: Build advanced AI and robotics that truly address frontline needs and drive adoption.
Scalability and Impact: Develop solutions that scale seamlessly across multiple facilities, yielding immediate ROI.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Align engineering, product, and business teams in a data-driven, iterative process.
Strategic Partnership Alignment: Cultivate robust relationships with enterprise clients and industry partners, anticipating and shaping market shifts.

LET’S CONNECT
Reach out to discuss product management opportunities, enterprise AI deployments, or building high-performing teams for the future of autonomous manufacturing.

name: Kurt Amundson
title: Co-Founder, VP of Engineering at LUUM Robotics
about:
I am VP of Engineering at LUUM Precision lash where I lead development of our systems for automated eyelash extension application.  We’ve been working for more than five years to bring robotic automation solutions to the beauty industry, and have developed the first system capable of autonomously applying eyelash extensions to a person.  This has required the coordination of mechanical, software, electrical, and computer vision systems, including both classical and neural network-based (AI) approaches.  My passion is in working at the intersection of these various engineering disciplines.

Previous to LUUM I led engineering teams at Ekso Bionics in both the medical and able-bodied spaces and was the PI on a number of government funded research projects.  Prior to Ekso I received my PhD in mechanical engineering from UC Berkeley where my thesis showed the first metabolic cost reduction achieved on a human exoskeleton.  I am an inventor on 19 granted US patents to date, with more cases pending.
notable_achievements: Former U.S. Navy SEAL; Accomplished Silicon Valley professional

And, I ran a public company for more than two years, which left me with a great understanding of corporations and even the most arcane preferred stock and warrant provisions.

name: Andre Esteva
title: Co-Founder & CEO, ArteraAI | TIME100 Health
about:
Andre Esteva, PhD, is an American entrepreneur and AI scientist. He is CEO and Co-Founder of ArteraAI, a medical AI company that personalizes cancer therapy, is standard of care (NCCN Guidelines), reimbursed by Medicare, and deployed internationally. ArteraAI was named a TIME 2024 Best Invention and selected for the World Economic Forum's Global Innovators as one of the world's top growth-stage companies.

He was named to the 2025 TIME100 Health list—TIME Magazine's recognition of the most influential people in health—and to Modern Healthcare's 40 Under 40 for 2025. He has co-founded four companies with a combined market cap of $2.2B. Previously, he was Head of Medical AI at Salesforce Research, and held engineering roles at Google Research, Sandia National Labs, and GE Healthcare.

His research has been cited over 25,000 times. His publications have appeared on the covers of Nature and Nature Medicine—the first to show AI matching doctors at diagnosis. His work is featured in Cell, The Lancet, NeurIPS, TIME, and widely covered by the WSJ, Fortune, BBC, The Economist, and hundreds of outlets.

He earned his PhD in Computer Vision at Stanford, and graduated with highest honors in Electrical Engineering and Pure Math from UT-Austin, where he was Engineering Valedictorian.

He holds a Bachelor's and Master's degree in Civil Engineering from Tsinghua University, and a Ph.D. in Transportation Systems Engineering from the State University of New York at Buffalo. name: Yuval Man
title: Co-Founder & CEO of DigitalOwl | Using AI to turn medical analysis into a competitive advantage
about:
Risk management in the insurance industry fascinates me, particularly in the Life, Disability, W/C, and LTC sectors.

During my time as a personal injury lawyer, I analyzed thousands of medical records for the purpose of evaluating claims cost, benefits worth, length of liability period, and forecasting the medical effect of the injury.
Access to data is central to risk management. The more you know, the lower the risk.
I was obsessed with finding a better way to evaluate and summarize medical information for underwriting and claim analysis.
In 2018, my brother Amit who is an artificial intelligence expert, and I decided to build a company that will use AI and Natural Language Processing to understand any kind of medical record (APS, EHR, EMR, etc.) and to extract all the medical information into a meaningful report. The extracted information is presented chronologically, allowing users to search and filter by condition, date, body part, body system, and provider.

It has been our privilege to build such an awesome company with such a talented team as DigitalOwl. DigitalOwl is a graduate of the Israel Security Agency and Tel Aviv University’s The Xcelerator, the prestigious Fusion LA Accelerator, the unique Deloitte LaunchPad program, IBM Alfa Zone program, and the world’s largest InsurTech program Plug and Play.

name: Jeffery Reid
title: Leading Design, Product, Growth at Knowde.
about:
I lead Design, Product and Product-led Growth at Knowde where we're collaborating with our customers to digitally transform the global Chemical Industry. 

Every human-made product on earth traces its roots to chemistry. From toy rockets to space stations, from Q-tips to qubits - chemistry makes every product innovation possible: It's the lattice upon which we all build. Knowde is transforming this $5 trillion chemical industry starting with the creation of a global marketplace where people can crush the product innovation cycle down from years to days. We’re doing this by connecting customers and producers early in the product development cycle where they can research, discover, collaborate, negotiate and purchase chemistry, polymers and ingredients quickly and repeatedly with a level of collaboration never before seen.

Before Knowde, I conceived, led and delivered major product and brand initiatives for Nike, Starbucks, Dell, Microsoft, ATI metals, Universal Studios, Warner Bros., Deluxe Entertainment, Panavision, Tommy Bahama, ChemPoint, Weyerhaeuser, DHL/Airborne Express, Red Bull, Franklin Covey, and others. I led the Product practice for a global digital consultancy based in Chicago and was a GM for Sports Illustrated Play, where I built various key products and stood up their creative delivery team. Also, I was SVP of Product for Mevio, a venture-backed (Sequioa & Kleiner) media and entertainment start-up.
speaking_engagements: Participated in a digital selling event alongside Knowde's CEO and guest speaker Joe Harlan
notable_achievements: Co-founder of Regeneron Genetics Center®; Pioneered cloud computing adoption in genomics; Inducted into NATAS Southeast Emmy Chapter Silver Circle Hall of Fame
reasoning: The founder demonstrates significant executive-level experience at both startups and major corporations, fitting the L4 'Proven Operators with Executive Experience' profile. His role as Chief Product Officer at Knowde and previous executive positions (SVP of Product at Mevio, GM at Sports Illustrated Play) show proven operational leadership. The venture backing from top-tier VCs (Sequoia & Kleiner) at Mevio adds credibility. However, while he has extensive experience, there's no clear evidence of personal exits or founding multiple companies, which would be needed for higher classifications.

about:
Buildings directly impact the life of billions of people and quality of the environment at large. We built Facilio to transform the way buildings are managed across geography; to create fast, delightful and healthier experiences. 


Facilio is an elegantly crafted facilities management software suite that unifies building operations, maintenance and sustainability performance across portfolio. We’ve reimagined the way facilities teams interact with buildings through IoT-driven web and mobile applications that connects disparate systems, people, and machines in real-time.

Buildings today need to shift from traditional, tactical facilities management towards smarter, predictive facilities experience. We’ve created Facilio to help you take that step.

name: Prabhu Ramachandran
title: Founder and CEO at Facilio Inc (Enabling Data-driven Building Operations)
about:
Prabhu has an extensive track record of creating successful enterprise software product lines and implementing data-driven solutions for large telecom companies during his previous stint. His ‘eureka’ moment came in 2017, when he spotted a significant gap in the built environment industry - facility managers were stuck in the past, still using clunky, on-prem systems to run their buildings. 

That's when he thought, "Why not use IoT and SaaS to connect sensors, crunch data, and supercharge building efficiency?" The possible applications and potential for such a solution seemed endless. Thus Facilio was born.

Today, Facilio manages over 200 million square feet of built space across continents,  empowering companies to transform their building portfolios into beacons of efficiency, sustainability, and productivity.

Passionate about this collective vision, Prabhu is actively involved in international communities and advocates how technology can be leveraged to drive environmentally responsible facilities that create a positive impact on the world.

name: Dario Medina
title: Entrepreneur & Executive
about:
Throughout his acclaimed and reputable career, Dario Medina has become known as a well-respected and innovative real estate leader. After more than 16 years serving residential real estate clients as an expert market analyst, tireless advocate, coach and fierce negotiator, he's officially open for new real estate opportunities. 

Dario brings an incredible passion for the real estate industry and an unwavering dedication to providing the highest level of concierge services for his agents and partners. He believes in a hands-on, transparent approach to business, and has spent years building and maintaining countless relationships with contractors, attorneys, mortgage brokers, and industry peers. These partnerships have lasted well beyond any transaction and are a testament to the respect and dedication he has for his craft. 

Dario is deeply ingrained in the Hinsdale community. He is involved in the school system, supports local businesses, and has spent his time forging personal and professional relationships with its residents and vendors. He brings an unmatched level of expertise and enthusiasm to an industry that demands both. 
Work/life balance is a crucial key to Dario’s success, and when he is not communicating thoroughly on behalf of his clients, he is likely basking in the glow of the home he shares with Candace and Sofia. He knows firsthand the importance of finding the perfect home, and in having the opportunity to build the ideal lifestyle for one’s family, in a place where they can feel safe and secure.  

His professional passion, however, has always been fueled by an innate desire to recruit, coach and mentor his fellow agents, sharing experiences that can benefit the company and individual professionals alike. He believes that lifelong coaching is essential for continuity, consistency, and success in any dedicated agent’s career. His leadership and influence, as well as his keen sales and marketing acumen, have already contributed to an incredibly successful and distinguished career path, one that will continue to expand and inspire for years to come
experience_2_company: Better Homes and Gardens County Line · Full-time
speaking_engagements: Q&A interview on RiseKit news site

name: Dominique Wilson
title: Global Social Impact Leader | Driving Economic Mobility and Community Empowerment
about:
With over 18 years of experience in global development, social impact, and economic mobility, I have dedicated my career to scaling initiatives that create lasting opportunities for underserved communities. I specialize in building strategic partnerships that bridge the gap between nonprofits, for-profits, investors, and donors to drive measurable growth and meaningful impact.

As Associate Director of Corporate Partnerships for the Pritzker Tech Talent Labs at Discovery Partners Institute (DPI), I’ve been part of the founding team, leading efforts to build corporate partnerships that hire diverse talent in the tech industry, fueling job creation and economic opportunity.

In addition to my work at DPI, I serve as Co-Founder and Strategic Advisor at RiseKit, a platform that connects underserved community members across the U.S. to job opportunities and critical nonprofit resources. By partnering with foundations, government systems, companies, and nonprofits, we are creating pathways to economic mobility for those often left behind.

I also contribute as a Board Member of Simba Technology Revolutions, an organization that equips startups worldwide with top engineering and tech talent from Africa, fostering innovation and growth on a global scale.

Throughout these roles, I remain committed to amplifying voices often excluded from decision-making spaces, creating equitable opportunities, and driving systems-level change.

Outside of work, I’m an avid chess player and lifelong learner with a passion for travel. Having lived in Africa and explored over 20 countries, I believe in the power of global perspectives to inspire solutions for local challenges.
education_2_school: The Washington Center for Internships and Academic Seminars
education_2_degree: Professional Track: International Development, Civic Engagement: Ensuring Access to Education & Grassroots Organizing
speaking_engagements: Interview on Black Businesses Matter podcast discussing RiseKit and economic mobility
reasoning: Dominique Wilson demonstrates significant professional experience and management expertise in social impact and economic development, fitting the L3 'Technical and Management Veterans' profile. While she has co-founded RiseKit and has extensive experience (18+ years), there's no clear evidence of major exits or significant funding rounds that would qualify for higher levels. name: Matt Strauss
title: President, Strategic Partnerships & Founder @ RiseKit |  Social Impact Innovator, Community Engagement, GovTech, EdTech, ImpactTech, HealthTech, Entrepreneurship, Board Member, Advisor | Chicago Sports & Liverpool Fan
about:
President of Partnerships & Founder of RiseKit with a proven track record of driving revenue and scaling strategic relationships. Successfully built and expanded partnerships that generated consistent referrals, secured RFP wins, and delivered $1M+ in annual closed business. Skilled at transforming sales from traditional cold outreach to a modern, thought-leadership and partnerdriven model. Ready to bring this expertise to an innovative company—whether launching, scaling, or redefining partnerships— by maximizing inbound opportunities, creating impactful content, and fostering relationships through unique events, webinars, and experiences that keep the brand top of mind and continuously included in sales opportunities.

--- 
Matt's Story: 

Matt’s passion for solving social problems began through his volunteer work mentoring youth from under-resourced communities across Chicago. In 2017, after mentoring more than 20 individuals, he recognized a deeper systemic issue: the lack of coordinated access to workforce resources, job opportunities, and support networks. This realization sparked the idea for RiseKit—a software platform designed to transform how nonprofits, employers, government systems, and community foundations collaborate to find, train, and support job seekers. RiseKit not only saves time for workforce stakeholders but also captures powerful data to help communities and cities organize more effectively around economic mobility.

As Founder and President of RiseKit, Matt continues to lead with the core belief that a person’s zip code should never define their future. He’s always eager to connect with innovative, mission-driven leaders who share his vision for equity, systems change, and social impact.

Matt brings over a decade of experience in community engagement, volunteerism, management, social entrepreneurship, sales, and fundraising. He also mentors and advises emerging social impact entrepreneurs, helping them navigate growth and scale their missions.

In his free time, Matt enjoys spending time with his wife, volunteering with local nonprofits, cheering on Chicago sports teams and Liverpool FC, playing pickleball or golf, and relaxing with family and friends.

name: Musheer Ahmed
title: CEO & Founder at Codoxo | AI Solutions for Healthcare
about:
A significant portion of our healthcare spend, up to $380 billion dollars and growing each year, is lost to fraud, waste and abuse. I founded Codoxo (formerly named FraudScope) to help make our healthcare system more affordable and effective. Codoxo’s Forensic AI Platform uses a patented algorithm to identify problems and suspicious behavior earlier than traditional techniques which helps ensure our scarce healthcare dollars go to real patient care. We're already finding millions of dollars of fraud, waste and abuse for large health insurance companies and government agencies. 

Codoxo’s technology was developed as a part of my PhD dissertation at Georgia Institute of Technology. A report by the JASON advisory group, the prestigious scientific advisory panel to the US government, reinforced that my doctoral research tackled some of the biggest challenges within the emerging health data infrastructure in the United States. I was honored to be included in the 40 Under 40 lists by Georgia Tech, Atlanta Business Chronicle, and ISB. When I'm not fighting healthcare fraud, you'll find me volunteering for various causes and spending time with my family. 

If you believe in the same mission and would like to bring innovation to a space that hasn't seen much change, I’d love to connect so we can work together either as members of the same team, collaborators or partners. I'm open to media inquiries around healthcare fraud, waste and abuse in general.

name: Srivatsan Laxman
title: CEO at TrueLark
about:
I am an entrepreneur with expertise in Artificial Intelligence.

TrueLark is an AI-powered automated customer communication platform. Our patented MIDGO conversational AI technology helps brands attract, support and up-sell customers round-the-clock via text and messaging. Our solution engages customers through human-like conversations on a range of triggers and drives a comprehensive set of outcomes, ensuring businesses need to step-in and follow-up in less than 10% of cases.

My earlier venture, Scibler, was an automatic assistant on the phone, that discovered an agenda for you every day, with appointments, tasks and timely updates from important people. Scibler simplified, often eliminated, calendaring and email management chores, so you would stop making lists and just focussed on getting things done.

My previous work has spanned many different application domains including, conversational artificial intelligence, search & ads, bioinformatics, computational biology, computer security and manufacturing. (Google Scholar profile: https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&user=9bu4OBIAAAAJ)

I love to build intelligent systems that can learn to predict, summarize, recommend, and take action, and I believe that smart technologies will simplify, penetrate and enrich our lives in super exciting new ways.

name: Motilal Agrawal
title: seasoned executive with deep experience in retail and AI.
about:
I started my research career with perception for unmanned vehicles as a computer scientist at SRI International after my Ph.D. in 3D computer vision. Over the course of my 12 years career at SRI, I worked on various robotics and computer vision projects – prototyping them and deploying them for various clients like DARPA and IARPA, collaborating with researchers and faculty at CMU, Stanford, Upenn, NYU, etc. I was one of the early advocates for data driven, deep learning (DL) computer vision at SRI for projects and created early prototypes in aerial surveillance and face recognition using DL.  

Realizing that this DL technology was revolutionary, I co-founded Zippin – a checkout free platform for shopping. Zippin’s mission is to enable frictionless shopping experience like online shopping. The underlying technology for Zippin is similar to autonomous vehicles. We make shopping friction-less and autonomous without needing cashiers just like AV makes driving autonomous. At its core, Zippin uses computer vision technology to make shopping autonomous without the risks of fatalities or accidents.

As a co-founder and chief scientist at Zippin for the last nine years, I have built the technology and the team from the ground up working on applications of deep learning for tracking, segmentation, activity recognition, calibration, 3D reconstruction, etc. I have managed large multi-disciplinary teams and projects to completion and deployment, understanding the business needs from technology perspective, actively mentoring managers, engineers, and interns, conducting design reviews, code reviews, incubating new research projects, and partnering with external vendors.

With a career spanning 22 years in computer vision research & development, directing and leading engineering teams, and broad engineering skills, I feel Its time to apply my experience and engineering leadership to other domains. My strengths lie in deep technical and research background, entrepreneurial spirit, and experience. I particularly enjoy solving hard problems through innovation.  I am a hands-on engineer cum researcher with a mindset to get the job done whether it be to design a new sensor, write firmware or a new multi-modal/foundational model for AI.

name: Steve Jillings
title: Chairman & CEO at Signal Technologies
about:
Steve has more than 30 years of business-building experience, specifically in the areas of corporate finance, sales, marketing and technology. He has been responsible for eight startups throughout his career, taking them from inception to commercialization and in several cases leading to successful liquidity events.

Steve is currently the Chairman & CEO of Signal Technologies. 

Signal is transforming the $15B US vehicle import market with the first comprehensive Vertical SaaS platform for Canadian new car dealers. Signal has eliminated traditional export barriers by integrating the entire export lifecycle into one seamless solution. Our platform creates an entirely new revenue stream for new car dealers, allowing them to appraise trades and aged inventory for export to the US. The Signal platform can increase dealer EBITDA up to $5M/year. Signal is the essential engine powering cross-border vehicle exports for Canadian dealers while capturing high-margin revenue throughout the export lifecycle.

Prior to Signal, Steve was the CEO at TeleSign where he raised $79MM in growth capital and lead TeleSign to become the #1 Company in the Two Factor Authentication and Digital Identity category. Starting with 12 employees and negligible revenue, Steve grew TeleSign to 300 employees and more than $100MM in profitable annual revenue. TeleSign was acquired by BICS October 2017.

Steve was also chairman and CEO of Vantage Media, an online digital marketing firm, where he and his investment partners raised $80MM to acquire in Vantage February 2007. Vantage Media grew into one of the largest performance-based online marketers in the country. 

As president and CEO of FrontBridge Technologies, Steve took the company from a startup to a global leader in SaaS email security services. Raising a total of $28MM of funding, this allowed the team to build a broad portfolio of services combined with the largest global distribution footprint in the email security category. This lead to the successful sale of FrontBridge to Microsoft in August 2005 for more than $200MM. 

Specialties: 
 - Helping start-ups grow rapidly
 - Ensuring that the Go-To-Market strategy is the right one. 
 - Raising money (I've raised more than $300m)
 - Product strategy
 - Sales and marketing strategy
 - Attracting the right people to win

name: Tyler Hall
title: Coaching the World’s Best CEOs & Organizations | Startup Advisor | Former Founder & CEO of Drivably (Acquired: NASDAQ ACVA)
about:
As the Founder and CEO of Drivably, there were a few things that plagued my ability to be the best CEO for the company. 

1 - I would experience constant burnout because I wasn't focused on things that created energy for me
2 - I would put on a different mask depending on which constituent I was talking to because I thought I needed to be who they wanted me to be, not who I really was
3 - My decision making would become plagued by fear of making the wrong decision
4 - I didn't have a solid playbook for how to be a first time founder & CEO

Having learned these things to hard way, but ultimately having a successful exit to a public company at the end of 2021, I have now taken what I've learned, and coupled that with a worldclass coaching framework created by Matt Mochary, and spend my time coaching the world's best founders & CEOs.

My greatest passion is working with passionate founders & CEOs in their pursuit of becoming great, and building a great company. When they experience exponential growth, it changes their life. When their life changes, it has the same effect on me.

Prior to my exit with Drivably, I led a world class global renewals team at HireVue which would eventually exit for $511m to the Carlyle Group. We developed one of the most robust processes around managing renewals and took our renewal rate from 64% to 94% in a matter of 12 months. 

Prior to joining HireVue I was early an early sales leader at DOMO, where we raised $900m in venture funding, and would ultimately go public (Nasdaq: DOMO) in 2018.

Most importantly, I am a husband and father to four beautiful children and an amazing wife!
education_1_degree: Ira A. Fulton Schools of Engineering, Technology Entrepreneurship and Management
speaking_engagements: Chief Interviewer for The Rollercoaster Podcast; CEO & Organizational Coach at Tyler Hall Coaching
notable_achievements: Founded Driveably, first American company backed by Porsche; Successfully sold Driveably to a Nasdaq-listed company

name: Morgan Linton
title: Cofounder + CTO at Bold Metrics
about:
a little about me, in Gonzo journalistic style...because that's just more fun right?!?

So there I was—deep in the weird and wonderful trenches, cofounder and CTO of Bold Metrics, pushing hard at the bleeding edge of what body data can truly do. You see, we're tapping into this strange digital alchemy, turning raw measurements into a personalized future—one that touches everything from the clothes we wear to the cars we drive, even reaching into how we get our health insurance or how sports teams pick players.

But between you and me, the real thrill isn't just the tech—it's the mad chaos of assembling a team, crafting a company culture that's as electric and alive as the ideas we chase. Because, dammit, I believe in a tomorrow where products are personalized to people. We're on the brink of a foundational shift, my friends, and I'm here for every wild second of it.

name: Naushad UzZaman
title: CTO/Co-Founder at Blackbird.AI
about:
As the Co-founder and CTO of Blackbird.AI, a silicon-valley born threat detection platform, I’ve led the charge in building our diverse team of highly specialized experts and data scientists. I oversee and work with the team to fulfill our mission which is to combat and detect information-derived harm through the use of artificial intelligence. We’ve built a unique series of scalable AI and network analysis modules to detect rare risk signals of threats. Our information intelligence platform is currently being used by a range of Fortune 500 companies, Global 2000s, and government organizations. In 2021, we partnered with PR-Giant Weber Shandwick to launch the world’s first Media Security Center. This emerged from our mutual concern around the growing and global information disorder crisis.

Before co-founding Blackbird.AI, I obtained my Ph.D. in Natural Language Processing and Artificial Intelligence from the University of Rochester. I have authored more than thirty peer-reviewed scientific papers and worked for the research divisions at Microsoft, Yahoo! Research, Nuance, and Bosch. In 2016,  I shifted my focus away from academia and research and headed towards the social enterprise arena. This led me to co-found Blackbird.AI.

Wasim Khaled is the CEO and Co-Founder of Blackbird.AI, an AI-driven Narrative Intelligence Platform.

A computer scientist by trade, Wasim has studied information operations, computational propaganda, behavioral science, AI and the applications of these combined disciplines to defense, cyber and risk intelligence. Wasim has consulted and advised government agencies and Fortune 500 companies on the risks and mitigation of the escalating information warfare.

Wasim is a member of the Social Intelligence Lab, a Senior Advisor at Interpublic Group’s Weber Shandwick Collective and the U.S. Department of State’s Global Engagement Center. He has been featured on TechCrunch, WIRED, Bloomberg, Forbes, Fortune and the New York Times.

about:
Graduated with dual-degree from MIT Electrical Engineering and Computer Science and MIT Integrated Design Management. MIT Graduate Woman of Excellence Award recipient, MIT Legatum Fellowship.

name: Laszlo Bock
title: 2x start-up founder & CEO --> 2 exits | x-Google SVP of People Operations | NYT bestselling author of "Work Rules!" | Founder/Faculty at Berkeley | Board at Stanford | CEO coach
about:
Laszlo is the founder and Co-Director of the Berkeley Transformative CHRO Leadership Academy and a member of the Board of the Stanford Center for the Advanced Study of the Behavioral Sciences. He founded, scaled and sold two companies (most recently to NVIDIA). Before that, he spent a decade as a member of the Executive Management Team at Google where he served as Senior Vice President of People Operations. His best-selling book, Work Rules!, has sold more than 750,000 copies with 100% of his book income donated to charity. He is an active investor and advisor in startups, with 55% of his portfolio companies going on to become unicorns and 80% having become unicorns or been acquired. Finally, he is also a documentary film and Broadway musical producer, with four Tony Award-nominated or -winning productions.

Laszlo was the founder and Chairman of Gretel.ai, the leader in synthetic data for AI (acquired by NVIDIA in 2025). He was also the founder, Chairman, and CEO of Humu, which used “nudges” to make people happier and more productive at work (acquired by Perceptyx in 2023). He has raised more than $150 million in venture capital funding.

From 2006 to 2016, Laszlo was the Senior Vice President of People Operations of Google/Alphabet, and a member of the executive management team. He grew the company from 6,000 to 75,000 employees while ensuring the culture remained innovative and robust. Laszlo co-led the creation of the field of “People Analytics”, the application of academic-quality rigor and Google-paced innovation to people management. He also co-led the development of the Google Job Search API, the only element of Google’s search engine developed outside of Google’s engineering organization. During his tenure, Google was named the #1 Best Company to Work for in the United States seven times as well as recognized over 150 times around the world as an exceptional employer. He was named “HR Executive of the Year”, “HR Executive of the Decade”, and elected to the National Academy of Human Resources. More than 150 of his team members have since become CHROs.

He is a sought-after speaker on workforce topics, AI, leadership and company-building. He has appeared on CNN, the Today Show, Good Morning America, NPR and the BBC; testified before Congress; and been quoted in and written for the New York Times, the Wall Street Journal, the Washington Post and Businessweek. He has worked with the Clinton, Biden and Harris Presidential Transition Teams and has been called on by various Presidential Administrations to provide counsel on workforce-related topics.

name: Jason Finkelstein
title: CMO at Numa | AI for Automotive Vertical
about:
I'm a 6x CMO, CRO, and President with a passion for building AI-native GTM teams that drive real, profitable growth. My career spans category-defining SaaS companies from $10M to $425M+ ARR, with ACVs ranging from $25K to $2M. Along the way, I've led high-output teams, shaped category strategy, and delivered exits ranging from $25M to $1.4B.

I’m currently CMO of Numa, vertical AI for automotive — where we're transforming how auto dealerships operate through AI agents. I previously led marketing at Gladly (AI-first CX platform), AdRoll (display retargeting pioneer for ecommerce), Traitify (acquired by Paradox AI), AVG (acquired by Avast for $1.4B) and Location Labs (acquired by AVG for $220M). I’ve also served as CRO, President, and CEO advisor across numerous B2B software businesses.

Where I Thrive
- Translating company vision into customer-facing category leadership and brand
- Creating sales velocity machines, more pipeline with larger $ and higher win rates
- Applying AI to unlock efficiency and scale for GTM workflows
- Leading, coaching, mentoring high-performing teams from 5 to 40+ incl full-stack Marketing, Sales, Sales Development, Customer Support

Notable Exits
- Location Labs → AVG ($220M)
- AVG → Avast ($1.4B)
- Traitify → Paradox.ai

Advisory Work
I advise growth-stage CEOs on GTM, strategy, positioning, category design and growth. Recent: NoFraud, Swellbox (acq. by Datavant), Alyce (acq. by Sendoso), Linqia, Disconnect, and Numa (prior to joining full-time).

name: Joel Grossman
title: Founder & President, Numa
about:
Founder & President at Numa, for the AI-Native Dealership. Backed by Threshold (DFJ), Costanoa Ventures, and Google's Gradient.

Before that, I was Chief Operating Officer of Location Labs, which I joined pre-revenue and was acquired by AVG for $220M in October 2014. In 2016, Location Labs delivered over $200M in gross revenue with $35M of EBITDA and during my active tenure, we retained 98% of our team. We designed, built, and operated mobile SaaS services used by millions of paying subscribers in partnership with mobile operators globally.

I love working with passionate teams that innovate on products that have a real impact on people's lives. My upbringing is product-heavy: I earned a computer science degree, spent a half-decade in Program Management, primarily UX, on Microsoft product teams (working on consumer products ranging from Windows to web services, to connected smart watches), and joined Location Labs running product management and marketing.

More recently, my product passion has evolved into a focus on building the Business, both the commercialization of the product(s) and the creation of a company that grows and adapts to the challenges--putting the people, culture, systems, and processes in place to develop a strong long-term organization.

name: Charles Cathlin
title: CEO of Polaris Genomics - Modernizing Mental Healthcare with Molecular Biomarkers
about:
An interdisciplinary engineer and life science entrepreneur with a vision to modernize mental health care. Charles served 20+ years as a military and public health engineer, assessing public health hazards and deploying technological solutions to protect and advance human health. He led scientific teams within the US Air Force, Office of the Secretary of Health, FDA, and TBI Center of Excellence.

Inspired by his work with first responders at Ground Zero and fellow military service members impacted by the conflicts that followed, Charles pivoted his career towards understanding the current approaches and solutions driving mental health outcomes. In 2017, Charles founded Polaris Genomics, leveraging genomics and machine learning to catalyze the discovery of mental health biomarkers. He currently leads a team of clinicians and researchers that’s developed a platform to advance the development of psychiatric drugs and objective diagnostic tools.

Born and raised in Brooklyn by a NYC subway mechanic and immigrant, Charles studied engineering at the Air Force Academy, public health at Uniformed Services University, and entrepreneurship at Stanford Graduate School of Business and Johns Hopkins Carey School of Business.

name: Peter C.W. Kim, MD, CM, PhD
title: Professor of Surgery and Pediatrics at Brown University
location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
about:
Dr. Kim is a Founder of Activ Surgical Inc and Co-Founder of eKare Inc. He was Vice President of the Sheikh Zayed Institute for Pediatric Surgical Innovation. Dr. Kim served as Associate Surgeon-in-Chief of the Joseph E. Robert, Jr., Center for Surgical Care at Children’s National. An internationally known pediatric surgeon and scientist, Dr. Kim creates value through team building, Innovation, cultural change and brand enhancement.

 Dr. Kim’s interests are in intelligent digital health, including image guidance and smart robotics; simulation technologies; and the potential of imaging technologies such as high frequency/intensity-focused ultrasound (HIFU) as non-invasive alternatives to conventional surgery. He was the lead for FDA funded National Capital Consortium for Pediatric Device Innovation (NCC-PDI) (www.innovate4kids.org). He led with the Innovation Institute and bioengineering team to pioneer  additive and tissue printing technologies  with an eye on developing personalized medicine for children.

Dr. Kim joined Children’s National from the Hospital for Sick Children in Toronto, Ontario, a national and international leading institution in pediatric research and care. There, he served as a general neonatal and thoracic surgeon, founding lead for the Centre for Image-Guided Innovation and Therapeutic Intervention (CIGITI), and senior associate scientist in the hospital’s research institute. His clinical specialties are complex surgical airway reconstructions, advanced minimally invasive surgery, and vascular reconstructive surgery for hepatobiliary diseases in children. 

Dr. Kim received his medical training, including the distinction of Master of Surgery, at McGill University. He completed his surgical residency training at the University of Toronto as well as his fellowship in pediatric surgery at the University’s Hospital for Sick Children.

name: Manisha Shah-Bugaj
title: Chief Executive Officer
about:
I have a long-standing career track record as a successful global medtech executive, key influencer and transformational leader, both globally and domestically. I’m proud to be an accomplished leader, specializing in the advancement of life-changing medical technologies. Currently, I am the CEO of Activ Surgical, a company with a vision to transform the collective surgical experience by leveraging emerging technologies and data into insights that make world-class surgery accessible for all.​

At Activ Surgical, we are focused on the commercialization of the ActivSight™ enhanced visualization imaging module and the implementation of the surgical visualization technology at established pilot hospital sites. 

Prior to joining Activ Surgical, I architected the gynecology unit at Olympus from the ground up in the U.S., ultimately serving as General Manager and Global Vice President for the company and played an integral role in expanding the gynecology business internationally. I have more than two decades of medtech experience, including building and implementing corporate business plans, directing regional and global businesses aligned to financial and operational targets, hiring and establishing new teams, and managing product portfolios.​

As a leader, I feel strongly that the team comes first, and an empowered, well-supported team is crucial for success. I'm dedicated to the growth, development and well-being of our team in the service of our mission.

name: Dima Plotnikov
title: Co-founder and CPO at Buddy.ai
about:
Buddy.ai is developing a voice-based virtual tutor to help every child on the planet speak English as a second language. To achieve this goal, I am drawing upon 15 years of expertise in product design and management for companies like Cubic.ai, Finolog, and Megaplan.

Though my roles differed, my task has always been the same: to build the right team and bring the concept to life. My specialty for the last decade has been voice-based products. At my previous position as a VP of Product for Cubic.ai, I applied Natural Language Understanding technology to the Smart Home field and built a digital butler – a voice-first assistant to control smart home devices. 

Before Cubic I led the design and development of B2B software products for Finolog and Megaplan. Was it finance (Finolog) or CRM (Megaplan) I always focused the team to build the best possible experience for customers. 

My work at Buddy.ai has been the most exciting and challenging of my career. By creating the first speech-based virtual tutor, we hope to offer children everywhere an affordable, personalized way to learn English. This mission is very personal to me as my two children are among the 500 million kids around the world learning to speak English as a second language.

name: Ivan Crewkov
title: Co-founder and CEO at Buddy.ai
about:
Co-founder and CEO at Buddy.ai. Voice tech and marketing expert. Entrepreneur.

For nearly a decade, I’ve created and marketed voice-first products. At Buddy.ai, we’re developing a voice-based virtual tutor to help every child on the planet speak English as a second language.  

Previously, I was a co-founder and CMO at Cubic.ai. Our company built one of the world’s first smart speakers and a voice-assistant app for smart homes. Cubic.ai was later acquired, and our proprietary technology became the base for Yandex Station, one of the world’s most popular smart speakers. 

I also have 15 years of expertise in product marketing. Prior to my time as CMO at Cubic, I founded Dominion Marketing, a boutique advertising agency in Siberia. As creative director, I received several international awards, including three from the Idea International Advertising Festival in Siberia.

Buddy.ai is my greatest passion. The inspiration came from my family’s experience immigrating to the United States. Seeing my children struggle to learn English showed me just how much kids need speaking practice to master the language. My oldest daughter became our first product tester and both kids continue to “rate” Buddy’s latest features today.
speaking_engagements: Speaker at Web Summit Rio 2025 on AI in education
notable_achievements: Raised $1 million in seed funding for MyBuddy.ai; Developed AI virtual tutor Buddy to help children learn English
reasoning: Ivan Crewkov demonstrates a strong track record as a proven operator with a successful exit through Cubic.ai, which was acquired by Yandex and became the foundation for a major product (Yandex Station). His experience combines both entrepreneurial success and deep domain expertise in voice technology. The acquisition by Yandex, a major tech company, and the technology's continued use in a successful product line suggests a meaningful exit, though the exact value isn't public. The combination of a successful exit, 15 years of marketing expertise, and founding multiple companies places him solidly in the L4 category as a proven operator with exit experience.

name: Carter Huffman
title: CTO, Co-Founder at Modulate
about: I'm passionate about understanding how software can represent and manipulate audio, in particular human speech!  Human perception of speech is complicated and combines many different audio features over a variety of timescales, which makes altering or synthesizing audio while maintaining plausibility of the result a difficult task.  Deep learning can be a powerful tool for doing so - but many applications of DL to speech are still in their infancy and the rules of operating in this domain are continually being discovered.  That makes this a fascinating frontier to work on!

name: Noah Horton
title: CEO - Unsupervised | Fortune 500 AI Expert
about:
Noah Horton is the CEO of Unsupervised.com - the premier automated data analysis technology for enterprise. Unsupervised allows enterprises to turn their vast data collections into actual business impact in a scalable and repeatable way. The company is the culmination of Noah's background in unsupervised machine learning, large-scale computing, analytics and enterprise software. 

Prior to founding Unsupervised, Noah led large AI deployments at many Fortune 50 companies from his position as the Chief Product Officer at Ayasdi. Prior to that, he led product and core engineering for Oracle's transition of its $9bn+ middleware and hardware business into the cloud. His first company, Involver, was acquired by Oracle in 2012 and ultimately became the nucleus of Oracle's Marketing Cloud. 

Before founding Involver, Noah held a series of increasingly senior roles at Sun, HP and Microsoft. He holds over 35 patents, has spoken at many of the largest technology conferences, and is a sought-after consultant and advisor on artificial intelligence and cloud computing. Noah lives in Boulder, CO with his wife and two children.

name: Tyler Willis
title: Founder of Unsupervised — Automating Data Analysis with AI | Recent wins: $100M found at AT&T; 75% reduction in hallucinations vs ChatGPT.
about:
I'm the co-founder and COO of Unsupervised, where we have built the first AI engine that can automate data analysis. Our customers analyze data faster and at a greater scale than possible with human analysts, creative significant ROI and impressive results. In the past 12 months, our customers have already found ways to save over $100M, double their conversion rate, and reduce LLM hallucinations on data analysis questions by 75%.

Our AI operates directly on the star schema data inside of your data warehouse — making it capable of using all of your data to improve analytics output. Our AI Agents find more actionable insights, make better predictions, and answer more complex questions — getting you more ROI and empowering your team to work at an impossible speed and scale.

This is all possible because of nearly a decade spent building the technology that allows AI to understand, use, and analyze enterprise data. We've raised over $50M from Coatue, Disney, Cathay, Swisscom, SignalFire, Eniac and more to help you do incredible things with your data. We work primarily with large enterprises that have complex data.

At Unsupervised, I oversee operations and everything customer-facing. I spend much of my time talking with CEOs and senior leaders about how they can use AI to improve their core metrics and solve their hardest problems.

Outside of Unsupervised, I:
- am an active angel investor (over $10M invested in >100 startups)
- have helped scale two startups from inception to exit (to Oracle and iHeartMedia)
- have worked on improving rare cancer research
- started a non-profit focused on improving global entrepreneurship (over 10k founders mentored)

Outside of work, I enjoy being a father and an accidental farmer.
speaking_engagements: Talks about venture capital fundraising, challenger selling and educating investors
notable_achievements: Senior Manager at Hayashi Wayland specializing in winery and vineyard taxation and accounting; Lecturer at Cal Poly San Luis Obispo; Financial Advisor at The Willis Group focusing on high net worth business owners

name: Eric Schadt
title: Professor, Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
After a wild three years driving growth at Sema4 (closing our first round of outside financing in August 2019, then second round 12 months later, SPAC merger agreement 5 months after that, public company 6 months after that, and then signed a merger agreement with GeneDx roughly 6 months after going public), in August 2022 I decided to step away and return to a more science focused role, continuing at the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai as the Dean for Precision Medicine and Professor in Predictive Health and Computational Biology.  I will continue to leverage existing and growing stores of NGS-based genomic and other multiomic data, longitudinal clinical data, and digital health information to better enable patients in partnership with their physicians to receive precision medicine/health as the standard of care. My work will continue to focus on constructing predictive models of disease that link molecular biology to physiology to enable clinical medicine. 

Prior to this, I served as Founding Director of the Icahn Institute for Genomics and Multiscale Biology, Chair of the Department of Genetics and Genomic Sciences, and the Jean C. and James W. Crystal Professor of Genomics at the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai.  Over the past 20 years, I have built groups and companies (Merck, Rosetta, Sage Bionetworks, Pacific Biosciences, the Icahn Institute, and now Sema4) to elucidate common human diseases and drug response, using novel integrative genomics approaches based on genetic and molecular profiling data.  I have authored/coauthored more than 500 peer-reviewed papers in leading scientific journals, and contributed to a number of discoveries relating to the genetic basis of common human diseases such as diabetes, obesity, and Alzheimer’s disease.

I received my B.S. in applied mathematics/computer science from California Polytechnic State University in San Luis Obispos, my M.A. in pure mathematics from UCD, and my Ph.D. in biomathematics from UCLA (required Ph.D. candidacy in molecular biology and mathematics).

Specialties: Mathematics; statistics; computing; biology; genetics; genomics; systems genetics; systems biology; high performance computing; large-scale scientific research; building and leading high-end research groups to pursue the most pressing problems in the life and biomedical sciences; drug discovery and development; pharmacogenetics/genomics; clinical trials
experience_2_title: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
awards_and_recognitions: Thomson Reuters World's Most Influential Scientific Minds Award; Merck Presidential Fellowship Award; Cine Master Series Award for documentary film 'The New Biology'
speaking_engagements: Presentation at 40th Annual J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference, January 2022; Speaker at TEDMED conference; Commentary published in Huffington Post
notable_achievements: Founder and CEO of Sema4, a patient-centered health intelligence company; Dean for Precision Medicine at Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai; Received Thomson Reuters World's Most Influential Scientific Minds Award; Received Merck Presidential Fellowship Award; Executive producer and creative director of documentary 'The New Biology' which won Cine Master Series Award in 2012; Named BioCT Entrepreneur of the Year in 2020

name: Nitzan Shaer
title: We help teams create reliable user insights, effortlessly.
about:
Nitzan Shaer is the CEO and co-founder of WEVO, a user research platform that leverages AI to deliver reliable insights in a fraction of the time traditional tools require. WEVO represents his continuous fascination with what drives people to make decisions and is the fourth startup that he has been a part of, either as a co-founder or an early team member.

Before co-founding WEVO, Shaer served as head of the Mobile Phones Product Group at Skype, where he collaborated with a diverse range of customers from over 150 countries. This role highlighted the challenges of designing experiences across diverse cultures and inspired him to build a platform that would provide insights to better serve the unique needs of people from different backgrounds.  

At WEVO, Shaer and his team have developed a platform that reduces the time required for user research from 50 hours to 30 minutes and provides statistically significant insights that designers, marketers and product owners can rely on. His vision is that every digital experience will be built on reliable user insights, delivering better experiences for all people. 

Shaer believes in dreaming big, listening more, and moving fast. He believes that the most rewarding aspect of being an entrepreneur is the opportunity to make a significant impact on the world.

name: Iri Amirav
title: Technology entrepreneur
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Iri Amirav is a successful technology entrepreneur based in New York City who has built and sold several high-growth technology startups since 2007. 

He is currently the Co-CEO of JLL Asset Beacon a SaaS asset management technology platform following the acquisition of his company Skyline AI in 2021 where he served as Co-Founder and Chief Revenue Officer. 

Prior to Skyline AI, Iri was Co-Founder and Chief Revenue Officer of StreamRail, a leading video ad optimization company that has been acquired in 2016 by ironSource (NYSE: IS), now part of Unity Software Inc. (NYSE: U). 

Previously, he was the Co-Founder, President, and CMO of Visionize, acquired in 2011 by AVG Technologies (NYSE: AVG), now part of Avast Sofware. Following the acquisition by AVG, Iri built and managed AVG’s distribution business as VP of Global Sales and partnerships, launching over 100 direct partnerships with the world's top software companies that generated over $160 million in annual revenue.

Iri Amirav focused most of his career on founding startup companies while building, leading, and executing zero-to-one Go-To-Market strategies and managing high-growth Sales, Marketing, Delivery, Customer Success, and Business Development teams. He negotiated and launched over 300 partnerships and deals with some of the largest companies in the world and raised over $46M for his various start-up companies. The products he built and distributed have been used by hundreds of millions of users and generated hundreds of millions of dollars a year.

about:
I’ve founded, scaled, exited, and shut down companies—and I’m still in love with the startup game.

I’ve raised $100M in venture capital, led teams from seed to growth stage, and founded and built four companies. Along the way, I’ve learned that leadership is about more than strategy—it’s about building cultures people want to stay in.

I work with startup leaders to help them raise and take their product to market. If you’re an ambitious founder, builder, or funder looking for honest conversations and high-leverage ideas, I’d love to connect.

More context in my pinned post.

name: Kevin Albert
title: Founder and CEO at Canvas
about:
I focus on creating automation that can work alongside humans to augment their abilities and bring productivity to areas that have traditionally been underserved by technology. I have spent my career teaching machines to interact with the world and have pioneered work on systems that leverage a sense of touch to understand their surroundings. 

My driving motivation comes from an excitement to understand the physical world at a fundamental level. By better sensing and modeling our world we can push the performance of machines. With better tools we amplify our own abilities and improve the quality of life for those that use them. System modeling, sensor fusion, nonlinear controls, optimization, computer vision, and machine learning are the tools that are shaping the next generation of machines.

I have run numerous robotics research programs including collaborations with DARPA, NASA, ONR, and large commercial partners (aerospace, automotive) to improve the performance of robotic arms.

I am currently focused on solving real world problems by creating better tools for the dirty, dull, and dangerous tasks that are still prevalent in the real world.

name: Sarah Bird
title: CEO of Canvas | Investor | Board Member | B2B | Scaling | SAAS | High-Integrity, Inspiring Leadership
about:
Sarah Bird is a seasoned and visionary CEO, board member, and investor with expertise spanning digital media, software-as-a-service, and venture capital. She has secured multiple rounds of venture capital, had a successful exit, managed approximately $100 million in annual revenue, and served a vast global customer base. Her strategic acumen is further evident through her involvement in the acquisition and sale of many companies, solidifying her reputation as a transformative leader in the industry.

Sarah's passion for cutting-edge technologies has been a driving force throughout her career. As early as 2008, she embraced machine learning and AWS, effectively addressing complex big data challenges. Her commitment to digital transformation has fostered a culture of innovation, ensuring customer-centric solutions while upholding stringent security and quality standards.

Sarah is a nationally-recognized speaker and leader. Her insights on cultivating corporate cultures that inspire employees, promoting inclusion, and driving civic engagement have earned her invitations to prestigious events, including the White House, where she shared invaluable perspectives on creating family-friendly workplaces that attract and retain diverse talent.

Sarah Bird's exceptional contributions have garnered numerous accolades, solidifying her position as a highly sought-after executive and board member. She has been honored as one of the Top 100 Women in Tech and received the Puget Sound Business Journal 40 Under 40 recognition. Additionally, she has been named an EY Entrepreneur of the Year Finalist, a 2x CEO of the Year Finalist by Geekwire, and was recognized as the inaugural Female Founder's Alliance Role Model of the Year. Her induction as an Aspen Institute Henry Crown Fellow further underscores her significant impact on the technology sector and the broader community. 

She is emerging from sabbatical during which she enjoyed traveling with her family, diving into her mycology hobby, investing in start ups, and serving as a strategic advisor for a non-profit and a new technology venture. She is looking for an organization-in-transition where she can chart the strategic direction and build a world-class leadership team.

name: Michelle Shaw
title: Founder & CEO of CANVAS | CANVAS: Contemporary Fashion Jewelry Brand
about:
Getting to explore my creative side, along with meeting, interacting with, and getting to know our customers and sales reps across the country are the two things I value most about my job as CEO of CANVAS.  

After spending the past 12 years in the fashion jewelry industry, I can honestly say CANVAS is by far my most exciting project, to date.  CANVAS experienced an incredible launch in January 2016, breaking $1 Million in sales our first month in business, and landing an account with a major, upscale department store within our first 45 days.  

The past year has been a ton of work, but very exciting, and well worth every sacrifice!  This past September, I had a wonderful opportunity to be a guest on The Shopping Channel, based in Toronto, Canada (an amazing city, btw), and in October, we opened our NY Showroom on 5th Avenue, just in time for November market!  In addition to NYC, we partner with multiple sales agencies and over 100 sales representatives across the country and Canada, and are in showrooms in Atlanta, Dallas, and Las Vegas.    

Competencies:  Fashion Jewelry Design, Merchandising, Fashion-Related/Trend-Related Writing, Marketing/Advertising Strategy, Graphic Design.    

When I’m not working, I enjoying spending as much time as possible with our 7 year old daughter, Madeleine, traveling, skiing, taking weekend bike rides with the family & friends, and a good bottle of Cabernet!  A few of my favorite travel destinations include Barcelona, the Galapagos Islands, Estonia, and heading to the mountains every chance I get … I would live there if I could!
speaking_engagements: Founder & CEO of CANVAS Style, featured in brand and business growth stories
notable_achievements: Named Property Council's Victoria/Tasmania 'Salesperson of the Year' in 2024; Named 'Sales Advisor of the Year' at the 2023 Ryman Awards; Top 10% sales performer in medical device sales, winning President’s Club twice; AT&T 2003 Outstanding Revenue Growth Award; AT&T 2001 Outstanding Sales Achievement Award; Center for Information and Communication Sciences Alumni Hall of Fame Award, 2019
reasoning: Michelle Shaw demonstrates proven operational success with her current venture CANVAS, showing strong early traction and scaling capabilities. In 2017 I started OnsiteIQ out of Cornell Tech to bring transparency and accountability to real estate development. Along the way, we built one of the most powerful construction imagery databases to train an artificial intelligence that can understand and monitor progress. That's how we launched OnsiteIQ's Construction Intelligence platform in 2022 to help real estate developers and equity partners transition from reactive to proactive asset/project management. I love to geek out about Real Estate Development, Artificial Intelligence, and Startup challenges. 

Note to self: the key to success is to fail fast and not repeat the mistakes 🚀

name: Katherine Przygode
title: Tech Entrepreneur | Exited Founder & CEO | Angel Investor | Board Advisor & Director | Cloud Computing Expert
about:
As a seasoned IT executive and entrepreneur turned investor, I bring over 25 years of experience leading IT organizations for innovative Silicon Valley startups, including Match.com, IGN.com, WagerWorks.com, and Edmunds.com. After earning my MBA from the UCLA Anderson school of management, I founded Stratalux—one of the earliest AWS Managed Services Providers—helping companies such as DreamWorks Animation, Red Digital Cinema, Vonage, TopGolf, and Carl’s Jr. migrate and manage their IT infrastructures in the cloud.

After successfully scaling Stratalux into a leading cloud-based MSP, I sold Stratalux to a Boston-based private equity firm, and shifted my focus to angel investing and management consulting. Today, I am the Founder and Managing Partner of Venusberg Ventures, where I manage investments in deep tech SaaS and AI-enabled companies. I also advise various boards and am actively involved with Tech Coast Angels, where I serve on the Executive, Fund, and Pre-screening committees.

I’m passionate about giving back to the UCLA Anderson community, where I serve as the President of Board Connections at Anderson, an industry group dedicated to helping fellow alumni prepare for corporate and non-profit board service. Additionally, I am a member of the career & industry committee of the UCLA Anderson Alumni Network Board of Directors and mentor startups through the UCLA Anderson Venture Accelerator.

Bilingual in German and English, I’m an avid cyclist and motorsport enthusiast.
education_2_degree: International Residency Program in Shanghai China on "Doing Business in China".
speaking_engagements: Founder and General Partner of Venusberg Ventures; Board advisor roles; President of Board Connections at UCLA Anderson Alumni Association
notable_achievements: Founded and served as CEO of Stratalux, a leading cloud-based Managed Services Provider; Successfully exited Stratalux to Great Hill Partners, a private equity firm

name: Jesse Hollander
title: CEO, Co-founder @ Teleperson | Customer Service, Designed Around You
about:
Over the past 20 years I have been passionate about finding unique, innovative solutions to complex problems. 

My professional career began in investment banking where I helped Japanese companies identify, value and strategize on US-based acquisitions. Seeking to expand my consulting repertoire, I got an MBA focused in international finance and entrepreneurship and upon graduating launched an M&A advisory firm in East Africa. Here I worked with global PE firms similarly bullish about the emerging opportunities presented by the African continent. 

Over the past several years I've transitioned into market research and began working with Frost & Sullivan, a global research & consulting firm. While starting in Biz Dev for the past 2 years, I've recently transitioned into Consulting role, working with senior management to solve specific strategic challenges or identify opportunities driven by shifting technological and regulatory landscapes. 

In July 2020 I launched Teleperson, a customer service solution which redesigns the end-to-end CX journey, truly aligning the interests between companies and the customers they serve. Learn more at teleperson.com. 

Specialties include: 
Complex financial modeling | Competitive analysis | Disruptive innovation | Primary & secondary research | Private equity | Venture capital | Product design | Fintech | IoT | Digital Health

name: Jennifer Lum
title: Co-Founder & Managing Partner at Biospring Partners
about:
Jennifer Lum is a Co-Founder and Managing Partner of Biospring Partners, a growth equity firm that invests in Life Sciences Technology. She is an accomplished investor and entrepreneur. She has co-founded several companies and has worked with many others from formation through to M&A. Jennifer serves on the Board of Directors of Labviva and she is a Board Observer at ixlayer.

Jennifer also serves on the Board of Directors of WTA Ventures. She is a Venture Capital Advisor at Harvard Business School and an Advisor at MIT’s Martin Trust Center for Entrepreneurship. She is also an Advisory Board member at The Petrie-Flom Center for Health Law Policy, Biotechnology, and Bioethics at Harvard Law School.

Jennifer co-founded Forge.AI (acquired by FiscalNote) and Adelphic (acquired by Time). She was an early team member at Quattro Wireless (acquired by Apple), m-Qube (acquired by VeriSign), and WebHosting.com (acquired by AT&T).

She has also held various roles as a management consultant with financial services and technology companies.

name: Chris Rowen
title: VP, Engineering, Collaboration AI at Cisco
about:
Chris is a Silicon Valley entrepreneur and technologist, now cofounder and CEO of BabbleLabs, a deep learning technology company focused on speech. Most recently, he has led Cognite Ventures, a specialized analysis and investment company for deep learning start-ups. Prior to Cognite, he served as CTO for Cadence’s IP Group.

Chris joined Cadence after its acquisition of Tensilica, the company he founded in 1997 to develop extensible processors. He led Tensilica as CEO and later, CTO, to develop one of the most prolific embedded processor architectures.

Before that he was VP and GM of the Design Reuse Group at Synopsys. Chris was a pioneer in developing RISC architecture and helped found MIPS Computer Systems. He holds an MSEE and PhD in electrical engineering from Stanford and a BA in physics from Harvard. He holds more than 40 US and international patents. He was named an IEEE Fellow in 2015 for his work in development of microprocessor technology.
 
Chris is an avid runner who has completed a number of marathons, including Boston Marathons in 2013, 2014, 2017 and 2018.

name: Brad Cordova
title: CEO at super.AI | Forbes 30under30 | Enterprise AI Platform | We're Hiring!
about:
Super.AI uses AI to automates the processing of unstructured data - called Unstructured Data Processing (UDP). UDP is a revolution in the way leading enterprises automate repetitive tasks containing unstructured data such as images, video, audio, text, etc. UDP is an evolution beyond RPA (robot process automation). Where RPA uses software to automate tasks, DPA uses AI. 

Super.AI’s customers are leveraging UDP to create more value for their customers or to drive down cost.
One of the world’s largest e-commerce companies currently leverages the super.AI platform to automate the review and quality control of every product on their platform; a large multinational inspection company uses DPA to automate their heavy machinery inspections, driving down their cost 10x; and a large technology company uses DPA to automate the processing of video data from their virtual reality headsets to build new services for their clients.

name: Saurabh Moody
title: Trusted AI Advisor to Fortune 500 CIOs | +4 Enterprise AI Patents | Ex-Microsoft Data Scientist | Helping You Build Enterprise GenAI with Private, Cloud-Based Agentic Platforms & Data Lakes | Angel Investor
about:
With over two decades of experience in data and technology, I’ve had the privilege of witnessing and shaping the evolution of enterprise systems—from early database architectures to the rise of GenAI.

As an Ex-Microsoft Data Scientist and a Trusted Advisor to Fortune 500 CIOs, I now help enterprises build Private, Cloud-Based Agentic Platforms that unify Data Lakes, Generative AI, and Deterministic Models—turning complexity into clarity, and data into outcomes.

I’m also the Founder of Super AI, a pioneering company that builds enterprise-grade AI platforms where business leaders can ask questions in plain English and get insights from structured and unstructured data—instantly, securely, and without technical barriers.

I help organizations move beyond dashboards and into the era of AI Shadows—where each team has its own intelligent assistant trained on their business logic and data.

This approach is already delivering real impact:

 • In Pharma, we reduced field force reporting time by 85% using a GenAI assistant over sales ops and SFA data.

 • In Retail, we enabled anomaly detection across 10,000+ SKUs—driving a 6% margin recovery within weeks.

 • In Banking, we simplified access to risk and compliance data, cutting report turnaround times and reducing dashboard clutter by 70%.

But this transformation isn’t just for technical teams.

I believe the next generation of AI leadership will come from non-technical professionals who learn how to bridge strategy, data, and intelligence. That’s why I actively mentor business leaders, marketers, and domain experts to become AI Strategy Consultants—equipping them to lead in the AI-first era.

I’m deeply grateful for everyone who has supported this mission.

Let’s create a future where AI doesn’t replace people—but amplifies human intelligence, empathy, and leadership.

Let’s connect if you’re building an AI-first enterprise, or DM me if you’re exploring how to bring GenAI into your business or career.

⸻

I’m available at saurabh@getsuper.ai

name: Raj Shah
title: Co-Founder, Chief Product Officer at Percipient.ai
about:
As a proven technology, management, & business leader for 20+ years, Raj brings a unique combination of creative leadership, entrepreneurial success, management discipline, execution excellence, and global experience in how product, development, and Ops teams build technology products on a rhythm for commercial success.

His career spans from building successful start-ups to scaling and streamlining large team operations facing explosive growth, incl., setting up global operations in various geos. Raj understands what it takes to organize creative teams of scientists, engineers, product managers, and designers to bring together the right ingredients to deliver market-ready products on a predictable rhythm. 

Currently, Raj is a CPO@percipient.   He is also advising several companies. 

At Microsoft, he led the maps organization, responsible for data and imagery acquisition and creation, and maps services to end-users and businesses for desktops/mobiles. Under his leadership the team created assets that prompted Uber’s acquisition.

His early stints at Google included teaming with its senior execs and both the founders to establish a disciplined execution process for its exploding global engineering teams and projects across 50+ engineering centers worldwide. Later, Raj headed creation of Google-owned Maps by establishing a large global infrastructure (managing a cross-geo team of >4,000) for all countries mapped by Google. Crowd-sourcing integration further leveraged users' local knowledge power, making Google maps now the most used resource globally. This is typically how Raj scales a nascent technology idea, establishes a deep infrastructure, and then delivers on a predictable rhythm to lead global markets. 

Raj’s extensive technology background, his deep experience in product development, his successes in meeting GTM timelines, his network, and setting up scalable ops uniquely qualify him to take on challenges high-growth technology company may face.

I’m the Co-founder and CEO of the aerial intelligence company AirWorks, where I spearhead the company’s development of automation technology to advance the application of aerial intelligence to help transform industries, including engineering and construction.

An accomplished executive and innovator with broad experience in scientific, technologic, and business leadership. name: Austin Rosenbaum
title: Founder, CEO @ Demand IQ | Boosting Leads & Sales for Home Improvement Contractors with eCommerce-Style Shopping
about:
After working in home improvement marketing for years, I saw an opportunity to tackle a growing challenge...

The process of selling home improvement upgrades is broken.

• Customers are overwhelmed with complex and time-consuming estimates
• Contractors struggle with high acquisition costs
• Lead qualification is inefficient and often too slow to follow up
• Trust and transparency are lacking in the buying journey
• Consumers want instant answers about pricing, but it’s not available

Demand IQ is changing this with a seamless digital shopping platform.

• Instant, AI-powered estimates on contractor websites or via our canvassing app
• Increased trust & transparency with consumers
• Automated lead qualification for better conversions
• Simplified shopping experience for homeowners
• Significant reduction in acquisition costs for contractors 💲

Let’s connect to discuss how Demand IQ can optimize your sales and marketing. Book a 30-minute demo through my profile link.

-------- 
Austin Rosenbaum is the CEO and founder of Demand IQ, a Denver-based SaaS platform focused on transforming the sales and marketing of home improvement solutions. Austin leads Demand IQ in providing AI-powered, instant quoting tools for contractors in industries such as HVAC, roofing, solar, and other home improvements. Demand IQ revolutionizes the home improvement customer acquisition process with a seamless, eCommerce-style shopping experience that empowers homeowners to shop with greater autonomy and lower sales pressure. A published academic researcher, Austin has also developed two patented software solutions that enhance the home improvement buying experience. He holds both an MBA and a degree in electrical engineering from the University of Denver.
