name: Sara Well
title: Founder & Ceo: Dropstat. Combating clinical staffing shortages, burnout, & rising costs of care. AI/ML powered staffing solutions.
about:
For me it was a singular moment: I couldn't afford to buy a $3.99 tabloid magazine in the airport. My husband and I were flying home for the holidays, and with him in dental school, while I was in nursing school, we counted every penny. 
But I found a work-around; I decided to be the last one off the flight and collect the tabloid magazines left behind by other passengers. At least I would have reading material for the connecting flight. Good plan. 
I walked off the plane last, and found lots of free reading material left behind by other passengers. But I couldn't bring myself to pick it up. I was so frustrated with myself for not being able to afford a $3.99 magazine, that I no longer cared to know what priceless fashion celebrities were wearing to their events when I couldn't even afford to buy the magazine that was reporting it. 
I headed up through first class to exit the plane and noticed that all the reading material changed. Instead of discarded tabloid magazines, it was Wall Street Journal, Entrepreneur, and Inc. magazines. In that moment, it all fell into place for me: the reason the first class passengers were sitting in first class was because they were focused on building, creating & growing, brands, companies & solutions, while the passengers in coach who had left behind tabloid magazines- were focused on being entertained. 
I did an instant 180 on my priorities. I took all the reading material left behind by the first class passengers. I started studying innovators instead of celebrities. I gave up popular music & started listening to venture podcasts, audio books, & the vast amount of business content on YouTube, being mentored by the giants of the entrepreneurial world- for free.
My paradigm shifted. I started to look at big problems in my industry as potentially big solutions waiting to be found & scaled. As I moved from bedside into leadership positions, I experienced the daily struggle of procuring staff quickly and within safe, cost efficient policies. I saw a better way, & found my calling.
Leaving the fast paced adrenaline filled life of trauma/critical care nursing was tough. The mental challenges & daily inspiration are everywhere in the clinical environment. I thought I would have to double down to find it in the quieter work spaces of technical teams. I was wrong.
Healthcare innovators share the same passion for patient care as my colleagues working at the bedside; from spending years with little sleep & pay to bring improvements to market, to the emphasis on quality & improving access.. it's a daily source of joy & inspiration.

education_1_degree: Bachelor of Science - BS, Registered Nursing/Registered Nurse

notable_achievements: Founded Dropstat, a healthcare staffing automation company; Led HealthTech community at Startup Grind

name: Krushnavadan Acharya
title: Unlocking Innovation
about:
A.	Personal Statement 
I am a technologist, entrepreneur, and researcher with over 15 years of experience applying advanced computing, artificial intelligence (AI), and cybersecurity across healthcare and government. As co-founder and CTO/CSO of PathPresenter, I drive the development of a cloud-based digital pathology platform powered by AI and secure architecture, serving clinicians, researchers, and educators worldwide. My public-sector experience includes leading cybersecurity and modernization initiatives at the Delaware Department of Technology and Information (DTI), where I supported Zero Trust adoption, application hardening, and infrastructure security across critical state systems. I am passionate about applying innovative technologies to solve complex, real-world problems in both medicine and public service. 

B.	Positions, Scientific Appointments, and Honors 
 
I currently serve as Chief Technology Officer and Chief Security Officer at PathPresenter, a platform I co-founded to transform digital pathology using AI, cloud technologies, and secure design principles. Earlier, I served as a cybersecurity engineering manager at the Delaware Department of Technology and Information (DTI), where I implemented Zero Trust network policies, containerized applications, and led the modernization of public-facing and internal systems for statewide agencies. My work has been recognized across healthcare, academic, and government sectors, and I continue to contribute to cross-disciplinary innovation that bridges medicine, security, and digital infrastructure. 

C.	Contributions to Science 
My scientific and technical contributions reflect a career-long commitment to harnessing AI and cybersecurity to enhance systems that impact lives—from hospitals to public infrastructure. At PathPresenter, I led the design of AI-enabled digital pathology tools that improve diagnosis, collaboration, and training globally. While at Delaware DTI, I developed and enforced cybersecurity frameworks, helped modernize aging systems with cloud-native solutions, and integrated secure-by-design methodologies into public safety and transportation platforms. My work demonstrates how emerging technologies, when applied thoughtfully, can deliver both clinical excellence and civic impact.

name: Rajendra Singh MD
title: Co-Founder, PathPresenter, Director of Dermatopathology and Digital Pathology, Summit Health
about:
Dr. Singh is the co-founder of PathPresenter, a leading digital pathology platform with over 50,000 users across 170+ countries. Widely adopted by academic institutions, private pathology groups, and organizations worldwide, PathPresenter (pathpresenter.com) has become an essential tool in the field.

Currently, Dr. Singh serves as the Director of Dermatopathology and Digital Pathology at Summit Health. Throughout his career, he has been actively involved with prestigious institutions, including Northwell Health, the University of Pittsburgh, and Mt. Sinai, as well as national organizations such as the ASDP, AAD, DPA, and CAP.

Recognized for his dedication to education, Dr. Singh received the 'Teacher of the Year Award' at Mt. Sinai School of Medicine for five consecutive years. He also chaired the American Society of Dermatopathology's Informatics Committee and is now part of the Sulzberger Grant Committee at the AAD and the Editorial Board of the Journal of the American Academy of Dermatology (JAAD).

In 2022, Dr. Singh was honored with the Lifetime Achievement Award from the College of American Pathologists for his pioneering work on PathPresenter. He was also awarded the Sulzberger Grant by the AAD in 2013 for developing innovative educational tools in dermatology and dermatopathology.

Dr. Singh is the creator and editor of the app mydermpath+ and educational platforms such as wiydx.com. He is the Chief Editor and author of two books-Surgical Pathology, Reimagined and Ace the Board Dermatopathology. His has served on the Editorial Board for the WHO Classification of Tumors (5th Edition), and the Board of the Digital Pathology Association. He currently serves as the Co-Chair of the Digital and Computational Committee of the WHO, and as a member of the  the Digital and Computational Pathology Committee of the CAP as well as the Education Committee of the DPA. He has been recognized on the Pathologist Power List for 2020, 2021,2022 and 2024, reflecting his ongoing impact in the field.

name: Krishnendu Chaudhury
title: Director Machine Learning at Apple | CTO Cofounder @ Drishti | Book Author "Math and Architectures of Deep Learning", Manning Publications  New York |  Xoogler | Deep Learning, Computer Vision, AI, Inventor, Tech Leader
about:
As the CTO and Cofounder of Drishti, a startup that applies deep learning and computer vision to improve human productivity and quality in manufacturing, I lead the technology vision and strategy, and oversee the research and development of cutting-edge AI solutions. With over 25 years of experience in the fields of AI, computer vision, image processing, and computer graphics, I have a passion for creating novel and impactful applications of AI that can transform industries and society.

I am also the author of Math and Architectures of Deep Learning, a book that explains the mathematical foundations and design principles of deep neural networks, and provides practical examples and exercises for readers to master the concepts and skills of deep learning. I enjoy sharing my knowledge and insights with the AI community, and mentoring the next generation of AI leaders and innovators. I have also been a technical advisor for Benhamou Global Ventures, an early-stage venture capital firm that invests in AI, cloud, and digital transformation startups, since 2018.

Previously, I was a principal scientist and head of image sciences at Flipkart, India's largest e-commerce platform, where I led the research and development of image-based solutions for online shopping, such as product recognition, visual search, and augmented reality.

Before that, I was an uber technology leader at Google, where I worked on various projects related to image and video processing, computer vision, and machine learning, such as image auto rectification, document scanning, and video stabilization.

I started my career as a senior computer scientist at Adobe Systems, where I developed and patented several algorithms and techniques for image editing, enhancement, and compression.

name: Tadas Jucikas, PhD

about:
I believe that the creation of beneficial Artificial Intelligence will be the most important technological development in human history, with the potential to shape the trajectory of humanity. 

At Genus AI we are introducing a fundamental shift in how brands harness AI to drive growth. Our mission is to empower businesses if any size with intelligent tools that enhance product catalogs, generate high-performing creatives, and run more efficient campaigns across every digital channel marking the beginning of a new era in e-commerce growth.

I have completed my PhD in Computational Neuroscience at the University of Cambridge where I studied genetic and molecular mechanisms of behavior. I have completed my MPhil in Computational Biology at the Department of Applied Mathematics and Theoretical Physics at the University of Cambridge where I studied machine learning, statistics and biological system modelling.

For the past twelve years, I have built and managed data science teams in both the private and public sectors and pioneered applications of machine learning algorithms and AI in real world scenarios.

Always pushing the envelope in AI and technology, Viktoras continues to drive the conversation on the future of AI and its implications for the broader society.

name: Jared Sanborn
title: CEO of Pure Technology
about:
Autodidact

I see things...
The best way to predict the future is to create it yourself!

I build things...
It’s best to do more than you think you know, than to think you know more than you do!

AI without data is a brain that knows nothing.

The beginning of learning is humility.. 
because it starts with accepting you might not know what you think you know!! 

You are the sum total of all the thoughts you've ever had in life and you are where you are RIGHT NOW because that's where you want to be, whether you want to admit it or not. 

Worry is the negative use of the imagination. Visualization of your dreams is the positive use of the imagination. Your brain and nerves don’t determine which to focus on, they just react accordingly... whichever you focus on is up to you!

It’s best to remember that the entire population of earth minus one exception, you, is composed of other people.

Choose a dream bigger than yourself so you either have to give up or get help.

You don’t create your dream, your dream creates you! 

Remember plans don’t have to be perfect just plausible.

name: Scott McClannahan
title: Dual CEO | Passionate Advocate for Small Business Growth | Filmmaker and TV Producer/Director
about:
As the President and CEO of both Pure Technology Inc. and Simple POS Solutions, I’ve dedicated the past 28 years to helping small businesses thrive through cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions. Since 1996, I’ve been immersed in the restaurant, retail, and technology sectors, continually evolving our offerings to empower small businesses with tools that simplify operations, increase efficiency, and drive growth.

At Pure Technology Inc., we specialize in advanced IT solutions, including networking, data security, cloud solutions, and infrastructure management, tailored specifically for small and mid-sized businesses. We focus on creating scalable, secure technology environments that allow our clients to focus on their core operations while leveraging technology to grow.

Through Simple POS Solutions, we deliver not just point-of-sale systems, but comprehensive business solutions with cutting-edge technologies like AI-driven analytics, robotics, and RFID. We are committed to being more than a vendor—we aim to be a trusted consultant and partner to our clients, helping them streamline their businesses with tools like Platr, our innovative marketing platform.

Passionate about supporting Main Street businesses, I’m proud to be part of the #MainStreetMatters and #MonopolistTears movements, advocating for the success of small businesses in a corporate-dominated world. My work is centered on helping small businesses leverage technology to compete, grow, and succeed.

Outside of my leadership roles in the tech industry, I’m also a creative. I’ve directed and produced over 16 films, with credits on IMDB (Scott McClannahan on IMDB), and I work as a freelancer in local sports television for major broadcast networks. Whether in the boardroom, on set, or behind the camera, I’m driven by a passion for storytelling, problem-solving, and delivering exceptional results.

If you’re interested in collaborating—whether on technology solutions, business growth strategies, or creative endeavors—I’d love to connect.

name: Ellington West
title: CEO & Co-Founder of Sonavi Labs I Harnessing the power of AI to detect and manage respiratory diseases I INC magazine top 100 Female Founder I Cartier Women's Fellow I $6.5M in funding
about:
Ellington West is the Co-Founder and CEO of Sonavi Labs, a medical device and software company based in Baltimore, MD.

Sonavi Labs spun out of Johns Hopkins University and has created Feelix, a smart stethoscope and AI-enabled platform that harnesses the power of machine learning to identify and track respiratory abnormalities with the same accuracy as a trained physician. She brings over 10 years of experience in healthcare business development, market research and leadership to Sonavi Labs and is overseeing the development of the company's inaugural product line.

Under Ellington’s leadership, Sonavi Labs has grown from a research project into a globally recognized, pioneering health tech company. Since its founding in 2017, Sonavi Labs has raised over $6.5M in funding, received FDA approval for the Feelix hardware, been awarded 9 patents and Ellington has been named to INC Magazine’s list of the Top 100 Female Founders of 2021 in addition to being named as one of the Cartier Women’s Initiative North American Fellows. Ellington was appointed by Gov. Larry Hogan to serve on the Maryland Life Sciences Advisory Board in 2022 and is best known for winning pitch competitions across the Globe from taking home the top prize at Arab Health, to winning the top spot in the Healthcare track at SXSW 2021. 

Ellington is a champion of diversity and has made history as one of less than 100 Black women to raise more than $1M in funding for her venture. She continues to use her platform to advocate for women in executive roles and diversity of thought leadership, particularly within the healthcare and venture capital arenas.
awards_and_recognitions: INC Magazine’s Top 100 Female Founders of 2021; Cartier Women’s Initiative North American Fellow 2021; Grand Prize Winner of the Empower 2021 Pitch Competition; Appointed to Maryland Life Sciences Advisory Board 2022; Winner of top prize at Arab Health; Winner of Healthcare track at SXSW 2021
speaking_engagements: Speaker at CSPO events; Featured in Microsoft Startups blog; Participated in Empower 2021 conference
notable_achievements: Established diversified credit strategies across residential mortgages, commercial mortgages, consumer debt, and corporate debt/leveraged loans; Managed assets under management of approximately $2.8 billion as of 2010; Pioneered MBS prepayment trading strategy since early 1980s

name: Ernest Semerda
title: Cofounder at Veryfi, Inc. (We’re Hiring!) — Dilithium expert. Cabinet at United Federation of Planets.
about:
🚀 Cowabunga! Co-captaining Veryfi with my partner-in-crime Dmitry Birulia.

💪 THE A-TEAM
We're the A-Team of document data extraction - turning documents from any language, geography, and format into squeaky clean structured data faster than you can say "Great Scott!" Our secret sauce? First and foremost - the Team! A team that's dedicated to the mission, passionate about helping customers and prospects achieve measurable outcomes, and easy to speak with.

⚡ VERYFI'S SUPERPOWER
Taking those chaotic, unstructured documents and transforming them into pristine, structured data in seconds flat. We're talking speed that would make The Flash look like he's running in slow motion.

🛡️ TRUST & SECURITY
Your data stays at Veryfi (if you choose to retain it). We don't send it anywhere. Our custom-built machine learning models are trained on hundreds of millions of real-world documents, running on our own Nvidia DGX H100s. Even Batman would be jealous of our hardware! And yes, we're SOC2 Type 2 certified - because even superheroes need security clearance!

Our Silicon Valley-based squad provides Day-1 ready solutions with support that's friendlier than your neighborhood Spider-Man. We're the go-to sidekicks for FinTech, Accounting, Healthcare, and CPG brands who need their data extraction done right.

🎬 PREVIOUSLY...
Before Veryfi, I was wearing multiple superhero capes: crafting HIPAA-compliant solutions as CTO at VectorCare to revolutionize healthcare logistics, and hunting down digital coupons at Coupons.com like they were Crocs in the wild.

But wait, there's more! Back in the Land Down Under, I cut my teeth at AMP Ltd (Australia's FinTech heavyweight), where I got to learn from the Jedi masters of corporate architecture. They showed me all the secret passages of financial services - from planning and strategy to banking and tax. And yes, I even ventured into the ancient arts of COBOL (fun fact: I once taught Object-Oriented COBOL at uni - please don't hold it against me! 😅).

Ok I will stop waffling and let you rest. Thank you for making it this far.
Onwards and Upwards 🚀🚀🚀

name: Hersh Tapadia
title: Co-Founder & CEO at Allstacks
about:
Born and raised in Raleigh, NC where I earned a B.S. in Electrical Engineering from North Carolina State University. On the way I co-founded a diagnostics medical device startup, medCount, focused on developing world Tuberculosis diagnostics. Went on to get my M.S. in Biomedical Engineering at Duke University. While there I got heavily involved with the startup community via my opportunity to work with Foundation Capital and source deal flow from North Carolina. After graduation I co-founded CertiRx, which is built to solve the global counterfeiting problem with a particular focus on counterfeiting of pharmaceuticals and other products that can have particular health risks. CertiRx has afforded me experience in a number of fields with touch points in pharmaceuticals, medical devices, consumer/luxury goods, supply chain, and education. Since then I have been consulting for technology companies with Ravioli Labs, an analytics and algorithms based software consultancy I founded and run and exploring product concepts for my next startup.

I work with early stage companies and students as an advisor/mentor through various channels including DukeGEN and the NC State Engineering Entrepreneurs Program, and am the Co-Chair of the NC State Alumni Entrepreneurship Network.

Formally trained in engineering disciplines, have spent a lot of time on startup business planning and startup financing. Broad interests in hardware, software, mobile, healthcare, education, clean tech. Primarily interested in startup and venture capital opportunities.

name: Damir Wallener
title: Make something people love
about:
TLDR: Currently working on a generative AI replacement for traditional game engines like Unity. This includes rolling my own models (transformer, ViT, Masked ViT, traditional R-CNN, LSTM, DETR), creating/managing custom datasets, and MLOps on remote GPU nodes. Most recently, I created a tight coupling between a 3D renderer where the AI takes a walkabout in the virtual world, learning as it goes along. This included both realtime and "sleepy time" continuous training loops.

For emphasis - none of this is loading models from HuggingFace with "pretrained=true". These are all custom models and custom datasets. I learn fast.

I have also created a screening tool for Obstructive Sleep Apnea using craniofacial classification. It is currently in early stages of field testing.

I am an experienced technical manager/executive with a history of shipping product across multiple domains, including AI, Gaming, Adtech, Agtech, Fintech, and Consumer Electronics. I've handled customer engagements as small as an 8-cow dairy farm in Northern California to a formal/funded Joint Development with Samsung. Highly literate in both software and hardware. 

My strengths include the ability for intense focus on product market fit coupled with rapid development iteration, working closely with early users and dev teams. This is a skill that crosses all domains - I am a connector with deep technical skills who loves to work in the intersection of things and teams. 

I have significant fundraising experience (7-figures and counting!) that leverages my skill in creating highly effective narratives that resonate with investors/customers. I am very fortunate to have added the requisite softs skills without losing my HW/SW design background - the ability to put myself in the customer's perspective, while maintaining enough technical competence to prototype the first versions of a solution has been a very powerful combination. 

I have very strong business development and product management experience coupled with a degree in Electrical & Computer Engineering from Georgia Tech.  An avid gamer skilled in Semiconductors, FPGA, ASIC, Business Development, Product Management, Algorithms, Financial Derivatives, Fundraising, and systems engineering....there's more, but if you've come this far, let's just have a conversation instead of sharing more dry words on a flat screen. :) 

SOSV/Techstars alumni, YC finalist.

Python, PyTorch, ML, MLOps, AWS, Image Processing, full stack, and inside 3D render engines are where I currently spend most of my time.

name: Ching-Yung Lin
title: CEO, Graphen Inc.
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
CEO of Graphen, Inc. and Adjunct Professor in Columbia.

Dr. Lin's interest is on fundamental research of AI including Multimodality Signal Understanding, Big Data Graph Computing, and Computational Social & Cognitive Science. 

The human brain is a giant graph of 100 billion nodes and 1 trillion edges, performing four major functions: memory, observation, judgement & perception, and abstract reasoning & strategy. Graphs are our natural way to remember, correlate, and understand all that surround us. For more than a decade, our researchers and developers have been devoting ourselves to advance artificial intelligence technologies based on mimicking brain-like graph infrastructure. Our technical strength falls in these 8 categories: Linked Big Data, Advanced Visualization, Autonomous Learning, Cognitive Feeling, Machine Reasoning, Strategic Thinking, Human Understanding, and Prediction.

We focus on creating novel AI solutions, especially in Finance and Medical. http://www.graphen.ai

Before starting Graphen, Dr. Lin created IBM Research's Network Science and Machine Intelligence department. His team created IBM's first Finance AI product -- Surveillance Insight. From 2011-2015, he led a team of more than 40 Ph.D. researchers in 10 universities (Northeastern, Northwestern, Columbia, Minnesota, Rutgers, CMU, New Mexico, USC, UC Berkeley and SRI). He led to create a big project of IBM System G.
 
Dr. Lin was elevated to IEEE Fellow in Nov 2011. His team created foundation to solve one of the biggest challenges of AI. It is applied to (1) Social/Economic Networks (2) Information/Knowledge Networks (3) Natural/Bio/Cognition/Brain Networks and (4) Communication/Mobile/Man-Made Networks. Applications are on Cognitive Security, Social Analytics, Behavioral Analytics, Neuron Network Analytics, and Sensing Analytics. The team is consisted of researchers with backgrounds of Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, NLP, HPC, Visualization, Economics, etc.
awards_and_recognitions: IEEE Fellow (2011); 7 Best Paper Awards; Featured 4 times by BusinessWeek magazine; IBM Exploratory Research Career Review: Most likely to have greatest scientific impact (2010)
speaking_engagements: Startup Presentation at MIH Demo Day (2022); Adjunct Professor at Columbia University since 2005; Adjunct Professor at NYU (2014); Adjunct Professor at University of Washington (2003-2009)
notable_achievements: Principal Investigator of many externally funded projects totaling approximately $25 million including DARPA projects; Developed software that tops the Supercomputer society’s Graph500 benchmark with 38 billion graph traversals per second; Pioneered research in cognitive networks, cognitive analytics, spatiotemporal analytics, and behavioral and mobile analytics; Led development of AI tools applied in multiple industries including finance, healthcare, and security
reasoning: Dr. Lin demonstrates strong technical leadership and executive experience at IBM Research, where he led significant AI initiatives and large teams. His role as department creator and leader of IBM's Network Science and Machine Intelligence department, plus development of IBM's first Finance AI product (Surveillance Insight) shows proven operational excellence at a major tech company. name: Andrew Noh
title: Partner & Co-Founder at Mila Ridge Partners | Formerly COO of Finch Therapeutics (FNCH)
about:
Currently, at Mila Ridge Partners, we're seeking a company to buy, run, and grow in Northern New England.

Having built two pioneering organizations alongside an amazing group of cofounders over the past decade - a financially self-sustaining nonprofit (OpenBiome) and a biotech in microbial therapeutics (Nasdaq: FNCH) - I'm excited to partner again with one of my cofounders at Mila Ridge. OpenBiome and Finch were fun and challenging experiences in building new companies. This time, we're eager to explore another side to entrepreneurship: sustaining and growing an established business for the long-term.

If I've learned anything about myself through work, it's best encapsulated by an episode of The West Wing in which President Bartlett says to Josh, "You want to know the difference between you and me? I want to be the guy. You want to be the guy, the guy counts on." I love being a leader behind the scenes: readily accessible to all, focused on the operational details and infrastructure that make for a well-functioning organization, and serving as the interstitial glue that keeps a team together.

With over a decade of experience in the drone industry, I’m an entrepreneur and technologist focused on the transformative power of AI and autonomy. As the founder and CEO of FlytBase, I lead a world-class team building AI-native software that powers large-scale, fully autonomous drone deployments across security, inspections, emergency response, and more.

At FlytBase, I drive the product vision, strategy, and execution — with a growing focus on integrating real-time AI capabilities into autonomous systems. Our platform enables intelligent decision-making at the edge, scalable fleet operations, and seamless cloud integrations, helping enterprises unlock 10x efficiency and safety.

We’ve partnered with global enterprises across the US, Europe, the Middle East, and Southeast Asia — and have been recognized with awards like the NTT Data Global Innovation Contest (Tokyo) and TiE50 (Silicon Valley). I draw from my background in aviation, robotics, and software to push the boundaries of what’s possible with AI-powered autonomy — and to reimagine how physical work gets done in the real world.

name: James Briscoe
title: Look-Ahead Software Designer, Developer and Team Leader
about:
I've always been interested in computing and now, I'm able to live out my passion doing what I can in any and all fields of opportunity. I'm quite fortunate to absolutely enjoy all of my work.

As a result, I've accumulated 10+ years of experience in the industry as both a Software Developer and Entrepreneur, accumulating and honing my skills in all disciplines required.

On the software engineering side, I've had professional experience in:
* C# on Windows/.NET, my primary professional platform
* Scala, which tickles my wish for programming language elegance
* C on Linux, MacOS (Classic and X) and Windows, for when performance is all that matters

A good software practitioner must dabble or have working knowledge in many more areas, and I'm no exception. This includes:
* Web-Based Software: JavaScript, HTML5, CSS and the like. More or less anything that comes out of the W3.
* C++, for when I must.
* Java, for the other half of businesses that don't use .NET.

I'm very interested in any type of computing work that involves heavy use of algorithms (which includes Deep Learning, now a very popular form of implementing light AI) and business-related applications, such as those my end-users are required to use to get their jobs done. Nothing quite satisfies me like an end-user able to increase their productivity with my software.

As an entrepreneur, I've learned from hard experience in how to effectively manage software teams and delivery schedules to ensure that quality is delivered on time. I believe that this skill is well-learned and only gets better through extensive experience, and is one of the other joys I experience while in the industry.

name: Ankit Gupta
title: Visiting Partner @ YC | Co-Founder/CTO @ Reverie (acquired)
about:
I am a computer scientist and entrepreneur with 10 years of experience in machine learning and the life sciences. I was previously the co-founder and CTO of Reverie Labs, a small molecule therapeutics company that used machine learning to drive a pipeline of therapeutics in oncology. As a founder, I grew our company to a staff of 30, built a culture of technology and engineering that marries computer science with chemistry, and raised $31M from top investors to fund our internal therapeutics pipeline. Reverie Labs was sold to Ginkgo Bioworks in February 2024.

I’ve built and managed a multidisciplinary team of engineers, scientists, and managers spanning machine learning, data science, backend and frontend engineering, cloud infrastructure, and cheminformatics. I have been hands-on in writing code (and then building teams to write code) for all of these disciplines.

In an earlier life, I graduated from Harvard and studied computer science. For my thesis, I built machine learning models for DNA structure, and I was advised by Professor Alexander Rush of Harvard NLP and Dr. David Kelley of the Broad Institute of Harvard and MIT. I was deep (pun intended) into the deep learning world throughout my academic training, including being a head teaching fellow for multiple Harvard courses in machine learning.

See my home page at http://ankitg.me!

With over 20 years of experience in the oil and gas industry, I am co-founder and CEO at Mechademy Inc., an engineering technology startup that provides domain-driven prescriptive analytics for the heavy process industry. My mission is to help plant personnel prevent unscheduled downtime on their rotating equipment through early prescriptive insights, using our cloud-based platform, Turbomechanica®. name: Dr. Sol Lizerbram
title: Executive Chairman & Co-Founder at ForeSee Medical, Inc
location: San Diego County, California, United States
about:
Dr. Sol Lizerbram is the Executive Chairman and Co-Founder of ForeSee Medical Inc. Formerly he held the same titles at HealthFusion Inc. 

Dr. Lizerbram has been in the healthcare industry for over 35 years, receiving a degree in pharmacy from Long Island University, School of Pharmacy. He obtained a medical degree from the Philadelphia College of Osteopathic Medicine. Dr. Lizerbram is Board Certified in Family Practice. 

Dr. Lizerbram has received many awards and appointments including: Health Advisor to California Governor Edmund G. name: Manolis Kellis
title: Professor at MIT and Broad Institute. Genomics, Computational Biology, Disease Genetics
about:
Manolis Kellis is a Professor of Computer Science at MIT, a member of the Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, and a member of the Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Lab at MIT where he directs the MIT Computational Biology Group (compbio.mit.edu). His research is in disease genetics, epigenomics, gene circuitry, non-coding RNAs, comparative genomics, and phylogenetics. He has authored more than 230 journal publications that have been cited more than 115,000 times. He has helped direct several large-scale genomics projects, including the Roadmap Epigenomics project, the comparative analysis of 29 mammals, the human and the Drosophila Encyclopedia of DNA Elements (ENCODE) project, and the Genotype Tissue-Expression (GTEx) project. He received the US Presidential Early Career Award in Science and Engineering (PECASE), the NSF CAREER award, the Alfred P. Sloan Fellowship. He obtained his Ph.D. from MIT, where he received the Sprowls award for the best doctorate thesis in computer science. He lived in Greece and France before moving to the US.

name: Nicholas Harris
title: CEO at Lightmatter
about:
---Bio---
With over 50 patents and 80 publications in journals including Nature, Nicholas’ seminal work on quantum and classical information processing with integrated photonics has helped launch the international research field of programmable photonics. In 2021, MIT Technology Review honored Nicholas with the Innovators Under 35 award, selected by 30 judges—including Andrew Ng—from over 500 nominees. Past winners include Google’s Larry Page and Sergey Brin, Facebook’s Mark Zuckerberg, and Apple’s Jony Ive. He received his doctorate in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology where he was a National Science Foundation Graduate Research Fellow and then a Postdoctoral Fellow through the Intelligence Community Postdoctoral Fellowship.

---Perspective---
My career has been focused on understanding computers—how they work (down to the atomic scale) and where they are headed. During my time at MIT as a PhD student and post-doctoral fellow, I explored what may become the ultimate tool for understanding the exquisite details of our universe: quantum computers. Quantum computing is profoundly exciting, but supporting hardware technologies are not ready yet. I've developed a level of expertise in designing components and systems that create, process, and detect light and what I've been able to build leads me to believe that the next step in the evolution of computing is all about light. I founded Lightmatter with a mission of creating photonic computers and new ways for chips to communicate. We are building machines that will serve as a new engine for human progress.

education_2_degree: Doctor of Philosophy - PhD, Electrical Engineering and Computer Science

notable_achievements: Certified Exit Planning Advisor (CEPA); Certified Private Wealth Advisor (CPWA); 20+ years career as analyst, strategist, and trader on Wall Street; Founding member of Entrepreneur Wealth Group at UBS
reasoning: Nicholas Harris demonstrates strong characteristics of an L6 Market Innovator and Thought Leader based on his exceptional technical achievements, industry recognition, and innovative work in photonic computing. His profile shows clear evidence of groundbreaking innovation with over 50 patents and significant academic publications in prestigious journals. name: Jay M. Wong
title: Founder & CEO, Luminous
about:
I’m 15 years into building robots, previously at world class defense and R&D organizations. I spent six years founding a robotics AI company that packaged for Fortune 50 brands. Now, my sole focus is Luminous. My ambition is to maximize positive impact within the next decade, spending all my time and resources to solve one of the greatest problems of our generation—scaling energy infrastructure at unprecedented rates—to empower humanity to do more and live more fulfilling lives. 

BIO //
Jay M. Wong, an innovator and roboticist of 15+ years, is mission driven to enable technology to be more widespread and accessible to society. In 2023, he founded Luminous, unlocking scalable solar energy with robot fleets to accelerate the planet towards a more sustainable future. In 2017, he co-founded Southie Autonomy and delivered reconfigurable industrial robot AI to contract packaging.

Previously, Wong worked as a robotics scientist at Draper and held visiting scientist roles at MIT and Harvard University, where he founded a cloud robotics initiative and led engineering on their award-winning robot. Prior, he was at NASA and UMass Amherst, his alma mater, where he was named Bay State Fellow and two-time Outstanding Achievement awardee. Since 2007, he's been involved with FIRST Robotics.

name: Katica Roy
title: CEO of Pipeline Equity | Gender Economist | 2020 Colorado Entrepreneur of the Year | Fast Company Impact Council Member | Contributor for Bloomberg, Fast Company, Fortune, WEF & NBC
about:
I’m Katica Roy, an award-winning gender economist, data scientist, and founder and CEO of Pipeline, an award-winning SaaS company advancing intersectional gender equity in the workplace. As a global speaker, media commentator, and a flagship columnist for Equity by Design™ by the Design Observer, I help audiences rethink the economic opportunity of equity — not as charity, but as a growth strategy.

My writing and ideas have been published in the World Economic Forum, Harvard Business Review, Fortune, Fast Company, Forbes, Bloomberg, NBC, Katie Couric Media, Entrepreneur, The Hill, The Advocate, and Morning Consult, among others, reaching more than 2.9 billion impressions. My research has been cited by multiple New York Times bestselling authors and in U.S. congressional proceedings, and I’ve advised policymakers, global leaders, and Fortune 500 executives on closing equity gaps to drive prosperity.

Recognized by TIME and Fast Company for transforming equity into action, I’ve been honored as Colorado Entrepreneur of the Year (2020), LinkedIn Top Voice for Gender Equity (2022), and Stevie Gold Entrepreneur of the Year. Under my leadership, Pipeline launched the first gender equity app on Salesforce’s AppExchange, earning TIME Best Invention and repeated Fast Company Most Innovative Companies recognition for closing the workplace equity gap.

I am also proud to serve on influential councils including Fast Company’s Impact Council, Bloomberg’s New Economy Forum, The Aspen Institute’s Tech Accountability Coalition, and the U.S. SBA’s National Women’s Business Council. 

My passion for equity is deeply personal: as the daughter of an immigrant and a refugee, and as a breadwinner mother raising a teenage daughter and son, I believe in building an economy that works for everyone.

Let’s connect if you’re ready to explore the ROI of equity, systemic change, and the bold leadership our future demands: katica@katicaroy.com.

name: Stefan Ramsbott

about:
I am an experienced technologist, innovator, and company builder with multiple exits. In 2006, I co-founded 303 Software, a strategic web and mobile app development consultancy focused on custom solutions implementation and technology integrations. With a strong history of relationship building and innovation-driven technology creation, I have always trusted in my love for logic and problem solving when identifying opportunities. While I have been involved in all aspects of building and growing companies, my core expertise and passion is creating product purposefully by working alongside, mentoring, motivating, and inspiring talented teams.

title: B2B Marketing Executive 🔥 | Developing & Executing Innovative Marketing Strategies 📈
about:
🚀 About Me: 

As a seasoned marketing leader, I'm passionate about driving sustainable growth in the B2B technology and services sector. Currently leading the marketing charge at Regology, I've been instrumental in transforming it into a front-runner in regulatory technology (RegTech), including launching Reggi, a generative AI compliance assistant. My previous role leading the marketing for RSM US LLP’s Strategy and Management Consulting Practice was marked by innovative marketing initiatives, propelling the practice to new heights. 

💡 Expertise:

I bring a rich history of elevating marketing strategies, ramping up brand visibility, and significantly boosting revenue. My approach is rooted in data-driven insights, ensuring that every marketing move is both innovative and effective. Whether in startup environments or established corporate settings, I excel in navigating and thriving in diverse business landscapes.

🔍 Specialties:

Marketing & Go-to-Market Strategy: Crafting and executing strategies that resonate with target markets and deliver tangible results.

B2B Marketing & Demand Generation: Expertise in creating campaigns that drive demand and foster meaningful business relationships.

Branding & Brand Awareness Management: Skilled in building and managing brand identities for sustained market relevance and recognition.

Marketing Optimization & Automation: Leveraging the latest technologies for efficient and impactful marketing processes.

Account-Based Marketing (ABM) & Analytics: Utilizing ABM strategies to tailor marketing efforts for maximum impact, backed by solid analytics.

Product-Led Growth (PLG): Implementing a strategy that centers on using the product itself as the primary driver of customer acquisition, conversion, and expansion. 

Search Engine Optimization (SEO) & Search Engine Marketing (SEM): Expert in crafting content specifically tailored for SEO and SEM, focusing on enhancing online visibility and engagement. 

🎓 Education: 

I am a proud alumnus of Villanova School of Business, where I majored in finance and management and minored in international business. I recently enhanced my strategic acumen through an Executive MBA at Quantic School of Business and Technology.

🔗 Let’s Connect:

If you're passionate about innovative marketing strategies or the evolving landscape of B2B technology, I would love to engage in a conversation. Connect with me for collaborations, insights, or just a chat about the future of marketing in the technology sector.

iSchoolConnect case study by Google : https://edu.google.com/latest-news/case-studies/ischoolconnect-gcp/?modal_active=none

Responsibilities include:
* Identify AI projects / products of high business value. Collaborate effectively with product owners representing different product lines.

Ensure the project implementation governance on an ongoing basis.

* Build cohesive team, imbibe a sense of purpose in it.
* Plan and oversee the implementation of quality assurance processes in relation to model testing by different stakeholders; Model performance testing, model acceptance testing. (blackbox, white-box, smoke testing, etc)
* Strategize for ethical AI, interact with stakeholders for the same.
* Plan and oversee the implementation of ML pipeline automation.
* Plan and oversee the implementation of AI Gcloud infra to be used for model training & deployment in production.
* Hire a team of data scientists; track hiring and upcoming requirements. Train and mentor team.
* Take part in communication with customers, partners, media stakeholders

name: Florian Pestoni
title: Multi-agent robot orchestration + physical AI
about:
I love robots, startups and pizza. 

As co-founder and CEO of InOrbit, the leading platform for robot operations, I have the best job ever: I get to help robot developers around the world tackle the most challenging tasks IRL and help end users across industries improve the efficiency of their operations. To do that, I drive awareness around a new category we call RobOps: like DevOps, for robots 🤖.

I took a winding road to get here. From hardcore engineering, working on obscure topics like image processing and crypto, to launching video products used by over a billion people, with a detour through digital health and productivity software. Along the way, I was granted over 20 patents; founded and joined startups; did stints at some of the logos everyone recognizes like Facebook, Microsoft and Adobe; negotiated and closed major deals; raised multiple rounds of funding and developed relations and friendships around the world.

Now I focus on impact at scale + giving back to the community. Whether it's writing articles (including for my LinkedIn newsletter "Welcome to the Roboverse", on Forbes.com or industry mags), starting the preeminent community group for robot operations (ROG - pronounced "rogue" of course), interviewing industry experts, or serving on the board for the Silicon Valley alumni association at UC Berkeley, I aim to share the key trends that will impact not just the future of work but the future of everyday life. Hint: I believe it involves robots and immersive tech.
 
I'm passionate about product management and entrepreneurship. I'm happy to mentor, advocate for and invest in the next generation of startup founders. I am a connector and booster, so if you are a founder trying to get connected in Silicon Valley feel free to reach out.

Did I mention pizza? I love making and eating 🍕 in all its glorious variety, from a classic wood-fired Neapolitan Margherita to my latest obsession, Detroit-style pizza.

notable_achievements: Raised $2.6 million seed funding for InOrbit; Named a 2024 Google for Startups Founders Fund recipient

about:

name: Corey Zwart
title: Technology-driven leader and innovator
about:
I am an intuitive engineer and a veteran of the software development and IT industries. My experiences in the heavily governed medical, financial and law enforcement industries have shaped my passion for leading teams and building systems that push us forward ethically and responsibly. 

I strongly believe that when leading a team it is my responsibility to provide any opportunities for growth and guidance that I can. I push to promote balance and ensure my teammates are fulfilled in their work and subsequently their personal lives. My role should provide challenging problems that excite people rather than bore them with a traditional routine. I never ask of others what I am not prepared to do myself. I also believe that strong leadership comes from having experience with what you are meant to lead. Learning and being a part of the project helps ensure I am not the figurehead who leads from an office but instead gets their hands dirty and shares my experience and knowledge with my team.

When it comes to system architecture, principals like KISS and SOLID are what I strive to follow. Build evolutionary systems so that the cost of growth is minimal and risk level is low. Find new ways to approach the problem but emphasize that not every problem has the same solution.
speaking_engagements: Keynote at Data + AI Summit 2023

Making a dent in the digital universe. I'm a 2x founder with 2x exits. As a product leader with 15+ years in the AI and Augmented Reality (AR) space and more than 30+ issued patents (and many more pending), I'm driven by a deep belief that AI is meant to enhance human capabilities and experiences for the better. I take pride in creating and building human-centric products with a customer experience first philosophy. As a leader, I prioritize people, product, and profit; in that order. 

My work and I have been recognized by WSJ, Wired, Forbes, New York Times, Apple, Google, CrunchBase: #2 Hottest Tech Company Globally, Cannes Lions, CNET, TechCrunch, VB, Digital Trends, Frost & Sullivan, Mobile World Congress, and more for my contributions to AI, AR, and innovation in the tech space. I was the founder/ceo of Streem (Acq. 2019 by NASDAQ:FTDR) and I founded and served as CEO of ONtheGo Platforms (Acq. 2015).

name: Sankalp Arora
title: CEO and Co-founder at Gather AI
about:
With over 15 years of experience in robotics research and engineering, I am the CEO and Co-founder of Gather AI, a startup that develops autonomous data gathering UAVs for the supply chain industry. Our mission is to provide reliable, efficient, and scalable solutions for inventory management, warehouse optimization, and asset tracking using cutting-edge technologies and algorithms.

As an autonomy expert, I have a strong background in motion planning, computer vision, machine learning, and data analysis. I hold a PhD in Robotics from the Robotics Institute at Carnegie Mellon University, where I worked on flying field robotics systems and published multiple papers in prestigious conferences. I also received the Qualcomm Innovation Fellowship in 2016 for my innovative research proposal. I am passionate about solving real-world problems using robotics and AI, and building a diverse and talented team that shares this vision.

I thrive on executive-level management challenges requiring me to help companies change the culture of how they do business and with opportunities where strategic planning, imaginative thinking, and a solid grasp of best management practices achieve the organization’s mission.

name: Daniella Zakon
title: Founder + CEO at Upwell Materials
about:
Daniella's background is in marine ecology. She studied the effects of rising levels of anthropogenic carbon dioxide on the ocean's chemistry and its inhabitants. It was clear that to make a great impact on carbon reduction, she would need to become involved in production and business. This prompted her to get a MA degree in environmental studies and business management.

Daniella has since worked in green tech, sustainable apparel, and most recently clean cosmetics. She has founded two companies and is a proven leader and team player. Her interdisciplinary mindset allows her to learn new topics quickly and thoroughly. Her background in recruiting empowers her to build highly specialized and experienced teams. Daniella's magnetism, passion, and drive make her a strong leader whom people support. 

She is skilled in ecology, ocean chemistry, research, environmental impact assessment, corporate social responsibility, sustainability strategy, sustainable business models, recruiting, public speaking, pitching, fundraising, and entrepreneurship.

name: Caitlyn Wells
title: Operations & Systems Development Strategist | Founder of Upwell Strategies
about:
💡 WHO I AM
I'm Caitlyn Wells and I’m the founder of Upwell Strategies, an operations agency that’s here to build the foundational systems, tools, and processes that will keep YOU creating for years to come. 

At Upwell Strategies, we don’t do cookie-cutter solutions or “one size fits all strategies.” We’re here to understand EXACTLY how you and your brain like to work, so that the behind the scenes of your business works best for YOU. 

I’ve supported 80+ clients while building complex + custom solutions in key capability areas like client experience, tech & software, and operational strategy.

Past projects include CRM setup, marketing funnel builds, project management software setup, process automations, and SOP creation (just to name a few). 

✨ FEATURED IN
My work has been featured on many business podcasts including She's Busy AF podcast, HerHQ podcast, The Millennial Mom Movement podcast, and the Inspiration Contagion podcast.

❓ASK ME ABOUT
- How to Know if A Task Can Be Automated, Delegated, or Set Aside for Later
- How to Save Hundreds of $$$ by Building a More Effective Tech Stack
- Why You Should Never Hire A Team Member Without An Onboarding Plan
- The Secret Energy Drain That’s Killing Your Creativity (& How to Recharge)

🎥 SUBSCRIBE TO MY YOUTUBE CHANNEL
Peek behind the scenes of some of the biggest operational challenges + custom solutions we’re building for clients here at Upwell. Subscribe here: https://youtube.com/@upwellstrategies

❤️ MY CLIENT WINS SOUND LIKE
- Organizing your files, processes, and systems for how YOUR brain works
- Building a CRM solution that reduces the time from proposal sent to invoice paid
- Optimizing your digital footprint to shorten your lead time to conversion
- Establishing the right process documentation so your team can work without you
- Enjoy more of the day-to-day work you love doing, not stressing about the details

name: Ariel Schilkrut
title: CEO at Zippedi Inc
about:
Luis is an industrial engineer and a serial entrepreneur with more than thirty years of experience in the retail space. He is from the first generation of Endeavor entrepreneurs.
He has deep knowledge about the inefficiencies of the bricks and mortar stores which have worked mainly by trial and error when planning layouts and merchandising their products.
Due to his expertise, he has positioned himself as a speaker on topics related to technology applied to retail.
Luis is aware retailers are one of the few industries that do not have structured data at the point where the sale is generated, and that is what he seeks to change with Zippedi.
Currently, Vera leads Zippedi, a company that captures store data using a robot and, thanks to artificial intelligence models, converts unstructured data into structured data, creating the digital twin of the store.
Vera's vision is that each retailer operates with a digital twin, a powerful tool that will allow them to handle stock-outs, manage assortments, errors of implementation, and much more.

name: Fei Zou
title: Chairman of Helios Data Inc.
about:
Dr. Fei Zou is the Chairman and CEO of Helios Data Inc., a Palo Alto-based technology startup with an ambition to turn enterprise data into a tradable financial asset. 

Dr. Zou is also the founder of Synergie Capital, an investment and advisory firm focused exclusively on global cross-border investments. Before founding Synergie Capital in 2012, Dr. Zou was a Managing Director at the China Investment Corporation (CIC), a Sovereign Wealth Fund with close to 1 trillion USD under management. Dr. Zou was responsible for close to $30 billion in direct investments between 2008 and 2012 in the US, Europe, Asia, and Latin America. Before joining CIC, Dr. Zou was an equity portfolio manager at American Century Investments, a premier investment manager in the United States with more than $150 billion under management. Dr. Zou was in charge of the US and international large-cap strategies with combined assets close to $3.5 billion.

Dr. Zou served as a member of the board of directors at BYD Company Ltd (China/ HK), China Modern Dairy Holdings Ltd (China/ HK), Delta Dunia Makmur TBK PT (Indonesia). He is also an advisor to a number of multi-national corporations (MNCs) and private equity funds based in the US, Europe, and Asia. 

Dr. Zou served as a director at the Chinese Finance Association (TCFA) from 1999 to 2007, and was the chairman of the board from 2000 to 2001. 

Dr. Zou received his Ph.D. in Finance and MS in Economics from the University of Texas at Austin. He is also a Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) and a member of the CFA Institute.

name: Adam Wray
title: Founder and CEO @ AstrumU | AI, Data and Skills Solutions
about:
Adam Wray is the founder and CEO of AstrumU, an AI data platform startup that translates educational experiences into economic opportunity. With over 20 years of experience in leading and founding data analytics, cybersecurity, cloud, and AI-focused companies, he has a proven track record of creating innovative solutions and driving successful outcomes in the technology sector. He is passionate about using AI to level the playing field between learning and working, and to quantify the value (ROI) of learning & working skills for lifelong learners, educational providers, and employers.

Before launching AstrumU in 2017, Adam was the CEO and president of Basho Technologies, a big data distributed systems database company, where he led the clean-up and sale of the company for an eight-figure outcome. He also served as a board director for Observable Networks, an AI/ML focused network security-as-a-service provider, where he helped secure a Series A investment and a sale to Cisco in 2017. Additionally, he was one of the founders and CEO of Tier 3, a public sector cloud services provider acquired by CenturyLink for a nine-figure outcome in 2013, and held senior roles at Limelight Networks, Amazon, and Akamai Technologies. 

Adam is active in community and civic life, having served on the board of directors for College Possible, an organization that supports low-income students in achieving college admission and success, and the Washington Policy Center, an independent think tank that promotes sound public policy in Washington State. He also volunteers for the University of Kansas Alumni Association and Big Sky Bravery, an organization that provides post-deployment programs and mentorship for U.S. special forces. He holds an Executive MBA from the University of Washington and a BA in English from the University of Kansas.

name: Reed Freling
title: Senior Software Engineer @ FiVerity
about:
I am a Senior Software Engineer at FiVerity, a company that provides AI-powered cyber fraud prevention solutions for financial institutions. I joined FiVerity in April 2023, after working as a Software Development Engineer at Amazon for almost 2 years.

At FiVerity, I leverage my skills and experience in infrastructure as code (IaC), cloud computing, and Java to design and implement scalable and secure software systems. I also collaborate with other engineers to deliver innovative and high-quality solutions that meet the business and technical requirements.

Before FiVerity, I worked at Amazon, where I built multiple pieces of a high-traffic system to display marketing campaigns across the Amazon site, and integrated a feature into the Amazon checkout experience. I also contributed to end-to-end testing, code reviews, documentation, and took part in regular maintenance of the existing codebase.

I graduated from Cornell University in Fall 2020 with a BA in Mathematics and Computer Science, and a minor in Spanish. I have a strong foundation in data structures, algorithms, software engineering, and mathematics, as well as a proficiency in Spanish. I enjoy learning new technologies and solving challenging problems, and I am always looking for opportunities to grow and improve as a software engineer.
education_1_degree: Bachelor of Arts - BA, Mathematics and Computer Science

name: Anand Kulkarni
title: CEO at Crowdbotics: the leading AI modernization platform | Y Combinator alum (S11) | UC Berkeley | NSF PhD fellow
about:
Anand is CEO and founder of Crowdbotics, an artificial intelligence model and research company, building the world’s leading AI modernization and requirements-managements model, C1. Crowdbotics enables enterprises to successfully modernize legacy codebases and continuously accelerate software development using generative AI. As a best-in-class solution, Crowdbotics outperforms leading foundational models at the core problem of extracting requirements from code, and accelerates development cycles by 50% via AI-driven requirements-driven development.

Over 20,000 apps have been analyzed or generated on the Crowdbotics platform, including mission-critical healthcare applications, venture-backed software products scaling to millions in revenue, financial trading engines, learning management platforms, and government  and flight intelligence tools. 

Anand has been named as one of Forbes Magazine's "30 under 30" Top 30 Entrepreneurs Under 30. Anand has published over a dozen papers in ACM, AAAI and IEEE magazines, journals, and conferences. Anand previously held a National Science Foundation graduate research fellowship in mathematics. He holds degrees in Industrial Engineering and Operations Research, Mathematics, and Physics from UC Berkeley.


Anand was previously co-founder of LeadGenius, a Y Combinator-backed startup using human computation and deep learning to automate account-based marketing (ABM). LeadGenius poweres the sales and marketing organizations of Fortune 500 customers like Google, eBay, and Box.  In conjunction with nonprofits like the World Bank, LeadGenius generates fairly-paid digital employment for over 500 individuals in 40 countries.


Specialties: Crowd computing, machine learning, theory of algorithms, operations research, linear and nonlinear optimization, microwork, computational geometry, mathematical modeling, robotics, telerobotics

awards_and_recognitions: Named one of Forbes Magazine’s Top 30 Entrepreneurs Under 30; National Science Foundation graduate research fellowship in mathematics

notable_achievements: Raised $58M funding for Crowdbotics; Early AI adoption in software development; Pioneered CodeOps movement; Secured government contracts for Crowdbotics

name: Carlos García
title: Executive Partner, Strategy & Intelligence
about:
I’m a strategist, data storyteller, and entrepreneur with more than 25 years of experience helping global brands unlock growth through audience intelligence, content strategy, and data innovation.

I recently wrapped up an incredible chapter as Co-Founder of Molecula, a company I built with passion and purpose—helping organizations optimize decisions and resources through the power of consumer knowledge and actionable insights. It was a rewarding journey, and I’m proud of the legacy we created.

Now, I’m embarking on my next venture: FatCat9 — a next-generation Data Intelligence Hub helping businesses across sectors turn data into outcomes. We help companies—from media and retail to tech and beyond—enhance relevance, performance, and decision-making through smarter insights and scalable analytics.

🔹 Data Intelligence Hub: We connect, clean, and harmonize data sources to deliver real-time, decision-ready analytics via automated reports and dashboards.
🔹 Performance Optimization: We analyze behavioral, operational, and content data to uncover performance drivers, boost engagement, and strengthen strategies across any industry.
🔹 Brand Relevance Tracker: Our AI-driven tools monitor brand visibility, cultural traction, and perception shifts across platforms and demographics.
🔹 Smart Insight Repurposing: We turn existing research—public, proprietary, or third-party—into fresh, strategic insights without redundant effort.

At FatCat9, we believe data should be accessible, intelligent, and purpose-built to move your business forward.

Let’s connect if you’re looking to leverage data strategy, optimize content or brand performance, or simply want smarter, faster insights to lead the way.
skill_1: Data Strategy & Governance – Designing scalable frameworks for managing data assets across sources.
skill_2: Performance Optimization – Identifying key performance indicators (KPIs) and aligning them with business goals.
notable_achievements: Founder and CEO of Kavak, the first startup to achieve unicorn status in Mexico; Top agent in Keller Williams Capitol Properties for multiple years; Sales team sold over $100,000,000 in properties annually (2013-2019)
reasoning: Based on the available information, Carlos García appears to be an experienced operator with significant experience in data and analytics, having co-founded Molecula and now leading FatCat9. His 25+ years of experience and successful co-founding of Molecula, which appears to have achieved some scale before his exit, suggests L4 classification. While he has demonstrated ability to build and scale companies in the data space, there isn't clear evidence of exits above $100M or unicorn-level growth that would justify a higher classification. His current venture FatCat9 shows continued entrepreneurial activity, but is still early-stage.

name: John Leschorn
title: Co-Founder @ SUPERWISE | Leading Product
about:
True leadership transcends the day-to-day; it's about crafting a vision, committing to the journey, and inspiring an entire organization to realize that future together. My leadership philosophy is deeply rooted in these ideals, informed by continuous learning and experiences throughout my career. These experiences have taught me the profound impact of empowerment, humility, and strategic insight on driving sustainable growth and fostering a culture of innovation.

Key to this journey has been the recognition of the value in nurturing talent from within our organization. By prioritizing the development of our team, we've unlocked incredible potential, leading to innovation and a strong sense of loyalty and belonging. Each day, I strive to live by these principles, seeking not just to lead but to inspire those around me to share in our collective vision.

The lessons learned have also highlighted the importance of mentorship as a pivotal component of leadership. Implementing structured mentorship programs has enabled valuable knowledge exchange, accelerating the personal and professional growth of our emerging leaders. This approach ensures our leadership pipeline is not only robust but also aligned with our organizational values and mission.

Furthermore, the significance of aligning with the right partners and collaborators who share our vision and values cannot be overstated. Such partnerships have amplified our capacity to achieve our goals, reinforcing the idea that true progress is a collective effort. It's through this synergy that we’ve been able to navigate the complexities of the business landscape effectively.

My experiences have emphasized that leadership is about more than achieving objectives; it's about cultivating an environment where every individual feels valued and motivated to contribute to our shared goals. This commitment to developing talent and fostering a culture of continuous learning and mentorship has been invaluable.

As we move forward, the insights gained from these experiences will continue to guide our approach, ensuring that we not only meet our current objectives but also lay the foundation for long-term success. Leadership, in essence, is about building a legacy of resilience, growth, and innovation. By championing a vision, embracing the journey, and inspiring our organization, we're not just achieving milestones—we're shaping the future.

name: Patrick Blattner
title: CEO & Founder SOTEREON.AI
location: San Juan Capistrano, California, United States
about:
Patrick Blattner – CEO & Founder, Sotereon.ai

Patrick Blattner is a visionary technology leader and the driving force behind Sotereon.ai, a company pioneering agnostic LiDAR perception software that’s transforming airports, smart cities, and critical infrastructure. Under his leadership, Sotereon.ai is shaping the future of real-time spatial intelligence through its Overwatch platform—an AI-powered system that delivers unparalleled environmental awareness across large-scale environments.

Patrick's journey into innovation began at the heart of the digital media revolution. He helped drive Disney Interactive, where he bridged entertainment and emerging technology. He went on to become a key contributor to AOL's AIM (AOL Instant Messenger) during the height of its cultural impact, and later joined Napster, helping reimagine how people access and experience music globally.

An early evangelist for productivity and user experience, Patrick authored multiple best-selling books on Microsoft Excel, influencing how professionals around the world harness spreadsheet software for decision-making and analysis.

Today, his work at Sotereon.ai reflects a culmination of decades of experience at the intersection of media, software, data, and innovation—with a mission to make our most complex spaces safer, more efficient, and perceptually aware through AI and LiDAR.

Our portfolio has expanded across various sectors, including leading airports, mass transit, agriculture, and now entertainment. For the past 14 months, we have been Dell Technologies’ preferred partner and are accelerating growth through direct and Dell channels.  Our platform, execution, and accuracy has led to a prominent reputation that has transitioned the company from lead gen to intake. We believe in the adage, "He who gets wired in first wins," and we take pride in having the most US airports and large-scale deployments in the United States.  We have been quietly securing airports without PR, tradeshows or fanfare to silently take this leadership position.

reasoning: Patrick Blattner demonstrates characteristics of a Proven Operator (L4) based on his significant executive experience at notable tech companies and his current leadership of a growing AI/LiDAR company. name: Prateek Joshi
title: Moxxie Ventures | Author of 13 AI books | Infinite Curiosity Pod | Nvidia | Recovering Founder
about:
I'm an Investor at Moxxie Ventures, a seed stage VC firm focused on backing ambitious founders solving hard problems.

Ever since I came across algorithms in mathematics, I’ve been fascinated by building machines that can do tasks on their own. This led me to the field of AI. I believe AI has a central role to play in solving the world's most pressing problems.

Here are the key highlights about me:
- I've authored 13 books on Machine Learning
- I write a newsletter called Infinite Curiosity focused on the intersection of AI and startups
- I host a podcast called Infinite ML with listeners in 135+ countries
- I've been featured in Forbes, Fortune, CNBC, Bloomberg, and TechCrunch.
- I've been a speaker at conferences such as TEDx, Global Big Data Conference, Silicon Valley Deep Learning, and Machine Learning Developers Conference.

Outside of work, I enjoy creating educational content and being a sounding board to people who are in the early stages of their career. I'm an ardent sports fan and a cinephile with a penchant for Neo-Noir, Spaghetti Westerns, and Jidaigeki movies.

You can visit prateekj.com to learn more about me.

name: Matt Gunnin
title: 4x Founder (2 exits) | CEO Vertical Labs + Esports One | Founded Leaguepedia (2011) | Building the next frontier AI for Sports & Esports
about:
Based in Austin, Texas, I am a pioneering tech entrepreneur and executive, currently diving into the exciting world of artificial intelligence. My journey began in a small town where the slow pulse of dial-up internet sparked my first venture—an endeavor born out of necessity and a passion for online gaming.

As a teenager, frustrated by the limited connectivity, I embarked on a mission that would mark the start of my entrepreneurial path. I negotiated with a local ISP to run a dedicated T1 (1.5 MB/s) line more than 30 miles out to my parents’ house. This was more than just about improving my gaming experience; it was about breaking barriers and creating opportunities not just for myself but for my entire community.

To afford the $2,000/month fee, I transformed our basement into a tech hub, setting up a network of Linux & Windows servers. What started as a personal fix soon evolved into a full-fledged business, providing web hosting, game servers, and VoIP services. The company quickly scaled, hosting hundreds of servers and thousands of websites. Prior to leaving for college, I decided to sell the business. While the return was nice, the experience that tested my limits early on was worth exponentially more.

After graduating, I joined Rackspace in San Antonio, deepening my skills in cloud computing and enterprise solutions. My passion for esports then led me to create Leaguepedia, a resource for fans of League of Legends that quickly became a cornerstone of the esports community, attracting over 10 million monthly users within just six months.

Following the sale of Leaguepedia to Twitch/Curse, I continued to innovate, playing a pivotal role in building their esports division. My next venture took me to Azubu and then Unikrn, where I led significant tech and marketing overhauls, further shaping the esports landscape.

In 2017, I embarked on an ambitious journey through startup accelerators, eventually founding Esports One in Boston’s MIT PlayLabs. After relocating to Los Angeles, we developed a revolutionary Fantasy Esports platform that utilizes real-time computer vision and deep data analytics to enhance user engagement in the DFS/Gambling markets.

Now, back in Austin, I am leveraging my extensive experience to launch a new AI startup. I am dedicated to solving complex problems in the tech industry, mentoring up-and-coming entrepreneurs, and pushing the boundaries of what technology can achieve. I look forward to connecting with like-minded professionals who are driven to innovate and make a significant impact through technology.
education_1_degree: Bachelor of Engineering - BE, Computer Software Engineering
speaking_engagements: Interview on Tech Company News about Esports One and its technology; Blog post on Esports One blog discussing Web3.0 and esports innovation; Featured in podcasts discussing esports and technology entrepreneurship
reasoning: Matt Gunnin demonstrates a clear pattern of successful entrepreneurship with multiple ventures and at least two confirmed exits. His most notable achievement is founding Leaguepedia, which scaled to 10M monthly users and was acquired by Twitch/Curse. He has founded multiple companies (4x founder claim) with at least two documented exits, showing a consistent track record of building and selling companies. While impressive, the scale of these exits appears to be in the small-to-medium range rather than the massive exits required for L5+. His progression from early entrepreneurship (teenage ISP venture) to multiple successful ventures and current AI/sports technology companies shows proven operational capability and exit experience characteristic of an L4 founder.

name: Jon Herlocker
title: CEO, Founder, Engineer - making AI Process Control a reality
about:
𝗠𝗔𝗡𝗨𝗙𝗔𝗖𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗖𝗢𝗠𝗣𝗔𝗡𝗜𝗘𝗦 𝗧𝗛𝗔𝗧 𝗔𝗣𝗣𝗟𝗬 𝗔𝗜 𝗔𝗥𝗘 𝗣𝗨𝗟𝗟𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗔𝗛𝗘𝗔𝗗 𝗢𝗙 𝗧𝗛𝗘 𝗖𝗢𝗠𝗣𝗘𝗧𝗜𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡

According to McKinsey's "The State of AI in 2020" report:

15% of manufacturing companies report more than 10% increase in revenue due to application of AI

22% report decrease of costs by more than 10% due to AI. 

𝗕𝗨𝗧 𝗔𝗣𝗣𝗟𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗔𝗜 𝗜𝗡 𝗠𝗔𝗡𝗨𝗙𝗔𝗖𝗧𝗨𝗥𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗜𝗦 𝗛𝗔𝗥𝗗

There are many obstacles. 

Even if you've collected data, it's hard to know where to start.

Current AI tools require expensive and hard to find data scientists yet they don't understand the physics or practice of manufacturing.

AI needs to be trained, but rarely is there enough data about the exceptional use cases.

Every plant is a special snowflake - different configs, different sensors, different work processes, different software.

AI needs good clean data, but plant data starts out dirty (erroneous, missing, misaligned, mislabeled)

𝗧𝗜𝗚𝗡𝗜𝗦 𝗖𝗥𝗘𝗔𝗧𝗘𝗦 𝗜𝗡𝗡𝗢𝗩𝗔𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡𝗦 𝗧𝗢 𝗢𝗩𝗘𝗥𝗖𝗢𝗠𝗘 𝗔𝗜 & 𝗔𝗨𝗧𝗢𝗠𝗔𝗧𝗜𝗢𝗡 𝗢𝗕𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗖𝗟𝗘𝗦

We have a goal of making manufacturing more reliable, efficient, and autonomous.

Our  team combines physics, mechanical, chemical, electrical, and petroleum engineers with world class software and AI experts.

Our approach is to combine the best of physics/engineering understanding with the latest in data driven machine learning.

Our solutions are not incremental, they are wildly new and innovative, such as:

A new analytics language for the digital twin - the Digital Twin Query Language. 

A digital twin accelerator that takes complex physical simulations and makes them 10000x faster.

A multi-variable closed-loop controller leveraging AI/ML that continuously learns and improves with operation.

𝗪𝗛𝗢 𝗜𝗦 𝗨𝗦𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗧𝗜𝗚𝗡𝗜𝗦?

Tignis technology is applied to analyze, monitor, and optimize hundreds of plants worldwide.

The next generation of 3D semiconductor manufacturing equipment will feature Tignis controllers. 

We are working closely with semiconductor fabs. 

𝗪𝗘 𝗖𝗔𝗡 𝗛𝗘𝗟𝗣 𝗬𝗢𝗨

The space is complicated, but we have experience doing this.

We can help you identify the low-hanging fruit that will yield increased revenue and decreased cost.

We will give you the tools to reach those goals.

And we will provide you with as little or as much expert help as you want. 

Learn more at https://tignis.com.
