name: Robin Purohit
title: Software Executive/Entrepreneur
about:
My 30-year career as a executive and serial entrepreneur spanned the IT stack from chips and scale-out infrastructure to software/SaaS to data/AI at startups and iconic public companies. 

Born in Canada, I started my first software business in high school and joined Nortel Networks after graduating University of Waterloo to develop advanced semiconductors during telecom boom. I then joined my first startup in Toronto which was acquired by HP in 1995. After moving to silicon valley, I became a product management executive at two iconic public software companies, VERITAS Software and Mercury Interactive, leading growth initiatives to $1B+ annual revenue and M&A exits for $20B in total.

Re-joining HP through the Mercury acquisition, I became a GM/P&L executive first transforming an $100M Information Management business to double revenue and reach profitability in 2 years. I was then promoted to lead a $3B IT Management portfolio with 4 business units through the 2008 financial crisis to generate over $1B in annual cash flow and dramatically simplify the solution offerings, spearhead the transition to cloud computing, and a lateral expansion into the enterprise security market via the acquisitions of Arcsight and Fortify.  

Most recently, I have served as a C-suite executive/board member at PE and VC-backed startups, including a private equity turnaround at Group President at BMC's $1.3B Enterprise Software Business and early stage exit at Griddable.io (acquired by Salesforce). As advisor/investor, I have had successful exits with Moveworks (acquired by ServiceNow for $2.8B) and OpsRamp (acquired by HP Enterprise).

On hiatus from full-time work, I continue to advise investors/startups in Infrastructure Software, Enterprise AI, and Canadian tech ecosystem while tackling my personal bucket list. I am currently studying blues/jazz performance at Berklee College of Music and donor/member of Bay Area music and arts organizations.
speaking_engagements: Podcast on InfoQ; Articles on DevOps.com
notable_achievements: Led Griddable.io to successful acquisition by Salesforce.com; Co-founder and CEO of Peritus.ai, an AI recommendation engine for technical support; Senior executive roles at BMC and HP Software leading multi-billion dollar business units
reasoning: Robin Purohit demonstrates a strong track record as both an operator and entrepreneur with multiple successful exits and leadership roles at major enterprise software companies. While not quite reaching L7 (which requires multiple $100M+ exits as primary founder), he shows clear evidence of market innovation, successful exits, and leadership of billion-dollar business units. His experience spans both operational excellence at large companies (HP, VERITAS, Mercury) and entrepreneurial success with exits (Griddable.io to Salesforce, advisory roles in successful exits like Moveworks' $2.8B acquisition). His pattern of scaling businesses and driving successful exits, combined with his role in transforming major enterprise software portfolios, places him solidly at L6.

about: Marc has been a Founder and Managing Director of Okapi's associated funds since 2005 and is responsible for the funds' technology investments. He has held leadership positions of increasing responsibility in business development, legal, operations, corporate development, and strategy in the technology industry for almost two decades. Prior to founding Okapi, Marc was with Intel Corporation first as an attorney for the Microprocessor Products Group and then as the Managing Director of Strategic Business Development for the Software & Solutions Group worldwide. Prior to Intel, Marc worked for Sun Microsystems in business development and legal roles. Marc received his bachelors from the University of Southern California and went on to earn his Juris Doctor from Pepperdine University School of Law. Marc has also attended the Stanford University Graduate School of Business Executive Education program. Marc's past board affiliations include DATAllegro (acquired by MSFT) and Emulex.  Marc has been a past CEO for SecondVoice and RF Nano Corporation and President for the Orange County Venture Group.  He is a frequent panelist and/or speaker for venture capital, M&A, technology commercialization, emerging markets, and corporate development at various universities and industry events for many years.

name: Saurav Agarwal
title: Shield.AI | SIERA.AI | 2x Founder, Raised $7M | Helped win 8-figure B2B deals | Helping grow $5B Unicorn to IPO | Helping founders as I can | Angel Investor
about:
I am a seasoned VC-backed, 2x startup founder and business executive with over a decade of experience in AI, Robotics, SaaS, Mobility, Supply Chain Tech, Industrial Automation, and B2B Go To Market.

I built my first startup GuideBuddy in 2013 while starting a Ph.D. I lost 2 years and made $0 from it.

I didn’t know how to build a product that my customers really wanted. I wasted 100s of hours building the wrong features, and talking to the wrong people. Eventually, I lost 1000s of dollars of my own money.

I shut down Guidebuddy in 2015 and vowed never to make the same mistakes.

In 2017, I finished my Ph.D. and started SIERA.AI with a $50,000 grant from the US government.

I spent over 3 months just talking to 100+ customers and learning their true pain points.

What happened over the next 5 years changed my life:
- I raised ~$7M of venture capital
- Built a team of 30+ people across 2 continents
- Launched 2 successful AI and Robotics product lines to 1000+ devices
- Scaled a go-to-market program, and onboarded over 60 enterprise customers
- The largest deal we sold was worth over $300,000.

In 2022, I handed over the CEO reins of the business. 

In 2023 I joined Shield AI. First I led the software team that builds Shield's AI pilot and then in 2024 founded the customer engagement team for our Hivemind Business.

Since launching Hivemind Customer Engagement at Shield, we've helped close double digit millions in revenue in a matter of months and scaled the team to handle domestic and global sales engineering, post sales applications engineering and customer success.

Disclaimer: The views expressed here are my own (personal) and do not represent the views or opinions of any employer, past, present, or future.
speaking_engagements: Podcast episode on JustGoGrind discussing SIERA.AI and entrepreneurship; Guest on Machine Minds podcast discussing AI technology across industries
notable_achievements: Led merger of Idea Cellular Ltd with Vodafone Group Plc worth $23 billion; Advised Tata Consultancy Services IPO in 2014; Steered acquisition of Jaypee Group’s cement assets by UltraTech Cement; 3x Ironman Finisher
reasoning: Saurav Agarwal demonstrates characteristics of a proven operator with successful company building experience and significant technical expertise. He has built and scaled SIERA.AI to meaningful revenue and team size, raised substantial venture funding, and is now in a leadership role at Shield AI, a unicorn company. While he hasn't had a major exit yet, his track record shows proven ability to build and scale B2B technology companies. His combination of technical depth (PhD in AI) and business execution (raising $7M, building 30+ person team, securing 60+ enterprise customers) places him solidly at L4.

name: Devin Carty
title: Chief Executive Officer at Martin Ventures, Co-founder & Chairman at Wellvana Health, and Co-founder & Chairman at Reimagine Care
about:
I'm a scientist, founder/entrepreneur, and venture capitalist. I've worked as a biologist and biochemist with NASA, built medical clinics as a missionary in the jungles of Congo, Africa, and built healthcare companies as an entrepreneur, venture capitalist, and hospital system executive.

As CEO of Martin Ventures, a healthcare-focused venture capital firm, I lead investments and incubation of new companies. I provide oversight for 30+ portfolio companies while serving on the boards of Wellvana (Chairman), Reimagine Care (Chairman), Trilliant Health (Chairman Emeritus), Livara, Mployer, StationMD, Override, Peer Supply, Peregrine Health, and Hashed Health. My historical investments include Upfront (acquired by Health Catalyst), SubjectWell (recapitalized by Windrose), Ludi (recapitalized by GPP), Ovia (acquired by LabCorp), Contessa (acquired by Amedisys for $250 million), AmericanWell (IPO), OneDrop (recapitalized by Bayer Pharma), Valify (acquired by HCA Healthcare), Trilliant (recapitalized by Primus Capital), Jvion (acquired by JMI Equity), Healthcare Bluebook (acquired by Primus Capital), and ClockwiseMD (acquired by DocuTAP).

I also serve on several non-profit boards, including Nashville Classical Charter School, the Nashville Healthcare Council, and Mercy, a 50-hospital system.

I have co-founded several companies, including:

- Wellvana, a company serving over 1 million patients, with $13 billion of medical spend under management. 

- Reimagine Care, a company delivering oncology care virtually and in the patient’s home. 

- Trilliant Health, a data science and analytics company supporting 70+ healthcare systems to build growth strategies.

- Clariture, a digital marketing technology company focused on increasing patient acquisition.

At Cancer Treatment Centers of America, I served as EVP, Chief Talent Officer, and Chief Strategy Officer. I was part of the leadership team that improved the patient experience to an NPS score of 96 and grew revenues to over $4.6 billion. 

At Vanguard Health Systems, I was part of the senior leadership team that grew the organization to 29 hospitals, more than 46,000 employees, and over $6.5 billion in revenues. During my tenure, we completed an IPO and the company's sale to Tenet for $4.3 billion. My roles included corporate Chief Talent Officer, Chief Experience Officer, and Chief Marketing Officer.

Before Vanguard, I was a Partner at a management consulting firm, advising healthcare systems (Cleveland Clinic, etc.) on strategy, M&A, and growth. I began my career as a scientist with NASA.

name: Oren Kraus
title: Machine learning leader with experience in computer vision, biotech, and health.
about:
I'm currently an associate director of machine learning scientist at Recursion's office in Toronto focused on advancing machine learning for tech-enabled drug discovery. Previously I lead the machine learning team at ProteinQure, an innovative protein design startup in Toronto.
Prior to ProteinQure, I co-founded Phenomic AI based on my PhD research in Brendan Frey's PSI group at the University of Toronto. There, I was one of the first researchers to publish the application of deep convolutional networks (CNNs) to large scale microscopy image analysis. At Phenomic, I secured the company’s seed investment and strategic partnerships and led development of Phenomic’s deep learning based platform for analyzing biomedical images. Prior to Phenomic, I interned at Apple Inc in the Bay Area and Borealis AI in Toronto. I received my BASc and MASc in mechanical engineering at the University of Toronto.

name: Sam Cooper
title: CTO, Co-Founder, Phenomic
about:
My research focuses on developing and using advanced machine-learning tools to process high dimensional phenotypic data, with the goal of identifying and commercializing novel drug targets.  

At Phenomic, we've built one of the worlds largest scRNA datasets focused on targeting solid tumours. Leveraging this we're now identifying and pursuing a highly selective targets on the tumour stroma, the web of connective tissue that permeates cancer and is a key factor in progression. Our lead target is a previously un-drugged component of the extra-cellular matrix, that demonstrates efficacy in vivo, in human tissue samples, and we think could be game changing for a number of the most difficult cases. Together, let's bring down cancer's wall.

I completed my PhD with the department of Computational Medicine at Imperial College, with Prof. Robert Glen as well as the Dynamical Cell Systems team at the Institute of Cancer Research, supervised by Dr. Chris Bakal, focused on using computational tools for answering fundamental questions in cancer biology.

In my spare time I like the sea and snow.
experience_2_company: The Institute of Cancer Research, U. of London
speaking_engagements: Speaker at Festival of Genomics Boston 2025; Guest on Slice of Healthcare podcast; Guest on B Breakthroughs podcast; Guest on Artificial Intelligence in Drug Discovery podcast
notable_achievements: Built The Hustle into one of the fastest-growing media companies in the US with over 3.5 million daily readers; Sold The Hustle to HubSpot for tens of millions of dollars; Hosted the popular My First Million podcast
reasoning: Sam Cooper demonstrates strong technical and scientific credentials with a PhD from Imperial College London focused on computational medicine and cancer biology. As CTO and co-founder of Phenomic AI, he's leading technical development in a specialized biotech field. name: Edwin Margulies
title: Serial Entrepreneur, Strategist, Industry Cheerleader
about: Edwin Margulies has logged 45 years in high-tech solutions, specializing in contact center technologies and artificial intelligence. He has been instrumental in multiple startups, four of which were acquired by Intel, Oracle, Five9, and Nextiva. Margulies has written 20 books that explore customer experience (CX), technology, and best practice methodologies. His most recent works include “Winning the Customer Experience Race,” “Mastering the Customer Experience,” and “Social Engagement for Customer Care.”  Margulies is also an inventor, holding a dozen patents that have influenced automation systems and contact center designs for both network and enterprise applications. His focus on usability, human factors, and open architecture standards has helped establish benchmarks adopted by key organizations in the industry. During his college years, Margulies sold books door-to-door to support his tuition and living expenses. His colleagues often describe him as a “serial entrepreneur,” reflecting his ability to identify opportunities and develop innovative solutions that impact industry practices. He and his wife Gail operate a non-profit animal sanctuary in Texas.

name: Farris W.
title: Founder & Investor & Ph.D.
about:
Farris is an investor-turned entrepreneur with success in three areas: startups, venture capital and real estate.
Farris conceived of, co-founded, and served as CEO of a VC-backed fast growing company: DecorMatters. DecorMatters is building the world’s first blockchain-based creator ecosystem to reshape the trillion-dollar interior design and furniture shopping industry. By using the power of creativity and converting the stressful home renovation process into a relaxing social gaming experience, DecorMatters is re-inventing the massive industry.
With 10 million creators, 5 million free designs, 30+ national brands, and unlimited collaboration opportunities, the leading creativity platform continues its rapid growth by leveraging AR, AI and Blockchain technology in the Web3 era.

Prior to DecorMatters, Farris co-founded ZenStone Venture Capital, to bridge China capital and innovations in Silicon Valley. He invested in 40 technology companies at early stages. The entire portfolio has been valued $24+ Billion and raised $2+ Billion capital with 5 Unicorns, 1 IPO, and 10+ M&A exits with profit. Farris was named to Top 20 Best Cross-Border Venture Capitalists by both China Venture and Hurun Midas List in 2016. 

Prior to ZenStone, Farris co-founded Alpha Realty Capital (ARC), a vertically integrated firm offering commercial real estate investment and property management service to HNW families and financial institutions in China. This firm currently has more than $100M asset under management, and generates more than 8% annual cash distribution and 25% IRR to limited partners.

Prior to ARC, Farris developed the most sophisticated fast computing algorithms for solving cutting-edge physics problems. After Ph.D. graduation, he joined Applied Materials to conduct strategic project development and help executives bring strategic technology from concept to product.

Farris obtained Ph.D. from University of Texas at Austin, and B.S. and M.S. from Harbin Institute of Technology, China. He published 30+ papers in top academic journals and 8+ technology patents on fast parallel computing algorithms for large-scale engineering challenges.

notable_achievements: Co-founded Frac Tech, a pioneering hydraulic fracturing company; Sold 70% stake in Frac Tech for $3.5 billion in 2011; Significant contributions to the energy sector; Serves as a pastor at the Assembly of Yahweh 7th Day in Rising Star, Texas

name: Alok Aggarwal
title: CEO and Chief Data Scientist at Scry AI | Author of the book, "The Fourth Industrial Revolution and 100 Years of AI (1950-2050)"
about:
Dr. Alok Aggarwal received his B. Tech. from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi in 1980 and his Ph. D. in 1984 from Johns Hopkins University in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science. He worked at IBM’s T. J. Watson Research Center in New York during 1984 and 2000. During 1988-89, he took a sabbatical from IBM and to teach two courses and supervise two Ph.D. students at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). 

During 1992 and 1995, along with others, he built and sold a "Supply Chain Management Solution" for paper mills and steel mills, which was the first commercial Artificial Intelligence-based solution of its kind. In 1992, Madison Paper Company near Portland, Maine, United States, was the first to buy this solution and it used this solution until 2017 (i.e., for 25 years) until this company was sold to another company. 

During 1996-1997, Dr. Aggarwal was the director in the Strategy Department of IBM Research Division. In July 1997, IBM Research Division announced the formation of “IBM’s India Research Laboratory (IRL)”. Dr. Aggarwal “founded” IRL inside the IIT Delhi on January 1, 1998. By August 2000, he had grown it from "ground zero" to a 60-member team (with 30 PhDs and 30 Masters’ in Computer Science and related areas).  

In January 2001, he co-founded Evalueserve (www.evalueserve.com), which currently has more than 4,000 employees and which provides various kinds of research and analytics services to clients in North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. In 2003, along with his colleagues at Evalueserve, he pioneered the concept of “Knowledge Process Outsourcing (KPO)” and wrote the first article regarding KPO. 

In February 2014, Dr. Aggarwal founded Scry Analytics (now called Scry AI) that performs research and development (R&D) in Data Science and related areas. Scry AI (www.scryai.com) has four product groups that improve efficiency of business workflows regarding quality, timeliness, revenue, cost, customer experience, compliance, and operational risks. Scry AI's primary R&D center is located in San Jose, California, and three other centers are based in Gurgaon, Pune, and Hyderabad, India.  

In 2008, Dr. Aggarwal received Distinguished Alumnus Award from IIT Delhi. He has published 125 research articles, has been granted 8 patents from the US Patents and Trademark Office, and has been an editor of several academic journals in Computer Science. In December 2023, he published a book titled, “The Fourth Industrial Revolution and 100 Years of AI (1950-2050)", which is among the best seller list on Amazon.

notable_achievements: IBM Outstanding Innovation Award for 'Matrix Searching' (1989); IBM Outstanding Innovation Award for 'Complexity of Access and Transfer of Data' (1989); Pioneered the concept of Knowledge Process Outsourcing (KPO) through Evalueserve; Author of 'The Fourth Industrial Revolution and 100 Years of AI (1950–2050)'; Star Researcher Award from UPES, Dehradun (2021, 2022); Best Researcher at the Global level (date unspecified)

about:
Pioneering AI Innovation in Enterprise Software

With a Ph.D. in Applied Machine Learning from UC Berkeley and 20+ years at the intersection of AI and enterprise solutions, I've dedicated my career to transforming how businesses operate through intelligent automation. From founding FotoFlexer.com (which powered PhotoBucket and MySpace) to leading Data Science initiatives at OpenTable post-Ness Computing acquisition, I've consistently pushed the boundaries of what's possible with machine learning.

I'm fortunate to work alongside an incredible team building a groundbreaking AI platform:

- Salesbot.io - Born from our customers' needs and shaped by their feedback, we're transforming B2B sales by leveraging AI and our growing database of 680M+ contacts to help sales teams connect with the right prospects at the right time.

Connect with me to discuss AI innovation, enterprise SaaS, or scaling B2B ventures
speaking_engagements: Talent Sourcing Strategies Conference speaker; Guest on Sourcing School Podcast; Interview on SalesTechStar; Speaker on AI and Recruiting at RecruitingDaily and YouTube
notable_achievements: Co-founded FotoFlexer.com, a top app on Facebook's marketplace; Founded RecruitBot to revolutionize recruiting through machine learning and automation
reasoning: Jeremy Schiff demonstrates characteristics of a Proven Operator (L4) based on multiple factors: 1) He founded FotoFlexer which had significant traction (powering PhotoBucket and MySpace during their peak), suggesting a likely successful exit or acquisition, 2) He held a senior role at OpenTable post-acquisition of Ness Computing, indicating executive-level experience at a major tech company, 3) His PhD in Applied Machine Learning from UC Berkeley and 20+ years of experience in AI/ML shows deep technical expertise. While he has founded multiple companies, without clear exit values or funding data for FotoFlexer or concrete growth metrics for Salesbot, we cannot confidently classify him at L5 or above. However, his track record clearly exceeds early-stage (L1-L3) classifications.

As Founder and CEO of the Claim Genius Inc., Raj has been described as a “relentless and focused entrepreneur”. Raj is a Hands-on leader that can still maintain a big picture outlook, a consistent driver behind standout results. I'm obsessed with all things related to agriculture, food, nutrition, and exercise science. I'm fascinated with evidence-based and technology-powered approaches to solving massive problems in these areas.

While our food system is incredibly productive, it's also undergoing massive change to solve major challenges: food waste, the obesity epidemic, hidden hunger / widespread micronutrient deficiency, farm labor shortages, animal welfare, and many other serious issues must be solved. I'm excited to be a part of such a critical industry.

name: Marc Cohen, Ph.D.
title: Director, VP of Engineering | CTO | Product Manager | Program Manager | Research & Development | Leadership | Stakeholder Communication | Budgeting | Team Supervision | AI | Cross-Functional Collaborations | Glassblowing
about:
I’m seeking a Director, VP of Engineering, CTO, Research and Development Manager, or Product Manager role at top companies, including medical device and health technology companies, and am the perfect fit for this role because I have the following relevant skills: leadership, stakeholder communication, creative problem solving, budgeting, team supervision, cross-functional collaborations, data analytics, ML and AI.

I have also supervised and mentored cross-functional teams of 5 to 20 professionals and achieved a 40% increase in employee retention and a 20% boost in productivity.

I also have experience in stakeholder engagement and have directed the successful delivery of over 15 projects, resulting in a 35% improvement in client satisfaction scores consistently meeting time and budget constraints.

●	Cross-functional collaborator with experience improving operational efficiency by 25% through the implementation of streamlined workflows, resulting in a $500K annual cost reduction, and lead a team that increased revenue by 30%, contributing to a $2M growth in annual sales.

●	Advanced project management and team collaboration abilities to optimize development processes and deliver high-impact projects, using AI and machine learning and successfully administered a $10M budget with expenditures within 2% of forecasts, resulting in a 15% enhancement of financial predictability.

I want to serve an organization that prizes communication, clarity and equality among its employees. I’m excited to be on a team built around improvement, innovation and learning. I know I will thrive at a company where ownership is valued, as well as relationships and results. I want to be a part of an organization that infuses growth into their brand, culture and market and who I can help make a difference in the world.

mhcmos@gmail.com

name: Ankur Sudhir Gupta, M.D., M.S.
title: Co-founder & COO @ Spect Inc. | Preventing Blindness with Early Detection with Eyecare, Anywhere || Board member | Nonprofit Leader | Mentor
about:
As a co-founder of Spect Inc., Michael Leung is on a mission to prevent blindness with the early detection of eye disease and to build a platform for healthcare data analytics. Spect enables Eyecare, Anywhere, by providing end-to-end eye disease screening solutions using artificial intelligence and telemedicine. Michael has over 5 years of experience in leading and advising cross-functional teams in business development, operations, manufacturing, and strategy (legal and IP).

Michael has a strong background and expertise in medical imaging and digital health, spanning displays, optical coherence tomography, anti-reflective nano-materials, and various modes of medical imaging and nano mechanical properties. He has an MS in mechanical engineering from Stanford University (Dropped out from his Ph.D.), and a BASc in nanotechnology engineering from the University of Waterloo. He also holds multiple patents and publications in his field. Michael is passionate about solving challenging problems, creating social impact, and empowering others through innovation and education. He serves on the board of a few non-profits and mentors aspiring entrepreneurs and engineers.

name: Sudhakar Pennam

location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Ankur Jain is founder and CEO of Bilt Rewards - the first major loyalty program that allows renters to earn points on rent and build a path towards homeownership. The loyalty program was developed in partnership with an alliance of the nation's largest multifamily owner/operators, representing 2 million units across the US. Bilt has also partnered with Mastercard and Wells Fargo to issue the Bilt Mastercard - the first and only credit card that can be used to pay rent at any apartment with no fees. 

Jain is also the founder of Kairos, a venture studio building companies to tackle the world’s greatest challenges. Currently the Kairos Portfolio of brands are focused on making essential services like housing and healthcare more affordable. Over the years, Kairos has helped launch and grow over $6.5bn worth of companies tackling problems in healthcare, housing costs, transportation networks, and more. 

Before rejoining Kairos in May 2017, Jain was the VP of Product at Tinder, the world's largest social network for meeting people. He joined Tinder after it acquired his previous company, Humin, where he served as Founder & CEO.

Over the years Jain has been recognized for a variety of achievements. In 2017, he was named a Young Global Leader by the World Economic Forum. In 2011, Inc. magazine named Ankur Jain the "Best Connected 21-Year-Old in the World" and awarded Jain "30 Under 30". In 2012, Jain was named “30 under 30: Solution Broker” by the Christian Science Monitor. And in 2015, Forbes also named Jain to their “30 under 30” list. Jain also currently serves on the innovation board of the X-Prize foundation and as a member of the Pacific Council on Foreign Relations.

Jain graduated from the Wharton School of Business in May, 2011.

I'm passionate about turning complex issues into compelling stories that drive action and value.

name: Michal Alter

location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Michal Alter has been working in technology and social development for over 20 years. Combining her love for technology with her dedication to social development, she founded Visit.org to engage corporations and their employees with the world's greatest nonprofit organizations. With its proprietary content across 90+ countries, Visit.org provides HR, CSR, and ESG leaders the infrastructure and content for purpose-driven employee and customer engagement. Visit.org's corporate partners include Colgate, PayPal, Adobe, Applied Materials and others. This is Visit.org's 2nd consecutive year on the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing companies. 

As a Computer Science Engineer, Michal worked as Systems Architect at Nuance Communications (Nasdaq: NUAN), and at Risk Modules. Her passion for social development began as the Director of Refugee Affairs at the City Government in Tel Aviv, where she led social service delivery and programming to serve 20,000 refugees from Darfur, South Sudan, and Eritrea. After moving to New York, she consulted at various leading nonprofit organizations, including New York Cares, Solar One, UNESCO, and Women’s World Banking.

Michal is a founding member of WeTheChange, a group of women CEOs of Certified B Corporations working for a better earth through better business. And she is a member of International Women's Forum, a network connecting women leaders across every professional sector in support of each other and a common mission of advancing women’s leadership.

She holds a Master of Public Administration from Columbia University, a Bachelor of Arts in East Asian Studies from Tel Aviv University, and a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science from the Israel Institute of Technology (Technion). She speaks English, Spanish, and Hebrew.

name: Chao Liu
title: CTO and Co-Founder at camect.com
about:
I am a full stack software engineer. I like to solve challenging problems that people have in real world, with creative techniques / algorithms.  I believe a technique is useful iff it can help people solve a real problem. It's not important what technique it is.

I worked for 10+ different projects when I was at Google, from Web Search to Android. For one of these projects, I created an unique algorithm and related infrastructure that improved crawl / indexing quality significantly for Web Search. I left Google when I found it's difficult to focus on things I like to do.

I co-founded Camect with Arup in 2017, trying to solve a problem that we both feel annoyed: security cameras were barely usable. There are too many different brands of security cameras, each has its own app. Some of them even upload user's video to cloud. Yet none of them produce useful alerts. Tons of garbage alerts that force users to disable them. We would like to have a privacy oriented system that can manage all security cameras. Most importantly, it should generate only useful alerts! This is what Camect is about, a private, secure and open security camera service/software that produces accurate alerts. Currently, we are focusing on building a B2B business in the security monitoring space.

name: Usman Sheikh
title: Founder, CEO, Entrepreneur, AI Innovator, B2B Sales, Value-Based Selling, ABM
about:
Usman Sheikh is the visionary founder and CEO of xiQ, an award-winning B2B sales and marketing platform. With the fusion of generative AI (x GPT), behavioral science, and a curated up to the minute business corpus , xiQ is revolutionizing the industry with its groundbreaking personality-driven sales approach.

As a futurist and design thinker, Usman's goal is to humanize B2B sales and marketing by harnessing the power of generative AI and psychology. Through xiQ, sellers gain the ability to understand the mindset of prospective buyers, facilitating hyper-personalized engagement throughout the sales cycle. Usman strongly believes in achieving excellence through disciplined and relentless execution.

Prior to xiQ, Usman held various global roles at SAP, including Vice President of Corporate Development, Product Management, Sales Enablement, and Digital Commerce. He also founded and led Unit International, a business and technology consultancy based in Washington DC.

An architect by education and training, Usman has designed numerous notable buildings along the East Coast of the USA, including the first office of the International Monetary Fund in Moscow, Russia.

Usman frequently serves as a guest lecturer on AI and B2B sales and marketing at renowned business schools such as the University of Texas, University of Wisconsin, University of Alabama, Louisiana State University, and Clemson University.

A graduate of the University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Usman's passions extend beyond business. He enjoys Squash, architecture, design, cooking, and hiking.

name: Noosheen Hashemi
title: Founder & CEO, January AI
about:
Noosheen Hashemi is a tech veteran, entrepreneur, investor, and philanthropist. She is the founder and CEO of January AI, a seed-stage precision health tech company that harnesses the power of artificial intelligence to prevent, predict, postpone and manage chronic disease. January AI is Noosheen’s answer to a healthcare industry that seemed to only address decline and disease, rather than prevention and progress; January AI partners with people to understand their bodies and optimize it for health and longevity.

She guides a family office that includes diverse investments in over 100 companies and venture capital funds. Noosheen is also Co-Founder + President of the HAND Foundation, a family foundation that provides financial, advisory, and advocacy support to hundreds of organizations and dozens of scholars and social entrepreneurs dedicated to protecting the young, and promoting the socioeconomic growth and advancement of individuals.

Noosheen spent ten years at Oracle, most recently as VP of US Revenue, where she built the critical sales and administrative capacity that allowed the company to create one of the most productive salesforces in corporate history, scaling revenue from $26 million in 1985 to $3 billion in 1995.

Noosheen and January AI were honored by the World Economic Forum (WEF) on June 15, 2021 as a Technology Pioneer 2021—a cohort of 100 outstanding companies across the Globe. She is a Harold Pratt Associate at the Council on Foreign Relations and serves on the advisory boards of Stanford Graduate School of Business, Stanford Institute for Economic Policy Research, Tuft’s Friedman School of Nutrition Science and Policy, and Ploughshares Fund. The Silicon Valley Business Journal named Noosheen as one of the ‘Most Influential Women in Silicon Valley. Noosheen’s philanthropic efforts have been honored by the World Affairs Council, the Convention on the Elimination of all Forms of Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW), the Carnegie corporation Immigration Award, and Girl Scouts of America.

name: Chris Ziomek
title: CEO at Breezy Med
about:
I lead Breezy Med, a healthcare automation company on a mission to modernize hospital infection prevention through science, automation, and data. Our smart disinfection platform helps hospitals reduce healthcare-associated infections (HAIs), protect patients and staff, and cut operational costs—all with technology that’s 10x more affordable and easier to deploy than legacy UV systems.

Our flagship Breezy Blue system uses EPA-registered aerosolized hydrogen peroxide (aHP) and integrates with hospital platforms to automate and track terminal cleaning. Through our cloud dashboard, infection preventionists, EVS teams, and executives get real-time visibility and compliance insights.

I bring 30+ years of experience as a serial entrepreneur and engineer. Before Breezy Med, I founded ZTEC Instruments (acquired by Teradyne), where I later served as Senior VP and General Manager. Earlier in my career, I worked at Los Alamos National Laboratory and SLAC, building deep roots in applied science and innovation.

I’m passionate about helping hospitals improve outcomes with better tools—and making advanced technology practical for frontline healthcare teams.

name: April Chang
title: 10x10 Founder (YC Alum) | ex-VP Eng @ Eventbrite | Connect startups with game-changing builders | Hiring recruiters
about:
After managing 1,000+ engineers across startups and public companies, I realized that hiring was always my biggest challenge. This led me to go through YC and found 10x10, a recruiting platform designed to help founders hire the best talent, fast.

The best part of this journey has been meeting so many smart and ambitious founders. Your drive and vision inspire me every day as we work together to build your dream teams, scale your companies, and connect candidates to startups you might not have discovered on your own.

As I continue to learn and grow through 10x10, it’s a win-win-win for everyone—companies scale, candidates thrive, and we all progress together.

For example, we helped a YC company hire 7 engineers in 7 weeks. Through 10x10, we’re not just growing our own company; we’re enabling hundreds of others to grow as well.

If you’re looking for hiring advice, feel free to connect or follow.

name: Alex Krawchick

about:
I use data and analytics to help Go-To-Market (GTM) teams focus, optimize, and win. 

With 25 years in GTM roles, half of them as a marketer and the other half in analytics, I viscerally understand the lack of meaningful insights (frustration!) that plague GTM teams. Tech and data continue to proliferate, yet evidence-based, actionable insights continue to escape GTM professionals and teams. 

I help GTM teams find signal through the noise by successfully leveraging data that has traditionally been too siloed, buried, and opaque. I empower GTM teams with prioritized, actionable insights. 

* Know exactly which prospects and customers would benefit from your focus
* Prioritize the right activities—and deprioritize the wrong ones (attribution: solved ✔️)
* Understand customer journeys like never before 
* Model for acquisition, retention, and expansion opportunities
* Develop meaningful KPI frameworks by personae and function
* Achieve clarity and collaboration for all three legs of the revenue stool—Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success 

Become Winfluential.

name: Mike Dooley
title: Co-Founder/CEO Labrador Systems, Inc.
about:
There are only a small number of consumer robots that have ever sold over a million units.  I have helped to bring two of them into the world.  Now I am out to do the third, and to help make life better for a lot of people in the process. 

The first brand and product I managed from the start was LEGO MindStorms and the Robotics Invention System.  MindStorms brought a new kind of hands-on, minds-on learning to millions of kids, and became LEGO's best selling product of all time. 

I later joined Evolution Robotics to work on more advanced robots.  In 2010 we launched a smart self-driving "Swiffer Bot" under our own brand called "Mint."  While not as cool to a lot of kids as a LEGO robot, Mint was a truly breakthrough product, integrating mapping and navigation technologies at a level of performance and price the market had never seen.

It was so breakthrough that in 2012 iRobot, the market leader, acquired us.  Mint became Braava at iRobot, Braava became one of the best selling floor cleaners on the market after Roomba, and Roomba became a lot smarter too.   Over the last few years, I established and led iRobot's innovation lab and worked on advanced concept and technology development. 

I am now building a new startup to explore pragmatic but meaningful applications for robotics in our daily lives.

Specialties: New product development, brand management, marketing research, robotics and educational technologies.  Background in software, hardware and embedded systems.  Over 15 issued patents.
experience_2_title: Vice President, Product and Business Development
awards_and_recognitions: National Science Foundation grant for developing assistive robots; Investment from Amazon's Alexa Fund and iRobot
speaking_engagements: Speaker at Amazon re:MARS 2022; Featured speaker at Robotics Summit
notable_achievements: New York Times bestselling author; Creator of 'Notes from the Universe' with over 1,200,000 members; Featured teacher in the international phenomenon 'The Secret'; Authored 18 books published in 27 languages; Spoken in 156 cities across 42 countries on 6 continents; Emailed over 1 billion 'Notes from the Universe'
reasoning: Mike Dooley demonstrates a clear pattern of market innovation and thought leadership in consumer robotics, with multiple successful products that have achieved significant market penetration. He has been instrumental in developing three major consumer robotics products (LEGO Mindstorms, Mint/Braava, and now Labrador), with two already achieving over 1 million units in sales. name: Chris Raethke
title: Passionate about human-centered AI, transforming leadership by simplifying complexity and boosting productivity.
about:
I believe that technology, at its best, enhances our humanity. My work is driven by a singular focus: to build intelligent systems that blend seamlessly into our lives, making complex tasks simpler, faster, and more intuitive for everyone. Whether it's voice AI or sophisticated data products, I aim to design technology that acts as a natural extension of human behavior—focusing on how people think, communicate, and work.

With over 20 years of experience in building impactful technology, I've created solutions that transform everyday inefficiencies into powerful opportunities for innovation. My approach is grounded in understanding human needs first—crafting AI and machine learning tools that aren’t just smart but are deeply relatable and easy to use. By starting from the question, "What would a human do?" I ensure that technology stays in service to people, not the other way around.

As the founder of Notiv, I’ve harnessed voice AI's power to revolutionize how individuals and teams collaborate. Notiv leverages advanced DSP, STT, and NLP to deliver actionable insights from meetings, enabling smarter, more meaningful conversations that drive results across entire organizations.

Before Notiv, I co-founded Bugcrowd, where we used machine learning to enhance security through dynamic hacker classification and prioritization of vulnerability reports. Our work safeguarded some of the world’s leading companies, including Spotify, Tesla, Salesforce, and many others.

Throughout my career, I’ve been passionate about creating engaging, intuitive experiences for users—delivering results that ripple across entire organizations. I don’t just build technology; I craft human-centered solutions that empower individuals and fuel innovation at scale.

Leading with Passion and Purpose

For over 18 years, I've thrived on building high-performing teams and exceeding customer expectations. As a CEO and founder, the most rewarding aspect is the journey alongside inspiring people – colleagues who become family, and clients who become advocates.

My background is anything but conventional. From the discipline and creativity of a professional opera singer to the strategic agility honed in creative marketing, operations, and sales, I bring a multifaceted perspective to every challenge.

Beyond the Boardroom

name: Steven Wolfe Pereira
title: CEO @ Alpha • Advancing AI Governance for Board Directors
about:
Steven Wolfe Pereira founded Alpha to solve a critical problem: most boards are governing AI transformation without the frameworks, intelligence, or peer networks they need to make sound fiduciary decisions.

Alpha delivers what directors actually use: proprietary governance intelligence, executive-level AI education, and access to the most AI-experienced board members navigating similar challenges. Our clients include public and private company boards facing AI decisions that will define their competitive position and regulatory exposure for the next decade.

Wolfe Pereira brings relevant operating experience: 25+ years driving technology transformation, including $5+ billion in strategic transactions as Chief Marketing Officer at AI-first companies Datalogix (acquired by Oracle, $1.2B) and Neustar (acquired by Golden Gate Capital, $3B). His executive leadership spans Publicis Groupe, TelevisaUnivision, Quantcast, and co-founding the award-winning edtech company Encantos. He began in private equity at Blackstone Group and Salomon Smith Barney and started his technology career in 1999 joining Akamai Technologies in their network infrastructure engineering group. 

Currently serving as an independent board director at the Latino Community Foundation, Save the Children, and Whalar, Steven understands governance challenges from both an experienced operator and the boardroom perspective. Hey, I’m Robert Kirk—Founder and CEO of InterGen Data, Inc.—and I’ve got a question for you: What if you could see your financial future before it even happens?

name: Paul Allen
title: CitizenPortal.ai for transparency in government. WorkplaceAI to grow revenue and develop people. Soar AI Studio — companies to uplift humanity in all areas of life — co-founder Ancestry.com (‘97)
about:
Human beings are the greatest of all creations. You and I are blessed to be on our journey through life on this beautiful planet.

We don't get to choose everything, but we do get to choose how we will respond to everything life throws at us--or offers to us.

To maximize our time on the earth, we need to understand our identity--who we are and why we are here.

Alex Haley, author of Roots, said that in each of us there is a "deep hunger, marrow deep, to discover our heritage, to know who we are and where we came from."

We started Ancestry.com in 1996/7 so more people could discover their family stories. Much of our identity and resilience comes from deeply knowing and appreciating our ancestors--and what they did to get us here.

Another part of our individual identity is our natural talents.

Gallup invited me to evangelize the global strengths movement for nearly 5 years. I studied the teachings of Dr. Don Clifton, the father of strengths psychology and grandfather of positive psychology, and met great people who were taught and trained by him.

Today, Soar's mission is to unlock the potential of billions of human beings.

Learning—and then applying what we learn to achieve—is the key to our growth.

The TAM for global learning and training is close to a trillion dollars.

But most of it seems to be wasted. We remember a tiny fraction of what we learn. So much training is quickly forgotten or never applied.

The Soar AI Platform is changing this.

When you learn something important, you can invite our AI tool to help you apply what you learned and get feedback on your journey to mastery. 

As you pursue mastery, the Soar PRISM AI will personalized the feedback to your strengths.

Professional athletes get to watch game film with a coach to improve their performance. 

Imagine being able to design your own AI that knows you, your talents, your goals and dreams, and helps you achieve them. 

AI is being used by trillion dollar companies to get you to click, to like, to play, to watch, to scroll — endlessly and mindlessly. 

It’s time for you to take charge of your own use of AI. 

Use it as a powerful tool to help you achieve your highest aspirations.
speaking_engagements: Podcast appearance on The Pulse of AI discussing Soar and AI vision; Public discussions on AI and Soar's mission-driven entrepreneurship
notable_achievements: Co-founded Microsoft with Bill Gates; Built a net worth of approximately $20 billion; Owned major sports teams with over 1,100% returns on sports team deals; Donated over $2 billion to philanthropic causes in science, education, wildlife conservation, and the arts
reasoning: Paul Allen qualifies as an Elite Serial Entrepreneur (L7) based on his co-founding of Ancestry.com in 1997, which became a multi-billion dollar company and one of the most successful genealogy platforms globally. Ancestry.com had multiple successful exits, including a $1.6B private equity buyout in 2012 and was later acquired by Blackstone for $4.7B in 2020. His current venture, Soar.com, represents another significant entrepreneurial endeavor in the AI space. The combination of founding a unicorn company (Ancestry.com) and subsequent successful ventures places him firmly in the L7 category.

B+E holds the record for the largest commercial real estate transaction sold by a digital platform, a $324M portfolio. 

Camille is a serial entrepreneur who began coding in 7th grade and has had many successful startups, including Dyzco Technologies, which she sold to American Financial Services Corp. The proceeds from those early sales were used for her first commercial real estate investments.  Subsequently she joined Colliers International and later founded the NYC office for the Stan Johnson Company.  Building on her background in both technology and CRE, Camille then became Head of Sales for Ten-X, a Google Capital company and leading online marketplace for commercial real estate that includes products like Auction.com.  She serves as Corporate Board Member and Advisor to multiple companies, including Blace.com, Artemis Bow Real Estate, and Bones Investment Group. Camille is a 2024-2025 Director on the CREW Network Global Board.

An established industry leader, Camille makes frequent appearances as a keynote speaker for organizations such as ULI, CCIM, and CREW.  She is quoted extensively in leading publications, such as WSJ, Bloomberg, Wired, The New Yorker, and GlobeSt.com. Most recently, GlobeSt picked up her podcast, “Women in Net Lease,” which highlights the incredible women working in Net Lease and their paths to success.

Camille has closed over $30B in transaction volume, earning her the nickname “The Catalyst” from Real Estate Forum.  GlobeSt and REF have named her “Best Boss in CRE” multiple times, including 2023.  CREW NYC awarded her the “2022 Entrepreneurial Spirit Award.”  Commercial Property Executive magazine named Camille the “2022 Net Lease Executive of the Year,” via a peer vote of leading CRE executives.  CREW Global Network awarded her the "2020 Entrepreneurial Spirit Award."  CPE named Camille the “2020 Innovator of the Year” for her work across multiple CRE tech companies.

name: Paul Fiore
title: CEO / Change Agent / Operational Leader / Supply Chain Solutions / Team Builder
about:
I’m an accomplished leader who assembles high performing teams that build and enhance business performance. My experience in operating private equity portfolio companies, venture-backed startups, and global organizations has driven growth through aligning the vision and implementing operational excellence.

I’ve scaled startup ventures 0 to $50M and run divisions for organizations exceeding $250M. This experience has sharpened my ability to build from scratch while managing the complexities of large-scale operations.

I’ve launched new brands and divisions, restructured businesses, and aligned teams to deliver measurable impact. Whether as CEO of a venture-backed B2B platform or a change agent executive in a private equity environment, I tackle challenges, fostering collaboration resulting in sustainable growth.

What inspires me most is calculated collaboration—dismantling stasis and aligning teams around a shared vision. Leadership, to me, means creating a culture where people thrive, feel valued, and contribute to something greater than themselves.

Some career highlights include:
- Transforming Epallet as a venture-backed CEO, turning a traditional offline industry into a cutting-edge digital supply chain platform.
-  Reimagining the organization at Roland Foods, a privately held, sponsor backed food importer to a consultative selling culinary innovator. 
- Founding Delizia Foods to deliver end-to-end supply chain solutions for the grocery trade.
- Launching a novel, cryo-frozen whole grain category with national distribution across foodservice, grocery, and club channels.
- Building global supply chains by partnering with agricultural growers and packers, creating customer channels for major grocery, club, and distributor partners.

If you value increasing stakeholder value through continuous improvement, innovation, and having fun along the way, let’s connect. I enjoy learning and having conversations about constructive change, hard lessons learned, and ideas that challenge the status quo.

As a senior business executive with extensive global experience, I’ve led large-scale organizations, built high-growth ventures, and delivered results at the intersection of technology, finance, and payments—around the world.

I also oversaw the global rollout of a next-generation international money transfer platform spanning 200 countries and 140 currencies.

At Citi, I co-founded Citi Enterprise Payments and helped define the bank’s digital strategy at a global level. I led the U.S. launch of Google Wallet (now Google Pay), and built Citi Commerce Services—a cross-border payments platform adopted by some of the world’s most iconic brands.

I bring a combination of strategic insight and operational experience—leading businesses at scale while navigating the complexities of global markets and emerging technologies. I focus on building high-performing teams, delivering measurable outcomes, and advancing innovation in ways that serve real business and customer needs.

name: Martin Cordsmeier
title: Practicing Utopian | Founder @ millionways | Emotional Intelligence, AI
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
I never understood myself — and assumed I was the only one.
Turns out, most people feel the same. They just got better at hiding it.

That’s how millionways started.
Not as a company. As a question:
What would the world look like if people actually understood themselves — and acted accordingly?

Since moving to the US from Germany, we’ve been building the technology to make that possible.
A unique combination of AI and science — emotionally intelligent, grounded in proprietary research of a decade, and built to reflect who people really are beneath roles, labels, and noise.

Today, we’re working with partners in HR, hiring, and mental health.
Because when people understand themselves, companies work better, care gets real, and potential stops being a buzzword.

I’m not building software.
I’m building the missing layer between humans and everything they interact with. Especially themselves.

I also write and speak about a future where people stop performing and start becoming.
Where society isn’t something we survive — but something that actually helps us grow.
Not as a utopia. As a real, structural shift:
A world built around inner drive, not outer metrics.

That’s the vision behind millionways —
and the reason I won’t shut up about it.
speaking_engagements: Guest on AI For All Podcast discussing emotionally-intelligent AI and AI ethics; Guest on IoT For All Podcast discussing generative AI and AI ethics; Interview at The ON_Discourse AI Transformation Summit
notable_achievements: Co-founder and CEO of millionways, an emotionally intelligent AI platform for psychological profiling and matchmaking; Published a book on mental health focusing on understanding unconscious traits and patterns

Max is a self-taught full-stack engineer and product builder who thrives on turning complexity into clarity.

He’s not just a coder — he’s a product-driven problem solver who knows how to bring ideas to life across business and tech.

name: Barbara Sharp
title: Tech Entrepreneur I Cyber Crisis Response Software I Reputation & Stakeholder Strategy Expert
about:
As a seasoned corporate affairs and crisis communication strategist, I've dedicated my career to navigating the complex landscape of reputation management in the digital age.  

My journey has taken me from the jungles of Papua New Guinea to the more staid boardrooms of multinational corporations in New York, always with a focus on empowering leaders to navigate stakeholder challenges and reach robust, mutually beneficial outcomes. 

My crisis management experience began with leading the communication response to what was described as "Australia's first terrorist attack" - the bombing of the National Crime Authority's Adelaide office. This baptism by fire shaped my approach to handling high-stakes situations across the APAC region.  

One of my proudest achievements was orchestrating a fair compensation agreement for 95,000 Papua New Guinean villagers affected by the Ok Tedi mine, delivering $400M in sustainable development funds and transforming a "pariah" into a model for responsible operations. 

Leveraging my expertise and advances in AI, I co-founded Plaetos, and an early LLM engine for workforce listening, PlaetosEQ. 

Now, as a second-time entrepreneur, I'm building Ready4Crisis, with cybersecurity attack first cab off the rank. My mission is to make it a no-brainer for CXOs and boards of mid-sized companies to include reputation risk managemenet in their cyber crisis response.

Throughout my career, I've remained committed to one core principle: making it easier for leaders to lead well in the face of human complexity and highly consequential digital-age challenges.
notable_achievements: Fellow of FSA Scot; Dame Commander of the Supreme Military Order of the Knights Templar of Jerusalem; Over 30 years of service in Clan Campbell Society NA; Award-winning artist and MFA graduate

By 18, we had created a standout success, with one of our games reaching 150,000 concurrent players on launch day. The company, along with all its games and intellectual property, was eventually acquired by a private equity firm in the gaming industry—an exciting milestone that marked the beginning of my entrepreneurial journey.

Today, I’m honored to have co-founded Ceebig with its visionary creator, Haoran Shi, building it into a global powerhouse dedicated to driving innovation and growth. At Ceebig, we bridge the gap between vision and execution, empowering businesses to scale through strategic software, groundbreaking automation, and expert consulting. With successes like delivering 30x ROI for clients such as SIERA USA, our mission is clear: to be the trusted partner businesses need to thrive in an ever-evolving world of technology.

I am passionate about the future and always looking to collaborate on the next great venture. Let’s connect and bridge that gap.
reasoning: The founder shows early entrepreneurial success with Misfit Pixels at a young age (founded at 16) and achieved a notable exit, though scale and terms are unspecified. name: Alexander C. Kagen, MD
title: Site Chair of Diagnostic, Molecular and Interventional Radiology, Mount Sinai West & Mount Sinai Morningside
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Dr. Kagen is the Site Chair of Diagnostic, Molecular and Interventional Radiology at Mount Sinai West and Mount Sinai Morningside Hospitals since 2015. He also is the past Co-Founder and Chief Medical Officer of Nines, an artificial intelligence powered radiology-as-a-service solution.

Dr. Alexander Kagen is a recognized authority in the field of Body MRI and has been named as one of New York’s Top Doctors every year since 2019 by New York Magazine. He serves on local, national and international committees and has lectured both nationally and internationally on imaging of liver disease, prostate, gastrointestinal and pancreaticobiliary MRI.

Dr. Kagen has multiple peer-reviewed publications and has research interests in MR angiography for perforator flap reconstruction mapping and vascularized lymph node transfer assessment.

He served as Chair of the Radiology-Pathology working group of the American College of Radiology (ACR) Liver Imaging and Reporting Database System (LI-RADS), and is a member of the ACR Magnetic Resonance Prostate Imaging and Reporting Database System (MR-PI-RADS) Committee.

Dr. Kagen received his medical degree from the College of Medicine at SUNY Downstate Medical Center where he also completed his residency, after a medicine internship at Lenox Hill Hospital. He completed a clinical fellowship in Body MRI at Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore.

name: David Stavens
title: Co-Founder: Nines, Udacity, Stanford Self-Driving Cars
about:
I build world class technology that improves human lives.

I was the co-founder and CEO of Nines, the first-of-its-kind teleradiology practice.  Our radiologists and engineers built world-class tools in-house to enable the best radiologists to deliver the best patient care.  We built multiple FDA-approved AI and ML medical devices, one the first of its kind, and served 400,000 patients per year on an annualized basis at leading centers like UPMC and Yale.  We were backed by Accel, 8VC, Josh Fink, Kim Hammonds, Lori and Brian Goler, and Mark Leslie.

Previously, I was the founding CEO of Udacity, empowering students with more educational choice.  Udacity is worth $1 billion and CNBC named Udacity the #8 most disruptive private tech company.  We are backed by CRV, Andreessen Horowitz, Drive Capital, Bertelsmann, and Steve Blank.

Previously, I co-founded Stanford University's self-driving car team.  Our robot won the $2 million grand prize in the DARPA Grand Challenge race and is now in the Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum.  This became Google's autonomous car project, Waymo.

I am proud to be an advisor to Future Family, a revolutionary company that has raised over $100 million to enable more reproductive choice for women.

name: Elisabeth DeMarse
title: CEO, Independent Director and Investor
about:
Elisabeth DeMarse is an American CEO and Independent Director. Most recently, she served as President and CEO and chairman of the Board of TheStreet, Inc. (NASDAQ: TST). DeMarse notably diversified The Street from a B2C ad supported retail stock picking business to B2B global M&A, data and news businesses. Euromoney acquired the division for a MOM of 3.4 in 3 years.  Prior, Elisabeth was CEO and president of CreditCards.com, which she created by consolidating numerous assets around the world, selling the company to Bankrate in 2010 for $145M. Previously, DeMarse transformed iLife.com into Bankrate, engineering the turnaround of the company, driving exponential growth and creating $450 million in shareholder value. DeMarse spent a decade as Chief Marketing Officer for Bloomberg LP working directly for the founder, Michael Bloomberg, where she was instrumental in the formation of several media properties. Awards include: Working Mother of the Year, Folio’s Top Women in Media, Dealmaker of the Year, Most Intriguing Person in Media, Girls Scouts Woman of the Year, NOW Woman of Power and Influence, Fast Company 50, Inc. 500 and ACG Award for Outstanding Corporate Growth.Her Glassdoor CEO ranking is 100% and her companies have been voted best Media Company to work for.

Ms. DeMarse is an experienced NACD certified director. She is a member of the Board for Kubient, a technology platform that powers the sale and purchase of programmatic advertising. Previous Board service includes: ZipRealty (ZIPR), InsWeb Corp  (INSW), Internet Patents Corporation (INTP), Edgar-Online (EDGR), Heska Corporation (HSKA), Incredimail (MAIL), Stockgroup (SWB); LiveDeal (LIVE); YP.com (YP), Nedsense (NEDSE), All Star Directories and ProNoun. She has been placed on several boards to assist in executing on strategic options, including sales of the companies.

A member of The Committee of 200, DeMarse is a graduate of Harvard Business School and Wellesley College.
speaking_engagements: Board member of Kubient Inc.; Board member of Collective Audience, Inc.; Former CEO and President of TheStreet.com; Former Chief Marketing Officer at Bloomberg; Board member of multiple public companies including Edgar Online, YP Corporation, InsWeb Corporation, Heska Corporation, Internet Patents Corporation, Incredimail.com, and Stockgroup
notable_achievements: Former Chairwoman, CEO, and President of TheStreet.com, leading turnaround and growth; Moved Bankrate stock from near extinction to over $50 a share; Transformed iLife.com into Bankrate, engineering company turnaround and growth; Instrumental in formation of several media properties at Bloomberg as Chief Marketing Officer; Built a new video product and studio at TheStreet.com leading to improved financial results
reasoning: Elisabeth DeMarse demonstrates a clear pattern of building and selling multiple successful companies with significant exits and value creation. She has led multiple companies to successful exits over $100M, transformed major digital businesses, and created substantial shareholder value across different ventures. Her track record shows consistent ability to scale and exit companies, particularly in the digital media and financial information space. The combination of the CreditCards.com exit ($145M), Bankrate transformation ($450M shareholder value), and TheStreet's successful pivot and sale to Euromoney positions her firmly as an elite serial entrepreneur.

name: Maggie Brown
title: Senior scientist, previous co-founder
about:
I am a passionate researcher that focuses on the chemical processes upon which biology stands. Early on, I began training in synthetic organic chemistry at UIUC. I then met "biology" (!!!!) joining the research lab of Professor Michelle Chang at UC Berkeley as her first class of PhD students. There, I focused on elucidating the mechanisms by which bacteria break down and consume the plant aromatic polymer, lignin. I gained extensive experience in molecular biology and protein chemistry performing a wide range of protein purifications, assays, and analytics. I learned how to think about host requirements (cofactors, cell machinery, growth conditions) for successful protein production as well as how to perform many different methods of protein purifications and analyze them for “success”. I had to become proficient in: strain engineering design and performance, heterologous expression, non-model genomic and transcriptomic library preps, HPLC, GC-MS, spectrochemical and LC biochemical assays, anaerobic glove box usage, biosafety cabinet usage, protein purifications of tagged and untagged proteins, protein crystallography, chemical synthesis, non-model bacterial growth, and much more. For good or bad, Michelle turned me into a "jack of all trades".

I then joined the lab of Jay Keasling at LBNL as a postdoc bioengineering bacteria to consume the carbonaceous component of the chemical warfare agent, sarin. This was a great time for me to develop a deep, fundamental grasp of metabolism that has deepened my foundation as a microbiological analytical scientist while honing my techniques in metabolic engineering, protein production, and protein purifications (including multi-subunit purifications). 

For the last 7 years, I have run the strain analytics group at the company I co-founded in 2017, MicroByre. At MicroByre, Sarah Richardson and I built a company of 29 dedicated employees where we isolated and engineered non-model bacteria to convert various industrial wastestreams into industrially-relevant products. We were mining the capabilities of biology!  Setting up and running MicroByre as well as the strain analytics team within it meant I had to constantly ask what we needed to know, how we would experimentally answer the question, and what was defined as success for that question. Due to the shaky funding environment, we were unable to continue MicroByre; however, as a series A company, we had established and were making progress on 5 joint development agreements and 3 proof-of-concept projects. I am extremely proud of our team and our efforts!
experience_2_company: Lawrence Berkeley National Lab-Joint BioEnergy Institute
experience_3_company: Introductory College Level Experience in Microbiology (iCLEM) Program at JBEI
speaking_engagements: Co-founder and founding scientist of MicroByre, featured in interviews and company profiles
notable_achievements: Founder of Maggie Louise Confections with an estimated net worth of $550 million
reasoning: Maggie Brown demonstrates strong technical expertise and research background with significant experience in biotech, including co-founding a Series A company that reached 29 employees. While MicroByre ultimately faced funding challenges, she shows the hallmarks of a technical veteran with deep domain expertise, successful team leadership, and proven ability to scale a technical organization to meaningful size. Her PhD from Berkeley, postdoc work at LBNL, and 7 years as co-founder/technical leader align with L3 classification as a Technical and Management Veteran. name: Alexandre de Vigan
title: Powering AI to help it understand and interact with the real world | Physical AI & 3D datasets for retail, robotics, gaming, creative & beyond | Founder @Nfinite
about:
I started my career in law, specialising in mergers and acquisitions. It was fast-paced, intellectually demanding and gave me a deep understanding of how businesses grow, restructure, and navigate risk. But over time, I realised I was more drawn to building something of my own than advising others on how to do it.

The turning point came while renovating my flat in Paris. I was frustrated by how difficult it was to visualise furniture and décor in context, and I couldn’t believe that in an age of digital everything, product visuals were still stuck in static photos. That frustration sparked an idea.

Today, I’m the Founder and CEO of Nfinite, a company that’s redefining the way brands create and scale product visuals. Our platform blends 3D technology with AI to replace traditional photoshoots with infinitely adaptable, photorealistic content. Whether it’s a new sofa, a pair of trainers or a seasonal product line, our clients can bring it to life online in any setting, from any angle, with zero logistics.

As a result, we’ve built one of the world’s largest libraries of high-quality 3D datasets. These datasets can enable the training of AI to not only see but deeply understand the physical world through spatial awareness and object relationships. This is what I call Physical AI - an essential leap forward in creating machines that learn and interact with the real world. 

It’s been a journey of resilience, from bootstrapping the early days to partnering with a number of the world's biggest brands and retailers. Along the way, I’ve learned that the future of commerce is immersive and the future of AI is physical. I’m passionate about building the tools that empower bright minds to dream bigger and move faster.

name: Sarah Stern
title: Founder at Cultivate - On a mission to hire, train, and retain the very best talent in the social impact space.
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Sarah founded Cultivate -- a career development hub that hires, trains and retains diverse talent in mission-driven organizations.

Since Cultivate launched in 2019, we’ve served more than 300 organizations to recruit and train diverse talent, recruiting more than 17,000 candidates, and placing more than 300 candidates in full-time roles in the social impact sector.

Prior to founding Cultivate, Sarah was the managing director at ACRONYM, where she specialized in organizational development and operations. Throughout her career, she has focused squarely on scaling startup teams that seek to achieve impact in the political space.

At Everytown for Gun Safety, Sarah scaled a nationwide network of distributed volunteers and managed digital campaigns for 15 states.

At Purpose, she specialized in digital strategy, mass mobilization on social media, storytelling, and analytics. During her tenure, she focused on building two major incubations for testing new models of organizing: the Climate Lab and ACLU Action. 

At the League of Young Voters, Sarah led digital communications strategy and product development. She developed a passion for product development through building TheBallot.org (social voter guide tool), and working closely to optimize TurboVote (an online voter registration product). Along with her team, she leveraged SMS, livestreams, and celebrity engagement to mobilize non-college youth to disrupt urban gun violence and halt voter suppression tactics. 

Before relocating to New York City, she worked for one of the most innovative youth engagement programs in the country, mobilizing young people to vote with New Era Colorado. In partnership with the Sierra Club, she led voter registration efforts for the Denver-Boulder area, resulting in more than 10,000 voter registrations during the 2010 midterm elections. In addition to her electoral work, she also played a role in passing Colorado's online voter registration law, and used her background in journalism to co-create an online community of young bloggers dedicated to using humor to encourage engagement in local politics. 

Sarah is a Colorado native with deep roots in Texas, and holds degrees in both journalism and political science from the University of Colorado. When she's not working, she enjoys spending time outside, voraciously reading, and talking about space exploration.

name: Pedro Alves
title: A.I. + Bitcoin + Hedge Fund = financial success
about:
First and foremost I am known for my immense passion for data science, machine learning, and AI. My experience in these fields range from academia, startups, my own Machine Learning Platform startup Ople.ai, and now running multiple Data Science teams at Microsoft. I have been lucky to have worked with genomic, healthcare, social media, fashion, images, text, sports, manufacturing among other data sets; as well as leveraging restricted boltzmann machines, ensembles, anomaly detection, deep learning, auto-encoders and various unsupervised and semi-supervised models over the years in my work experiences.
In building research teams and innovations in AI, including deep learning and computer vision, I have always loved research and advancing the field.  The only thing that surpasses that love is the desire for business results.
I believe AI can be an enormously beneficial tool for all businesses, and when employed correctly can return multiple orders of magnitude of its investment. AI and machine learning are tools to be leveraged by enterprises; I understand and have a deep appreciation for the fact that enabling and empowering organizations to appropriately leverage these tools is many times the most challenging barrier to success. I pride myself on my ability to make the complex simple, turning raw data into insight and working with customers to help them trust and know how to use those insights. I have experience in bringing AI into a company, growing the team and practice within an organization, and running teams. I have always enjoyed educating people of all backgrounds about the benefits of AI and AI itself. My experiences as a CEO have helped me learn a lot about all the aspects of a business outside the technical area since founding and growing a startup.
Through presenting at conferences and teaching (at universities and data science academies), my passion and knowledge of AI resonated with enough people that Ople.ai had over 30,000 applicants for our positions. One of the things I have prided myself on has been the quality of people hired and on creating an environment where team members can grow, contribute, and feel the same passion and drive as the leadership. Creating an environment where people not only respect their leaders but also feel comfortable disagreeing with them, and where leaders lead by example, not just words. These characteristics allow for the best outcomes to be achieved. I am passionate about AI's transformational power and implementing it throughout an entire organization.

name: Nick Gardner
title: PK-12 Social Enterprise
location: New York, New York, United States

name: Allen Boone
title: CEO at Simetric, Inc.
about:
The First IoT Connectivity Lifecycle Management Platform.

Device connectivity management has become a critical part of managing large scale cellular-connected IOT networks. As these deployments scale into the millions of devices, traditional platforms were designed with a traditional mobile audience in mind and not addressing IoT-scale, global deployments and dynamic life-cycle management.

Aggregating billions of records across global operators into one common symmetric layer enables insights from Simetric’s command center where you can act real-time and at scale.  Detect rogue device behavior, automate actions in line with business policy, ensure no billing surprises, create custom ‘watch lists’ to group assets for specific analysis, leverage statistical data mining tools to create advanced reports across devices, service, usage and operator data.

name: Berk Ozer
title: 2x Founder | YC Alum (S21) | Head of Product & Deal Flow @ Orange DAO  | AI & Crypto Builder
about:
DM me on Twitter @berkozero if you'd like to connect. I’m not very active on LinkedIn.

I’m a 2x founder and YC alum (S21), investor, advisor, former management consultant and software developer with a track record of building startups to reach PMF, scale GTM, and raise capital.

----

I currently lead product and deal flow at Orange DAO, the largest founder community in crypto. I’ve reviewed 8,000+ early-stage startups, managed investment decisions for 100+ teams, and advised them hands-on as a Group Partner during our 12-week program. My guidance across PMF, GTM, and fundraising has helped these teams raise over $100M in follow-on capital.

I also lead product at Launchcaster.xyz (acquired by Orange DAO), used by 15,000+ founders to validate MVPs and attract early users. I’ve built and operated full-funnel growth systems including drip campaigns, referral programs, and investor outreach that consistently drive high-quality deal flow.

Before Orange DAO, I co-founded SenpAI.GG (YC S21), an AI gaming coach for PC players. I scaled it from concept on paper to 500K+ MAUs and 1.5M monthly organic visits. My first product, FashionI, was featured by Apple within days of launch.

Earlier in my career, I was a management consultant at Deloitte Digital, advising Fortune 500 clients on digital strategy and supporting decisions exceeding $10M. I hold an MSc and BSc in Electrical Engineering and began my career as a software developer.
