name: Adrien Schmidt
title: AI Product Manager & Team Leader
about:
I’m an AI Product Manager and tech entrepreneur specializing in using cutting-edge AI technologies to create amazing product experiences. Over my career, I’ve built and scaled innovative AI-driven solutions that bridge big data and user-friendly interfaces.

AI Products I’ve Worked On:
	•	Aristotle (Bouquet.ai): A conversational AI platform that replaced traditional dashboards with a chatbot answering complex data questions using natural language processing (NLP). Piloted with Fortune 500 companies, it demonstrated the power of AI to simplify data exploration.
	•	The Looking Glass (Cartier): A luxury augmented reality jewelry try-on device powered by custom generative AI (GAN) models. Developed as Product Manager for Cartier’s Retail Innovation Lab, I led it from research to boutique roll-out.
	•	ROZZ: My latest venture, leveraging large language models (LLMs) to transform static websites into dynamic, AI-powered chatbots that enhance user engagement and accessibility.

Before my AI-focused ventures, I founded Squid Solutions, a Big Data analytics engine that processed SQL queries directly in databases. Serving global clients like eBay and telcos, our technology has stood the test of time and remains in use more than a decade later.

From NLP to GANs to LLMs, I’ve consistently leveraged AI to turn complex technologies into seamless, impactful product experiences for users worldwide.

name: Mark Bjornsgaard
title: Born at 330ppm
about:
Mark is the founder and CEO of System Two Group, a venture capital firm that invests in, and partners with, leading corporations and entrepreneurs across Europe and the US.

Mark has grown numerous businesses from scratch to scale, with seven exits so far. He has raised funding for over 10 businesses in various sectors, including health care, technology, and energy.

name: Noor Akbari
title: Entrepreneur
about:
Co-founder of Rosalyn.ai, I'm on a mission to reshape academic integrity and democratize education globally.

In Taliban-ruled Afghanistan, my mother gifted me one of the few computers in existence. Though she couldn't read, she envisioned a future empowered by technology and set me on its path. Using that computer, I founded Afghanistan's first digital printing shop, pushing Microsoft PowerPoint to its limits to produce magazines and newspapers at unprecedented speeds. 

This was the pivotal moment, the first step of many, on my journey from a modest home in Afghanistan to the cutting-edge world of artificial intelligence. 

After navigating the complex terrains of war as a translator and advisor for the U.S. military, I relocated to the U.S. and continued my entrepreneurial journey. My vision was simple: leveraging artificial intelligence to transcend traditional methods of assessment 

his led me to Martin Jakobsson, a luminary in machine learning, and together we ignited Rosalyn.ai. Our ambition? Revolutionize exams with authenticity and scale.

My journey speaks of resilience, the magic of tech, and unwavering belief in vision. Passionate about education and technology, I'm eager to share and inspire.

Ready to reimagine academic integrity with AI? Reach out!
speaking_engagements: Featured in interviews and articles discussing AI in education and academic integrity; Public speaker on democratizing education through technology
notable_achievements: Co-founder and CEO of Rosalyn.ai, an AI proctoring company used by Coursera and the Department of Defense; Founded Afghanistan's first digital printing company; Built a product to democratize education and ensure academic integrity in online exams
reasoning: Noor Akbari demonstrates significant technical and management experience with a unique background combining entrepreneurial ventures and strategic roles. Dr. Daniel Rollings Karlin, MD, MA is the Chief Medical Officer at MindMed (Mind Medicine Inc). He is board-certified in Psychiatry, Addiction Medicine, and Clinical Informatics. Previously, he was the Co-founder and the CEO of HealthMode, a company that developed digital measurement technology for medicine and clinical trials, which was acquired by MindMed. He was previously the Head of Clinical, Informatics, and Regulatory Strategy for Digital Medicine at Pfizer, having passed through several roles on the way to this position including Senior Director, Quantitative Medicine, Group Lead for Human Biology and Medical Informatics with Pfizer's Neuroscience Research Unit in Cambridge, MA. 

He is an Assistant Professor at Tufts University School of Medicine in Boston and had been the Director of Psychiatry Informatics, and the Associate Training Director for Psychiatry.  He was the Co-Founder and former Chief Medical Officer of Column Health, an addiction treatment startup. 

Dr. Karlin trained in Psychiatry at Tufts Medical Center, attended medical school at the University of Colorado School of Medicine, and graduate school for Clinical Informatics and Cognitive Science as well as undergraduate studies in Neuroscience and Behavior at Columbia University.

name: Adam Boaz Becker
title: Building HeadOn - AI for Israel-Palestine. Coming soon...
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
I'm a tech entrepreneur and I spent the last decade founding companies that drive societal change. 

I am now building HeadOn, a startup still in stealth mode...

I was most recently building Telepath, the world's most developer-friendly machine learning platform. Throughout my previous projects, I had learned that building machine learning powered applications is hard - especially hard when you don't have a background in data science. I believe that this is choking innovation, especially in industries that can't support large data teams.

For example, I previously co-founded Call Time AI, where we used Artificial Intelligence to assemble and study the largest database of political contributions. The company powered progressive campaigns from school board to the Presidency. As of October, 2020, we helped Democrats raise tens of millions of dollars. In April of 2021, we sold Call Time to Political Data Inc.. Our success, in large part, is due to our ability to productionize machine learning.

I believe that knowledge is unbounded, and that everything that is not forbidden by laws of nature is achievable, given the right knowledge. This holds immense promise for the future of intelligence and therefore for the future of well-being. I believe that the process of mining knowledge should be done honestly and responsibly, and that wielding it should be done with care. I co-founded Telepath to give more tools to more people to access more knowledge.

I'm fascinated by the relationship between technology, science and history. I graduated from UC Berkeley with degrees in Astrophysics and Classics and have published several papers on those topics. I was previously a researcher at the Getty Villa where I wrote about Ancient Greek math and at the Weizmann Institute, where I researched supernovae.

I currently live in New York City. I enjoy advising startups, thinking about how they can make for an excellent vehicle for addressing the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, and hearing from random folks who stumble on my LinkedIn profile. Reach out, friend!
education_2_degree: Bachelor's degree, Classical and Ancient Studies
speaking_engagements: Podcast episode on how data is changing fundraising; Interview on using AI to heal a broken world

PERSONAL COACHING

COACHING FOR LEADERS
For Leaders that extends to the systems you are part of - community, workplace, corporation. What is wanting to emerge and what is in the way. 

COACHING FOR CHANGE AGENTS
For leaders and others wanting to rise to the challenge of these tumultuous times by aiding a positive transformation to a more authentic and integrated world, I’m offering coaching that creates space for aligning your self-growth with your intention and mission.

name: Peter J. Gruber
title: Surgical Director, Children's Heart Center; Vice Chair and Professor of Surgery, Yale University School of Medicine
about:
Peter J Gruber is a congenital heart surgeon, scientist, and inventor.  He completed his undergraduate training at the University of Pennsylvania followed by an M.D., Ph.D. at Penn. He pursued clinical training at the University of Pennsylvania, Johns Hopkins Hospital, and the Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia (CHOP). He held the position of Assistant Professor at Penn and was a staff surgeon at CHOP. He joined the Primary Children’s Medical Center as the Jensen Presidential Chair, and Chief of the Section of Pediatric Cardiothoracic Surgery. Dr. Gruber then moved to the University of Iowa as the Ehrenhaft Professor of Cardiothoracic Surgery, Chairman of the Department of Cardiothoracic Surgery, and co-Director of the Abboud Cardiovascular Research Center. He is currently Vice Chair of Research and Professor of Surgery at Yale University School of Medicine. He is the Surgical Director of the Children's Heart Center at Yale New Haven Hospital. His clinical interests revolve around complex congenital cardiac repairs, mechanical support, and transplantation. He is best known for his clinical care of complex neonates and mechanical support with an overall survival of >98% and for the highest complexity surgical cases >91%.

His scientific work in human congenital heart disease, particularly investigations in the molecular basis of defects of cardiac morphogenesis are current topics of investigation in his NIH-funded laboratory. Dr. Gruber’s honors include election to the Alpha Omega Alpha Honor Society, the American Society for Clinical Investigation, and American Surgical Association.

Dr. Gruber is co-founder of Brogent International, LLC and holds IP for epigenetic treatments for ischemic injury.

name: Stephen Gruber
title: Head of Model Risk and Governance
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
I am currently the Head of Model Risk and Governance at Fortitude Re and part of the  ERM team. As such I am Fortitude-Re’s Model Risk Officer and run the Model Governance Committee. The role focuses on model risk management, model validation, management reporting, and documentation practices.   This would include numerous financial framework such as BMA SBA/EBS, GAAP LDTI, Stat, Economic Value, and Capital Management. 

Additionally, my team and I are involved in the review process for new business deals and reinsurance transactions.  I am also involved in assumptions setting review as part of Fortitude-Re’s Assumptions and Judgement Committee. 

Prior to joining Fortitude Re, I worked for twenty years at Equitable (and its prior parent AXA), in numerous roles of increasing responsibility including head of variable annuity pricing and modeling, lead actuary for annuity inforce management, and head of annuity experience and analytics. In my final role, my responsibilities included leadership of the assumptions and experience studies of all product lines along with actuarial governance (assumptions and models). In addition, I worked on a number of reinsurance deals for Equitable including ceding a significant GMXB block to Venerable and ceding part of the Fixed Annuity block to Global Atlantic.  Prior to working at Equitable I worked as a consultant with Milliman for 5 years with diverse assignments in life and annuity products, including M&A deals and Demutualizations. 

I am highly committed to the actuarial profession and am involved in several SOA / LIMRA task forces that contributes to changes in liability behavior and mortality in the industry.

name: Neno Duplan
title: Founder and CEO at Locus Technologies
about:
As founder and CEO of Locus Technologies, I have spent my career combining my understanding of environmental science with a vision of how to gather, aggregate, organize and analyze EHS and water quality information to help organizations better manage their ESG scores. The result: Locus is now the leading provider of SaaS ESG, EH&S, water, and sustainability software, and outpaces its competitors in the full gamut of SaaS compliance applications.

Locus evolved from my work as a research associate at Carnegie Mellon in the 1980s, where I developed the first prototype system for environmental information management. This early work led to the development of numerous databases at some of the nation’s largest environmental sites, and ultimately, to the formation of Locus in 1997.

Under my leadership, Locus developed the world’s first commercial SaaS EH&S and water quality management system. Our software has been ahead of the curve in helping organizations in not only managing their EH&S compliance, water, and sustainability but also turning their data into a competitive advantage in their operating models and ESG scoring.

The work we do at Locus has evolved over time to encompass more and more aspects of business’ strategic planning. While a key incentive to using Locus SaaS is regulatory compliance, my team and I have taken a wider view of the mandate to improve environmental stewardship by creating systems to improve EHS+S performance across our clients’ organizational silos; regulatory programs; emission sources; energy management; all aspects of  EHS and risk, ESG reporting, and technology platforms and mobile devices. We unify EHS Compliance and ESG reporting in a single Locus Platform.

We solve our customer’s complex information management challenges for environmental, sustainability, water, and energy data using cloud technologies. We turn environmental Big Data into actionable, real-time information. Most importantly, we help our clients lower operating costs and reduce risk.

Specialties: Multi-tenant SaaS for EHS and water quality management.

name: Tom Chiarella
title: Founder at Level Up Live | Technological Innovation
about:
I am a business builder with extensive experience in the high-technology industry spanning Internet of Things (IoT), sensors, artificial intelligence, media, and enterprise software.  I’ve directly worked for/with some of the most advanced and innovative companies in the world including Disney, Microsoft, GE and HBO.  I've also been involved with eight venture-backed startups as founder, investor, advisor and/or Board member, six of which had exits to publicly traded companies.

Over the last three years, I’ve been involved in a project that brings together my love of high-tech with my passion for shooting sports.  Ever since I joined my university's international skeet team many, many years ago, I've had amazing experiences competing with men and women from all walks of life and from many countries around the world. It has been my dream to share that fun and camaraderie with others. I have imagined a place where shooting sports are accessible to everyone in a completely new format.  A place where the focus is sports and entertainment with live timing and scoring, leader boards and games designed for everyone from first timers to Olympic champions.  That place is called Level Up Live. 

In addition to amazing mechatronics technology - over 100 patents / inventions – we've developed a core philosophy of social responsibility with respect to firearms.  Our guests will find no human shaped targets, silhouettes or zombies at Level Up Live, nor will they find guns and ammo for sale.  Rather, we hope they will find a modern, sophisticated, safe, inclusive and welcoming experience that is best shared with friends, family and coworkers time and time again.

My entire adult life has prepared me to make Level up Live the next big thing in technology-enabled sports and entertainment.

name: Vivek Gupta
title: Founder & CEO at Indus AI
about:
Vivek Gupta is an AI entrepreneur, engineering leader, and innovator with over 14 years of experience in building scalable technology solutions across industries like finance, streaming, food, travel, and real estate. He is the Founder & CEO of Indus AI, a pioneering company focused on developing personalized and secure Large Language Models (LLMs) that enable businesses to integrate AI efficiently while ensuring data privacy And AI Voice agents for Enterprises.

Prior to Indus AI, Vivek held leadership roles at Wissen Technology, Hubilo Technologies, Jubilant FoodWorks (Domino’s Pizza), and Go-MMT Group, where he spearheaded AI-driven innovations, optimized engineering processes, and led high-performing teams. An expert in AI integration, cloud solutions, and scalable architectures, he has significantly contributed to reducing operational costs and improving business efficiency through cutting-edge AI applications.

Vivek holds an MBA in Technology Management from IIT Delhi and a B.Tech in Computer Science from Jaypee Institute of Information Technology. name: Dan Savage
title: CEO at MachineTrader.io
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Dan is the CEO of MachineTrader.io, an exciting new equity and crypto trading platform designed to serve the needs of serious traders who want to automate trading ideas, but who lack the full stack programming skills to build their own platforms. ‍MachineTrader™ was built using a visual-programming, flow-based development tool, which allows users to program without typing a language.  The JavaScript code is written automatically as you drag and drop the various nodes available in the palette. 

MachineTrader™ is an outgrowth of the technologies developed at  Predictive Trading Systems (PTS), a which focused on developing and deploying low-code/no-code software technologies for algorithm-based automated trading. 

Prior to PTS, Dan founded Resolute Digital, a ground-breaking digital marketing agency that had 50 employees and $30MM in annual revenue at the time of its sale to Weber-Shandwick. Earlier in his career, he led the team developed the first automated system for buying Google AdWords and was a pioneer of using technology to purchase online advertising. 

Dan also has deep experience in digital strategy and digital marketing and his technical skills include more than fifteen years of writing LAMP stack programs including Javascript, php, MySQL, BigQUERY, PERL, and Python. Dan is a lifelong entrepreneur and classically trained musician with a track record of starting and growing successful companies and building outstanding teams.

I also enjoy teaching, mentoring, and inspiring. Contact me on LI (if you're dedicated).

* A problem that others told you is unsolvable.

* An uncontrollable urge to become a product manager.

name: Simon Arkell
title: 2X Olympian and Cancer Research Entrepreneur
about:
Experienced AI software company founder with a focus on cancer research. Co-founder of venture backed companies Deep Lens, Predixion Software and Versifi, which together raised over $100M in venture backing. All were acquired. 

My latest company, Ryght, is a venture-backed, generative AI company for the biopharma industry to help biopharma and CROs accelerate drug development by accessing a real time, global network of AI connected research sites across all indications and geographies.  

I came to the US in 1986 from Australia on a pole vaulting scholarship to compete in the NCAA and try to crack the nut on Australian Olympic Team selection. Later became the first pole vaulter to represent Australia in 16 years when I was selected for the 1992 Barcelona Olympic Games. Represented Australia at 3 World Championships, 2 Commonwealth Games, 2 World Cups, and 2 Olympic Games. Proud member of the Halls of Fame for Athletics South Australia and the University of New Mexico (USA). 

Philanthropist and volunteer for "Megan's Wings" which assists the families of children diagnosed with cancer in their most difficult times. 

I am also the founder of "Olympians in Business" on LinkedIn which sports almost 2,000 Olympians from all sports with the goal of helping athletes transition from sports to the "real world" of business and career.

Advisory board positions at Cal Poly, San Luis Obispo include the President's Council, the Noyce School of Applied Computing, The Center for Innovation and Entrepreneurship (CIE), Track and Field, and the Dean's Advisory Council for the Orfalea School of Business (emeritus). 

Also board member of Ryght and Uneeq (NZ), and LP in 4 venture funds; Sierra Ventures, Central Coast Ventures, Tamarind Hill Fund and Virtue Ventures.

Enjoy bringing energy and information into your body to serve using all of your senses and neural networks, as you architect a life that only you can imagine.

His work has taken him into globally recognized companies, embassies, enterprise leadership roles, startups, and not for profit organizations. He combines education with real world experience, and the result is insights into individuals and organizations that lead to tailored, long lasting solutions. 

He will ask: 
1. Can you name a decision that doesn't involve an emotion? 
2. Where did you get training on making better decisions? 
3. And where did you learn how to accurately identify, manage, and express emotions, especially when making big decisions? 

Bryan works with schools, philanthropic groups, 12 step groups, suicide prevention, couples, individuals, families, and other organizations who want to benefit from new perspectives, heightened awareness, refined control of desires, and solidly build core, personal foundations that lead to breaking out of old patterns, stopping unwanted habits, and transform false beliefs into trustworthy foundations.

name: Sarah Ansari
title: CEO at Artizara.com
about:
I’m an unremarkable woman but a believer in big dreams.  I founded Artizara in 2002, a pioneer in the online modest fashion and lifestyle space. Veteran tastemakers, we are now setting our sights to grow into a global Islamic art and culture inspired lifestyle brand.

I’ve been sewing since I was eight. A love passed on to me through my mom, who taught me how to make clothes piece by piece. She also taught me to have pride in being my authentic self.

And that’s what Artizara is about: building a world where all people hold their heads high and celebrate their identity. Fashion is more than a choice in clothing. Fashion is a lifestyle.

“Let the beauty of what you love be what you do,” said Rumi. 
So, here I am, doing what I love. And every single day, I wake up excited and grateful for this opportunity.

name: Lio Slama
title: Serial Entrepreneur
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
🥷🏻 I help people escape the Matrix.
_________

🚀 Entrepreneur and artist from France / CEO and co-founder of AskNeo.io / CEO of AskNeo Media / Founder of the Neo Club / Creator of Studio ARY.
_________

🙆🏻‍♂️ Lio is considered a pioneer on non-linear design, mental mapping, and work culture. He recognizes the importance of design and storytelling to help others build their narrative and succeed. Whether it’s emerging founders, veteran entrepreneurs, artists or athletes, Lio understands the power of personal brands to empower everyone at a company. He is an active mentor and advisor in more than 100 companies, and a prolific artist with more than 300 artworks.

Lio is an entrepreneur at heart, building bridges and bringing people together. Today, he helps early and growth-stage startups translate their vision into reality through growth hacking at AskNeo Media.

He is the founder of the Neo Club, a network of founders and investors meeting once a month on the most exclusive rooftops in New York. The Neo Club invests in early-stage startups.

Lio is also the founder of Studio ARY, focusing on art, design and architecture. He is part of the rebirth of the abstract expressionist painting movement in New York, and one of the pioneers of the marbling painting technique. He is an adept of data mining and mental mapping to tell a story through design.

Lio holds two Masters Degrees from Columbia University (GSAPP) and the Lyon School of Architecture (ENSAL), and is an alum of the Techstars NYC accelerator. He serves as a mentor at the Columbia Startup Lab (CSL), Almaworks, and as a judge for the Columbia Venture Competition (CVC). He serves on the board of the French American Chamber of Commerce Los Angeles (FACCLA), and is an active member of the American Israeli Political Affair Committee (Aipac).

Before starting his entrepreneur journey, Lio became one of the youngest project managers in the world at 25 as the new Head Architect for the International Labor Organization in Switzerland, a $300M renovation project.

Lio is based in New York and spends several months each year in Spain, France, and Israel.

name: Dan Savage

location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Dan is the CEO of MachineTrader.io, an exciting new equity and crypto trading platform designed to serve the needs of serious traders who want to automate trading ideas, but who lack the full stack programming skills to build their own platforms. ‍MachineTrader™ was built using a visual-programming, flow-based development tool, which allows users to program without typing a language.  The JavaScript code is written automatically as you drag and drop the various nodes available in the palette. 

MachineTrader™ is an outgrowth of the technologies developed at  Predictive Trading Systems (PTS), a which focused on developing and deploying low-code/no-code software technologies for algorithm-based automated trading. 

Prior to PTS, Dan founded Resolute Digital, a ground-breaking digital marketing agency that had 50 employees and $30MM in annual revenue at the time of its sale to Weber-Shandwick. Earlier in his career, he led the team developed the first automated system for buying Google AdWords and was a pioneer of using technology to purchase online advertising. 

Dan also has deep experience in digital strategy and digital marketing and his technical skills include more than fifteen years of writing LAMP stack programs including Javascript, php, MySQL, BigQUERY, PERL, and Python. Dan is a lifelong entrepreneur and classically trained musician with a track record of starting and growing successful companies and building outstanding teams.

about:
Hi I'm Kate. I make dynamic, entertaining, surprising, creative work and I love bringing art into business and being on the business side of art. Often, I will make you laugh, without even mentioning cats riding vacuums on the internet. I'm a creative writer/thinker specializing in brand voice, story, positioning, re-brands, messaging, reaching diverse audiences, and optimizing a company's storytelling overall.  

I also work as a TV Producer and creator of innovative live experiences. Because of my background in activism and entertainment, I am a frequent speaker at colleges, conferences, and panels on: Asian America, Comedy, Women in the Media,  and queer events that don't necessarily, but often involve disco balls. 

I graduated from the Drama Division of the Juilliard School in New York, where I won the Interarts Award for producing interdisciplinary work. I also hold an honors degree in creative writing from the University of Melbourne, Australia. I am a well-known New York actor-writer whose comedy shows have been featured in Time Magazine, Backstage Magazine, NOW Magazine, The San Francisco Guardian, and The Globe and Mail. I have been invited twice to The Smithsonian Institute and taped for Comedy Central. As a theater actor, I am what you call "Famous in New York". (Also the name of a show I produce).

I was the Creator/Executive Producer of groundbreaking TV competition shows: "Dance Your Ass Off" for NBC Universal (format sold to 9 countries); "Cache Craze" for YTV/ Disney XD, for which I also created an award-winning online game and AR app.;  "Tour Dates" for E! in both the 1hr and half hour formats. My stunt/comedy hit "Gonzo Girlz" delivered monster numbers for RIPE TV, Sprint +  Adelphia Time Warner at the dawn of streaming.  My comedy has been seen internationally on Comedy Central, Showtime, NBC, PBS, CTV, City TV, Vh1, and theaters/clubs worldwide. I currently serve as Creative Director for the Over The Rhine International Film Festival- the nation's only diversity film festival hosted by the disability community.

As a brand writer and strategist, I worked for Omnicom's Siegel + Gale as a Senior Writer in their Brand Voice division,  synthesizing strategic insights into actionable communication drivers and brand attributes.  Before my agency work, I worked freelance on naming, creative copywriting, and communications strategy for The Whitney Museum, Soho House, McKinsey, The City of Raleigh, Toronto Board of Trade, the City of Niagara, and more.

name: Marc Boiron
title: Chief Executive Officer
about:
I am Chief Executive Officer at Polygon Labs where I oversee all aspects of the organization. Before being named CEO, I was the Chief Legal Officer at Polygon Labs. 

Prior to joining Polygon Labs, I was Chief Legal Officer at dYdX Trading Inc., where I handled all legal matters.

Prior to joining dYdX, I was a partner in the blockchain and cryptocurrency and financial services groups of Manatt, Phelps & Phillips, LLP. My practice focused on blockchain and digital assets, and my clients operate businesses across a broad range of industries that use innovative technologies to disrupt traditional businesses. I also advised venture funds making investments in blockchain companies and digital assets.

Prior to joining Manatt, I founded and led a blockchain-focused practice at a large California-based law firm, where I built a practice advising companies on a breadth of issues involving digital assets, including token distributions, fund portfolio investments, exchanges, custody and mining. I also advised early-stage companies on traditional financings and crowdfunding.

I am a frequent speaker on issues relating to blockchain technology, mainly educating on blockchain technology and cryptocurrency regulations. I have also served as an adjunct professor of law at the Chapman University Dale E. Fowler School of Law, where I taught foundational transactional skills.

I am always seeking to learn from and collaborate with other experts and stakeholders in the renewable energy sector, and to explore new opportunities and possibilities for the future of energy.
